My children like this and all the rest of Ms Harper's works. Is clever just the province of adults? How about catchy? The songs are wonderful little stories that children get caught up in, and the melodies are very hummable. I like em too.
This CD took me back many years to such a wonderful voice and great songs.
Once again Viva Quetzal has put together an album that grabs you and does  not let you go!  The latin and funk rhythms are awsome.  Can't wait for the  next album!!!
summary: A Explosion of Latino-Andean-Funk! A MUST for ANY collection

reviewText: Viva Quetzal's music beckons the core of all human existence.  The  high-energy, Afro-Andean World-Beat rythms contained on Hijos del Sol will  drive you dance.  The complicated, multi-layered combination of intriguing  rythms will force you to listen with intensity.  Viva Quetzal's amazing  sound will lift your spirits and tranfuse the mystical essence of the  Andeas into your being.  I've witnessed them performing live and Viva  Quetzal strongly appeals to individuals of all ages (children & adults)  and all ethnicities.  I personally own all three CDs and you should  consider owning them too!  Don't miss out on their fabulous fusion of  sounds!

How do they do it? These guys create ageless, heartbreaking sounds - bamboo, wood, and leather noises-- surging up from a deep dark forgotten place; a place of ancient, crumbling stone, a place filled with steaming primeval equatorian jungle sighs and moans, animal cries -- and then weave the coolest, most avant-garde textures, rhythms, and texts into it...simultaneously, seamlessly, consistently. An impossible feat, a rare delight. Where have these guys been? Where did they come from?
Great CD of early Lou Christie recordings. Particular favorites are Two Faces Have I, How Many Teardrops, The rare B side You And I, When You Dance, and You May Be Holding My Baby.
summary: Great two Albums On One CD !

reviewText: When Lou Christie was making this music in 1963, nobody cared about making great albums. The hit single on AM radio was the measure of success. So this CD has a few hits and a lot of forgettable stuff to fill out albums.The presentation is done impeccably. The album artwork, liner notes, etc. are outstanding.One of the tag suggestions Amazon gives you is "bubblegum". This music came before bubblegum, though.
When you need to hear Sherry or Big Girls Don't Cry, this is the CD to get. Love it !

I love this album of songs. Only thing is I can only hear from one ear so the songs don't really sound the way I remember them. I think it is different sound in each ear bud that I use so I have to change. For instance some times it seems the music drowns out the singing and some times the singing drowns out the music. But that is the way headphones are made. You hear sounds in one ear and a different sound in the other ear. But I have been listening to this album of songs ever since I got it and it brought back a lot of my teen memories. I'm a senior now and I put this on my Zune so I can walk around doing house work and the like while listening to it, with just one ear bud in my ear but have to take out my hearing aids to listen to it. LOL!
summary: Lou Christie was my teen idol!

reviewText: I have loved this collection since I first heard a track at a Barnes & Noble store. This music has moved me in the wee hours of the morning, in the dark with headphones. It has helped me on long, and short, drives up and down the American West Coast.My very favorite track is 12 "The Maidenhair Tree". "Feast of Secrets", on the other hand, has provided the dreamiest sound scape for my mind to wander about.Highly recommended.

Un primer tema realmente precioso por su grandiosidad, Secret Call, donde las armonías vocales se fusionan con la música ¿Son voces? ¿Son sintetizadores?Música electrónica de toque new age, con buen gusto, previa a la degeneración que llegaría con el sonido tecno "enlatado"
I'm not sure I'm capable of a music review, but I like this in the car on commutes, it's different, it seems Eastern, but the band's really from Germany I think.  Good stuff.

Ginkgo Garden is the name of the musical project of the German composer and musician Eddy F. Mueller. Ginkgo stand for the hommage to ginkgo biloba, a tree, the oldest plant of Planet Earth. Ginkgo Garden is also named "living fossil" It is a unique phenomenon in the plant world and myths as well as tales have been created about it, inspiring Eddy F. Mueller to use the theme ginkgo for his music."Garden" stands for a musical garden in which Eddy has planted his complex instrumental titles to let them flourish in a symbiotic way and in order to sensitize the listener's senses. At the same time Eddy has adopted William Shakespeare's motto: " I want to touch the people's hearts".The first Ginkgo Garden album was entitled "Leaves of Hope (1993) and a year after the release of the first album Eddy could not put down his thoughts of the fascinating theme of Ginkgo and its varied symbolism. It was not to be long until Eddy continued working on Ginkgo Garden, which had been intended to be a one-CD project only at the beginning. Inspired by a "Secret Call" Eddy F. Mueller wrote new instrumental titles and tried to do even more musical justice to the "wonder tree" Ginkgo as a symbol of the uniting of opposites (East/West; day/night; black/white; loud/low); nevertheless Eddy F. Mueller did not neglect the entertaining aspect of music.
summary: New Age" or "New Instrumental" or "World Music" can only partly describe this music

reviewText: I've been a Del Suggs fan since I moved to Tallahassee in 1983.  After 20 years, his music continues to be invigorating and thought-provoking.  I was lucky enough to "work" with him once many years ago (a little favor for a beloved-occasionally-bizarre County Commissioner), and I have never forgotten the thrill of performing with this consummate professional and very nice man.  So, why did it take me so long to buy one of his albums?  Don't know, but I'm glad I did.  "Floating on the Surface" (1993) is a great mix of the saltwater originals we've come to expect from Del, traditional favorites reinterpreted, and a couple of surprises.  The album starts off with "Boundless," with its wonderfully upbeat philosophy we could all stand to adopt.  "Standing in the Rain" is a song that has sounded different to me each time I've listened to it; there's a lot going on there, musically and morally.  "The Water is Wide" is a long-time favorite of mine, which Del has kept interesting without sacrificing respect to tradition.  I had to listen to "Billy" a couple of times before I got it.  Is it a story of love, loyalty, betrayal, injustice, personal integrity, or cosmic indifference?  The answer is "yes."  I really enjoy this CD.  However, I must admit that "Talk is Cheap" is not a favorite of mine.  I think the irony being expressed sort of slips over the line into bitterness, and the lyrics lack the introspective quality that is present in the other songs on the album.  (On the other hand, I've only listened to it three or four times-and always sober.)  I have ordered two more CDs by Del Suggs, "Living Deliberately" and "Wooden Boat," which I look forward to playing.

Someday I'm going to have to go to Kayes and hear the music on the streets.  If Kar Kar's music is any indication, I'll be in for a good time.  I thought I'd heard all the deepest blues till I heard Kar Kar.  His guitar playing makes us realize that the people didn't start playing the blues on plantations in the American south, they started back on the savannas of Mali and continue from the streets of Bamako to Paris, and right here in California.  By the way, if you ever get a chance to see Kar Kar play take it.  I saw him in Berkeley and I'm still wondering how he gets all those notes out of his guitar.

1. Build a Time Machine.2. Set it for New York City; 1972, and hit the "Launch" button.3. Call every single top Jazz & Rock Studio Session Musician working in New York, that you can think of.4. OH  - Don't forget to also call the world's most underrated Folk-Rock  Singer-Songwriter, 'Nick Holmes.'5. Send them up all together on the  same bus to the town of Woodstock, in upstate New York.6. Make sure that  they are all thoroughly wasted for the next three days.7. Roll  Tape.8. Bring the finished masters back with you in your time machine,  to the Year 2000.9. Buy some Altec-Lansing "Voice of the  Theater" Loudspeakers; Crank your Stereo up to 'Eleven,'  and invite  all of your esoteric friends over to your house for a New Year's Eve Party,  this December 31st, 2000.10. Lead off with the track "Battle  Royal" and end up with "Auld Lang Syne!" at Twelve Midnight,  on the dot.
summary: Ten Steps to Best Bring in 2001, This New Years's Eve...

reviewText: KarKar from 1992 finds Traore in great voice in an upbeat recording of excellent production quality. His jazzy, bluesy guitar work is wonderful. The mix of western and Malian is evident. And it's as good as Toure or Boucoum.
Anant Jesse is one of the most beautiful souls on the planet, and as such has created a most beautiful expression of purity and love through his music.
summary: Anant Jesse is one of the most beautiful souls on the planet

reviewText: Mantrica (2001) is perhaps the most exciting, rock-oriented Sanskrit chanting album available.  Using a mixture of traditional and modern instrumentation, along with hauntingly powerful chanting, this disc has a full sound and is inspired through and through.  The chants are traditional Shiva chants which are souped up.  A volume 2 would be welcome.
I think this rap gruop is very original with their music. For spanish speakers, the lyrics are pretty funny. The music is also different from all the rest common sounding groups.

I have not had a cd grow on me quite like this one in a long time.  Great vedic chanting/mantras, with a western groove to it. It all works out so well.  Good strong vocals with good pronounciation of all the sanskrit words, great percussion, and you just want to listen to it a little more each time you hear it.  The cd ends with a resonating insturmental, that chills you out, and puts you in a great state of mind.  I looked for more material by this artist, and found none. I can only hope he comes out with more music like this. Its exactly what Id been looking for, and if I were an artist, this is much what my music would sound like. I love it.  5 stars plus!!
summary: Great vedic chanting with a groove

reviewText: I love this album!  It invigorating and contemplative at the same time.  Anyone who loves mantras will love this music.  Just my opinion :)
This album truly touches the heart of men and women.  Bishop Patterson's annointed voice of God left me believing I was truly, Just Right For A Miracle!
summary: Be Healed, Be Delivered, And Be Set Free!

reviewText: This is simply put an amazing cd. I was turned on to this cd from a friend, and in turn I have purchased 3 for other friends. One friend loves playing it while giving massages to his clients!It journeys through meditative grooves and trancends the listener through the ancient and beautiful language of Sanskrit. A far more groovy album than one expects from "spiritual music."

As a recording engineer/producer, I have a fair amount of experience working with "X meets West" music (i.e. toured with Sandip Burman's 'East Meets Jazz', and recorded/produced many "World" music performers.)I recently returned from a one month trip to India where I bought music in droves.  I heard nothing like Mantrica while there.  I purchased it just a couple of days ago here in the States.  It is trance inducing and dance inducing at the same time!  I have found it quite addictive.It builds to a middle rhythmic climax with 'Maha Mrtyunjaya Mantra', which smokes.  This piece would not be out of place in any dance club that plays trance or house, nor on any late night rock show on FM.  It then spools back down, finally arriving at 'Savasana', which translated apparently means Supreme Stillness.  Indeed.  This mededtative drone piece induces altered states of deep relaxation, but not no much so that you pass out while driving ;-)  The entire CD could be used as meditation music though.AJ uses many authentic Indian instruments and as stated above speaks Sanskrit for lyrics.  You don't have to understand Sanskrit to feel the energy provided by the songs.  I give this CD 5 stars because the East/West blend is so good that it provides access to Indian music for many people who may have pooh-poohed it had they not heard how much it ROCKS!Excellent.  I can't take it out of my player!
summary: Flowing and Rockin' and very addictive

reviewText: i was never a fan of anant jesse's previous band, the alt-pop group dramarama. so when i first heard this album, i was surprised at how much i liked it.the five 8- to 13-minute long tracks consist of a gleeful romp through 60s psychedelia with moments of peter gabriel, george harrison, and deep forest tossed in. however, anant jesse does use many authentic indian instruments on the album.unlike other sanskrit chant or "kirtan" cds, anant jesse doesn't play it serious. he goes right for the groove. if you're a 60s- or kirtan-purist, you probably won't like this album. on the other hand, if you're willing to toss your preconceptions to the wind and dance, this album is a lot of fun.it definitely makes the chants accessible to a younger, more modern audience, who would probably just dance to it without any idea they were listening to sanskrit.anant jesse chants the sanskrit verses in an ultra-reverb enhanced drone for a george harrison "within you/without you" (on the sargent pepper album) effect. unlike the wispy gossamer of that beatles' song, however, the vocals here feel muscular, sinuous, and sensual, serving to underscore the dance grooves. maybe the sanskrit pronunciation isn't perfect, but the steady rhythm of the voice weaves in and out of the music in a pleasing way.my only criticism is aimed at the liner notes. while they do give the english transliteration of the chants, the very poetic interpretations of them may confuse people as to their meaning. i wish anant jesse had given a "plainer english" translation of the chants as well as his literary ones.i find doing yoga to this music completely effortless. i highly recommend it for a vigorous, flowing yoga practice. actually i find it's pretty good to listen to on headphones at work as well.if you *were* a fan of dramarama, you might like to buy this album just for a stroll down memory lane. however, it's much different than the kind of music they were playing in the late 80s and early 90s.

I enjoyed most of this set and so glad its finally available after hearing about it for decades BUT where in hell is Mike Mainieri? As leader of White Elephant I would have thought his vibes would be prominent but I actually heard no evidence of him at all. Now that's just sad. Still, i am very glad I got this as t musicians on the tracks are just great---so cool to hear guys like Gadd and Levin way back in their careers.
summary: Very cool music of a powerful time--but where's Mike Mainieri??

reviewText: This CD is an ecstatic glorious combination of East mysticism and Western vibes.  The distinct unique sound of Indian instruments weaved with Western guitar and rock sound makes me want to get up and dance, shout with pure joy, every time I play this CD, which is everyday.I am also a belly dancer and have created dance routines just for this CD.  Everywhere I have played Anant's music people have fallen in love with this extraordinary sound.  I played this for a Hindu friend of mine and he immediately fell into the rhythm and mood this CD invokes and bought CD's for his family.I cannot say enough about this Anant Jesse's music, it is exuberant, delightful, dynamic, eclectic.  Highly recommended.  I hope that Anant is soon back in the studio, I am waiting.
Exceptional album - very unique. The right blend of chant (vedic?), middle/far-eastern instrumentals, & underground beats. Entrancing...I'm hoping this artist will release a part 2 someday.

This disc is just sooooo funky. Who'd have thought that Germany could give us such a great rap group? Excellent cuts and scratches like the good old days of rap. The only reason this disc gets 4 not 5 stars, is that I have no idea whether the lyrics are any good! Try it, you just might like it! (It's great if only to hear Darth Vader sampled in German!)
This cd is a classic, a jump blues cd for swing dancers and rockabilly nuts alike.  Great hard rockin' feet stompin' finger poppin' picnicing and Sumemr BBQ-ing fun!!!  AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!
summary: The bEST of all newer swingin' jump blues bands

reviewText: If you are a real swing heperoo, then this is teh cd for you!  If your an ickeroo then this in't for you.  If you dig the lindy hop you need to buy this now at a shop.  This is like the wildest swingining heppest cd around.  Flattop gonna make a sound, that's goona drive yo' feets do the dancing beats.  Man get yo' zuit suit and pleats and come on let's swing with Flattop!!!  This cd is the heppest man!!!
summary: Man, just dig that jive, it's just too hep for words

reviewText: When I get a Swing or Jump Blues album I am looking for dancing songs.  This CD is loaded with a fine array of different tempo songs that will get  you tapping your feet and jumping out on the floor with your partner.  The  male and the female vocals are great. Sound quality on my copy is good.

I saw Flattop Tom at the La Pente High School(in Southern California). Flattop is local here so he plays all over the San Gabriel Valley areas.  Flattop is a high energy perfomer with a distinctive and appeling voice, the growls and is somewhat rockabilly-ish.  This cd features LA's top blues and jazzmen, and is a tight swing band, that plays blues, just as well as swing.  The band swings HARD, and is one of the finest swing/jump blues bands in Los Angeles.  This band is not only for lindy hoppers, but they often are featured at blues festivals.  This cd is one of the most energetic and fun swing cd's and it's perfect for dancing.  FUN!!!
summary: One of the best jump blues swing cd's out there!!!

reviewText: I teach yoga and my students seem to like this album as much as I.  Meditative and flowing.

I received this cd for Christmas, and I absolutely love it. In fact, it has been playing most of the time since I got it! It creates a very soothing and relaxing atmosphere without being monotonous. I have different meditation cd's, but I have never heard spiritual sounds being used in such a creative and diverse way. Each track has a unique style. Wai Lana and Siddha both have very soft and touching voices that are also at times incredibly powerful. I find this cd has a deep, positive effect on my mood and attitude. I just ordered their other cd, Yoga-Music of the Heart, and can't wait to receive it. I hope it's asgreat as this one.
summary: The best gift I've received in years...

reviewText: Was hoping it would be more like kirtan and less like background massage music.  Probably give it to the resale shop
summary: Not what I had hoped for

reviewText: I listen to all sorts of music... grunge, ska, pop, rock, you name it and I got it.  However, I have this new CD that I recently added to my collection... Wai Lana Yoga... it's really far out.  It has all these little  instruments playing and the voicing... wow... knocks me off my feet every time  I listen to it!  I just go nuts... it's like you can actually feel it in your  bones or something... I don't know... that's how I feel.  It's like... different  world.  It's awesome!
summary: Knocks me off my feet every time ...

reviewText: Yoga Sound is the most wonderful surprise I could have ever hoped for. It is so soothing and relaxing - I find I can listen to it all day long and never grow tired of it. As a result, I gave it to several of my friends as a gift and they absolutely love it. One friend is a yoga teacher and another a massage therapist - they told me their students and clients really enjoy it and always comment on how nice it makes them feel. I highly recommend this cd to anyone who is looking to calm their mind from the daily stresses of everyday life.

I do not know how or why several of the reviewers did not like this cd. I guess to each their own... I admit that I was skeptical about purchasing this soundtrack because of those reviews and the select pieces on amazons music player. The preview tracks here on amazon do not do this cd justice. It is VERY beautiful. It is VERY peaceful and has a wonderful tranquilizing effect. It sends you off on a happy journey within you, within your space, so no matter where you are in this world, this cd and her others will surely put your mind, body and soul to ease and at rest. If you practice Wai Lan's Yoga Videos, as I do, you will surely enjoy the music as it compliments her tone of voice, the scenery and the movements. There is some talking throughout several of the songs on the disc but they are so gentle they flow right along with the music. This is more than New Age music as it incorporates beats from all type of music: ie. Rock; Jazz; Rhythm; New Age; etc. If you are a die hard Wai Lana fan as I am, at the end of one of her videos, there is even a carribean beat, which I am sad to say is not on any of her cds. Well, here's hoping for the next one....Enjoy.

I had a cassette of Wai Lana's Yoga Sound way back in the late '90's, and then upgraded to a CD in the 2000's. I lost my CD some time ago and kind of forgot about it for a few years. One day I had a deep longing / insatiable craving to hear "Lionheart" (my favorite track) again, and was delighted to find I could buy the mp3 files of Yoga Sound here. So beautiful, I don't know how I lived without it for those years!

I saw Wai Lana on a PBS show for kids and Yoga where I got just a tidbit of  her beautiful music, but enough to want to hear more. I came here to amazon.com and listened to every music sample on this CD- it hooked me! I was going to review this CD right off the samples, but thought I had better get the CD first in the remote chance that it was just too good to be true and there might be some less than desirable cuts- like so many other albums that are fluffed and salted with ho-hum fillers.I needn't have worried about hearing the whole album before reviewing it. It is a soothing, beautiful, lofty,  fine mix of several music genres, i.e., Oriental, Indian, Western light rock  with some light vocals and nature sounds included here and there. Pardon this perhaps cliche' or cheeky comment, but it truly is uplifting, "feel-good" stuff!As another reviewer intimated, it is not repetitive and linear like many other meditative music albums. Rather, it structurally, yet gently moves around while retaining the connective thread of gentle, flowing, and harmonic sound.Undecided? Just try the sample cuts available here and then check out all the other 5-star reviews- I concur with them and since I usually only post reviews on what I consider are 5-star offerings, this is worth sharing . Thank you, Wai Lana and Sidha!
summary: Eclectic Mix of Soothing, Harmonious Music!

reviewText: I'm so glad I got this CD as a gift.  I work at home on my computer for hours and hours, and this is the only CD that I can listen to non stop for a long time.  It's relaxing, and also refreshing for the mind.  Every track  has a  different style.  Congratulations to the artists for a one of a kind  album.  I really like it and I'm looking forward to other albums from them.

I have owned this cd for about 3 years now, and looking for more items by Wai Lana & Gold Moon productions, the fancy comes upon me to review it...Whilst encapsulating all the best aspects of oriental and eastern music with none of the boring repetition which can so often predominate the meditation mixes of this kind of album.Never intrusive, it's great thinking music, like the serene ocean - wonderfully restive & deliciously refreshing.For me the best tracks are no.9, and no.2. I often sing along to the tracks with vocals (no.9 Spiritual Love).If you are looking for some sweet relaxing music to chill to, this is for you. Now I'm not saying I play this cd all the time - my musical tastes are too ecclectic for that - but it is the one my son goes to sleep to, and I often have it on repeat overnight.  It would have made a great backing track to the movie: Crouching Tiger; Hidden Dragon. It's that sort of feel.The best thing is: it's the soundtrack to my favorite yoga instructor!
summary: ecclectic, relaxing & oriental inspired - meditation music

reviewText: Some of the music is like the music on Wailana's TV program, and it's all beautiful -- good and enjoyable to just listen to or play while exercising or practicing Yoga.

I am very pleased with the content of this cd. I can not believe I have lived without it for this long. It is peaceful, vibrant and EVERYTHING I hoped for. I only wish it were much longer. I am a Wai Lana fan and have most of her workouts. I have enjoyed the music from the videos and now I can enjoy it by itself. Wonderful. This cd is a must!!!! Enjoy.

When I was young, music was the "soundtrack of my life," and I found a lot of inspiration in my vinyl. Since then, I've found out that shallow lyrics and big egos kind of sour the taste of most commercial music these days and that makes me really choosy in what I listen to. Wai Lana's music is the some of the most genuine, heartfelt, good sounding music around. It's easy to listen to over and over again and inspiring to hear. Listening to it just makes it seem like everything's going to be all right. And knowing what Wai Lana is teaching with her yoga only makes it sweeter.

I purchased the Power Hooks at Amazon.com. They are a great idea. I don't know how long they've been around but I wish I'd known about them sooner. I don't have to 'clean' the dumbbells before using them. I use heavier(?) dumbbells - 80# - 90# - and the hooks hold their position on the dumbbell handles so the 'catch' hooks, the pieces that wrap around the barbell, don't lose their position so that you're left dropping the dumbbells. The hooks allow for a full first rep. The only down side for me, and it may not be one for someone else, is putting the catch hooks back on the barbell. I can't see the hooks catch the bar but I can feel them settle. Makes me a little jumpy after I return them to the bar. They're a good deal and not pricey. Good luck with your workout.
summary: Great product and price at Amazon...

reviewText: Definitely makes dumbell workouts a lot easier. However they do not fit ALL Dumbells I have.  Then I would have given the product a better rating.

These hooks are great and allow me to get a great dumbbell workout without risk of injury trying to swing the weights in to place. The only thing I'd like to warn people on is the major inconvenience of using them with powerblocks. It's a major pain. You you have to strip down to the handle, slide it in sideways (barely fits), then you have to place the weight back in sideways (by hand). I had to pull my old olympic dumbbells out of storage for DB presses because I disliked they way the worked together so much. Totally killed the efficiency of the powerblocks.
Saves my shoulders when doing Dumbbell press. The only downside is the cushion and bar sometimes interfere with my grip.

It is not my intention to maliciously disparage a product. However, these Power Hooks are worthless. Honestly, pain in the arse to use. Also, very unsafe. If you miss the hooking point after a set you are subject to injury. Poor design.  If using 45 pound plates on the dumbells the hooks cannot be used....not enough space to hook it to the bar.  So you are restricted to using plates no bigger than 25 pounds.My hooks collect dust and prefer the old fashioned heave and hoe method.  I am decent size....5/8 and 205 with no fat. Instead of using a bench....lie on the floor and use legs/knees to put weight in position. No need to use a bench and arms to go below parallel. I currently use 90 dumbells and works great. No worry about dropping weight and injury. Do not buy this junk.

I sincerely hope anyone who thinks about buying these uses common sense when reading the two DUBIOUS posts that gave these 1 star.  In my opinion....they are bogus posts.  I have these....and here are my findings.1.  They are awkward at first, as with any new skill you try when lifting weights.2.  Someone said he couldn't use his "normal" weight when doing incline press.....if you can do 90 lb incline press WITH DUMBBELLS then these hooks will NOT hamper your ability in doing incline presses with the same weight.  That doesn't even make sense.  However....if you never or rarely do certain exercises with dumbbells then yes, you will have to lower the weight...at first.  Anyone who lifts knows if you go from a bar to dumbbells then you will have to take time to get used to each arm lifting independently.3.  Yes....it will take a few times to get used to placing your bench just right under the bar that holds the hooks for you.  I do not bump the bar when using these.  And just like lifting on your own, without a spotter, with a barbell.....it's no different with dumbbells.  You need to be able to muscle them back up to hook the bar.4.  They are NOT made to be dropped!!!  They are made to hook on the bar when your set is done.  I read a review on here that complained that they get banged up or something when you drop the dumbbells.  Duh!  You wouldn't throw your barbell on the floor when you got done bench pressing, would you?  No....then why would you think you would throw these on the floor?  It doesn't make sense.  These hooks are designed to be placed BACK on the bar after your set...NOT thrown on the floor.5.  They are comfortable...to me.  Unless you don't find padded material comfortable, you will find them comfortable too.  Someone actually said that if you have big hands then you can't use these.  What?????  They fit ON THE HANDLE!  If your hands don't fit around a dumbbell handle then it's not the hooks fault.  They take up ZERO space on the handle, other than adding just a few centimeters in thickness around the handle.6.  In my opinion....they also help prevent shoulder injuries from trying to muscle up the dumbbells to their position.  There are a few videos on youtube demonstrating these hooks.  There is also one that shows how to use chains hanging from a power cage or from rafters in your basement hooked on to these as a spotting system in case you can't muscle them back up to rehang them back on the bar.  I have the chains hanging from the top of my power cage and attached to the hooks so I can go to exhaustion on my last set without the worry of dropping the weights on the floor.
summary: I've had these for about a year.

reviewText: The Power hooks are better than I thought they would be.  A friend of mine bought a pair similar to these and he told me they were rated at 300 pounds. Mine are rated  at a thousand pounds.  I couldn't be happier. I share these with other guys at the gym. They all really like them and seem to get a better workout.

Since I lift at home, I was limited on how heavy I could do DB presses to how much weight I could get into position with out injury without a spotter.With the hooks, I'm only limited by how much weight I can pack on to my DB handles (and the limits of my strength, of course).I've gone from pressing 75's to 110's in only a few weeks thanks to Power Hooks!
I bought them as a gift for a trainer at my gym. He loves them as uses them regularly as part of his workout.
This is the only useful gym gizmo in existence, imo.  They are pure awesome and a great conversation starter at the gym.
These are awesome.  You must own these if you do any DB work.  I no longer have to swing the weights into posistion and risk injury.  Must have.
these  barbell  hooks  work  great ! just  be  careful  when  returning  to  bar  when  through with  set  if  your  working  out  alone  ! you  could  miss the  bar !

What can I say , this product allows you to perform dumbbell exercises without having to kick the weight up each time into position allowing you to complete more reps without exhausting yourself from getting the weight into positon first.
summary: Does what it says at an affordable price.

reviewText: POWER HOOKS ARE JUNK! If you have big hands forget about using these cheaply made products. Very uncomfortable to use. DO NOT BUY!!

Great for heavy lifts and fast paced supersets, but to train up the support muscles for lighter lifts pick the weights up yourself. Also if using a power rack make sure the side bars are placed so they don't get in the way when putting the dumbbells down (if your doing reps to failure).

I tried to use these several times, but gave up.  First it takes extra time to wrap the dumbbell and situate the bar.By that I mean you have to move from your normal bench position further down the bench or else you will hit the bar with the top of the hook when pressing the weight.I did not like the way the dumbbells felt due to the length of the top of the hook, that hangs on the bar. It added a sort of instability I did not like. I was unable to use even my normal poundages for incline db presses, which was my main reason for buying.I had to alter my positions on every exercise I tried with these. I tried db presses, shoulder presses on the squat rack and using the Smith machine bar, decline db presses, bench presses, I experienced the same difficulties with all exercises I tried.I had a great deal of difficulty just getting them off the bar, no matter what position(s) I tried. It was not worth the trouble or time I had to take to use these. I was really bummed too, it seemed like such a great idea. These just did not work for me.I will try them using pullups and dips, hanging it on a weight belt, but if that doesn't work, then its Ebay or garbage!
I don't know why I waited so long to get these.  They go on and off easily and work great. Great accessory!

Power Hooks Dumbbell Power Hooks for Free Weights Dumbbells & BarsThese dumbell handles are very essential if you want to make great gains in the bench press and also improve your strength. If you are a power lifter you have to get these. what a great Invention!!!!!!
summary: An essential tool for maximum safety and results!!!!!

reviewText: The product is great. Very useful. But the customer service I received from the seller went above and beyond expectation. Always have reservations ordering things online because you're not dealing with a person at a store location. But this seller really went the extra mile by following up with me. Many thanks!

We were coming back from my son's wedding; I had dropped my wife and our two daughters off at the hotel and on the way to the parking garage I heard this great track I just had to know the name of. I had to sit through two more other-group tracks before I found out it was Stephen Scott's "Virgo". By now my wife and daughter were frantic, thinking something had happened to me. I then had to order it from Germany. It was worth all the trouble, and now it's easily available from Amazon. Hope you like it as much as I did.

Bathory is a one of a kind band. Getting their name from the Blood Countess Erzebet Batory (her uncle was once King of Poland, Stephan Batory..Batory the old spelling, we now spell it Bathory), Quorthon and crew can do metal any way they want. And the Jubileum trilogy proves it. Get the album, ANY album, from Bathory. Though for beginners I recommend any of the 3 Jubileums, that way you get a taste of the Bathory way of music!!  I have seen the Goat, and It is my Sign. Hail Bathory!  Sho
I heard him in Santa Cruz (years ago) and bought a CD.  Wow, so glad I did!  His music is a must have. I'm going to get another for a gift.

Third volume of a three-volume retrospective of this seminal Swedish death metal band.  Actually, it's a band in name only, singer/guitarist Quorthon being the only constant, while other members are pretty much just hired  guns.  Since 1983, Quorthon has been churning out original, experimental,  and often unlistenable variations on death and black metal.  Bathory is  considered one of the originators of both those genres, most of the extreme  Swedish and Norwegian black and death bands of the early 90s claiming  Bathory as prime influence.  Bathory's early material is pure thrash, fast  and trebly, riffs sounding like a vacuum cleaner, blastbeats totally out of  control.  Over this raging din, Quorthon screeched out unintelligible odes  to Satan, making him, along with Venom, Mercyful Fate and Slayer, one of  the earliest groups to really embrace Satanic imagery (much of which sounds  goofy today).  Gradually, Bathory embraced more intricate riffs and the  lyrics moved from Satan to Norse mythology (again, Bathory blazing the way  for future Scandinavian metal bands).  By the early 90s, the music had  slowed down to a medieval/doom, nearly mellow sound recalling Manowar.  All  the while, the production job was always pretty loose, with fuzzy guitar  and bass and drums that were either inaudible or too boomy.  This  compilation haphazardly covers all of it.  More than anything else, Bathory  gets credit for originality, true weirdness and a complete disdain for  mainstream sounds.
summary: inconsistent, but one of the true innovators of metal

reviewText: The "Call Jesus" album has proven old school songs to be "lively again" when combined with the right contemporary styles of music. I think it's going to catch on soon!
summary: Otemporary(O-temp-oh-rare-ree): Perfect blend of old & new!

reviewText: I really enjoyed listening to this CD.  The sound is unique and I can feel the spirit of his music. I recommend this CD to all gospel music fans and those looking to buy a gospel CD for the first time.

Robert lowery first came to my attention 2 years ago when a friend sent a compilation CD of San Francisco Blues artists that had been recorded in 1976.I bought this CD to hear more of him , and was definitely not dissapointed. Any fan of acoustic Blues will appreciate this Arkansas - born  guitarist and singer.  ( He resides in Santa Cruz, CA) Roberts acoustic guitar is as clean sounding as it comes. He switches from his two major influences, the direct and down low slide playing of the Delta , and the clean finger picking Piedmont style, with ease. He is accompanied by his long time harp player, Virgil Thrasher on 2 of the songs on this CD , with the rest being only acoustic guitar and voice.His vocals and guitars are cocksure, played and sung with the confidence of  veteran Blues man. Twelve of the 17 tracks on this CD are Lowery originals, with 2 Robert Johnson songs (32-20 Blues, and Dust my Broom) and one Sam Chatman tune ( Sittin` on Top Of The World) If you are a fan ( as I am) of acoustic Blues, then this CD should be in your collection. If you are a casual fan , this CD is representative of some of the best modern acoustic Blues available.Listen , and I promise you`ll be back for more !!!

This CD was in all factuality "good."  There was a sound that really appealed to me through the song "This Old Building."  I think that Troy Sneed is an artist we all need to watch as he breaks  through.

This CD Call Jesus by Mr. Troy Sneed is truly an expression under the anointing of God.  It explores gospel from Traditional to inspirational to contemporary and with a final note of Praise and Worship.  Again I know my  gospel and this CD is it!

Love this project.., The tunes and interludes are great! His traditional and choir cuts such as This Old Building, are sure to be sung by choirs across the world.  Sneed's high and powerful falsetto voice(Walk Around  Heaven) is definitely impeccable he absolutely  has an anointing on his  life.  This album is great and I just cannot wait for the sophomore  project! Buy this album and you will be blessed!

"Call Jesus"- is an outstanding collection of Gospel Music for persons of all ages.  From the upbeat "Call Jesus"- which my youth all love to the song -"Walk Around Heaven"-  for those of  us who are tired and weary are looking forward to just walking on the  streets of gold one day. The album is mastery from cover to cover.  I love  the rendition of- "He's Sweet I know"- because it talks about my  Jesus in such a way that makes me love Him more and more. - "This Old  Building"- ain't nothing but the good old time gospel like my Mama  them used to sing!  I love It!  As I listened to -"More Than This  World to Me" - I hear a young man who has learned who the most  important person in his life is and the artist truly gives "Reverence  to His Name" This song is a soothing praise that relaxes the mind and  encourages the heart. It seems that all the songs and their messages follow  because once we get in the attitude of reverence - We get that assurance  that the Lord is on our side.  I especially appreciate the artists urge for  us to encourage one another by assuring the person in need that -"The  Lord is on Your Side". To include one's Pastor on a first album is  also a sign of unselfishness on the part of Troy.  It's not important to  him to get the glory - It's all about getting the message out that we all  need to - "Come to Christ"! As Troy says in his album cover-  "Its all to the glory of God!" I can also think of no better  ending praise than - Something about that name! Yes, - Call Jesus! - is a  wonderful, exciting, soothing, masterpiece of Gospel Music for lovers of  Gospel music of all ages!

Every born again believer uses tools to witness in the battle to win souls for the Lord; CALL JESUS is an excellent witnessing tool because that is your goal when talking to someone about giving their life to Christ...you  want them to call on the name of Jesus and be saved. So from the title song  with its strong call and response chords to the very beautiful WALK AROUND  HEAVEN so vocally superb and every believer's goal to the melodic REVERENCE  TO THY NAME and SOMETHING ABOUT THAT NAME, Troy Sneed takes us to the 'most  high place' with his first cd.

Very talented and humble.  His voice reaches in range where very few intrumental musicians even dare play.  This project should be in every personal collection, in every home and every radio station throughout the  world.  Something for everyone and able to improvise to fit the audience  when ministering, always interactive.  In Nashville for WNSG-awesome,  Champaign, IL he was simply In God's service.  Definitely will be used by  the Lord in the next century.  Live performance is conducive to  recording-even better in person.  You'll surely want to attend one of his  concerts when he is on tour in a city near you in 2000.

I felt that Troy Sneed's album Call Jesus was the best.  I know personally because I participated with him and the Youth for Christ Choir, so his works are always good and will continue to be outstanding.

This CD holds a recital that Shura Cherkassy performed in San Francisco in 1982. He thought the performance was a good one and allowed its release. Mr. Cherkassy has been described as among the last post-romantic pianists, and indeed he is in a class with Rubinstein, Hofmann and Horowitz. Having been able to attend one of his concerts, I can vouch for his deep love of music and his ability to communicate this love to his audience. He was a spontaneous performer in command of what he played, and not afraid to tackle difficult works in his old age.This recital is quintessential Cherkassy. Perhaps a highlight is the Grand Sonata by Tchaikovsky, a piece not often performed and played to perfection here by Mr. Cherkassy. The variety of this concert is perfect. We being with Lully and continue down the centuries exploring Mendelssohn, Chopin and a marvelous work by Hofmann. This was a great concert that is well-recorded. There is audience applause but there are only slight coughing that does not disturb the performance. A must buy.
GREAT toy!! Forget toys with batteries, accessories or ones that require a crowd. This one is a MUST.
summary: Can't Imagine my kids having a childhood without it. ALL the kids had them. And just one lasted for several kids.

reviewText: I don't speak very much French, but this is a Great, Great CD. I enjoyed all of it. The musicality transcends my language barrier and I found a lyric sheet for "Dormir Dehors" and it is very poetic. I originally downloaded the CD from I tunes to help me with French Classes, but was blown away by how good this CD is, a proud addition to my collection.  Au Revoir, S
We gave this to our son for his first birthday.  He loved it to pieces...literally.  It lasted about 2 months before the wood under the handle bars split and it fell apart :(

I highly recommend this ride on toy.  I was looking for something durable and fun for my one year old and this is perfect.  It surpassed my expectations.  Takes a little time to put together but seems very durable.

We bought this trike for my son when he was a year old. After buying several other ride on toys that were too high, we finally found the perfect size.  My son loves it and still rides it at 3!  It still looks new after two and a half years!  If you are looking for a safe indoor ride on toy that won't put a hole in your wall or mark your floors this is the one.  We highly recommend it.
summary: Just the right size for little ones

reviewText: My boys have loved this ride-on.  They wore out the first one after 3 years so I'm buying another for the little one.  Very fun and safe (as long as the big kids don't ride it and scrape their knees).  Perfect for little ones who want to ride and steer but aren't big enough to pedal.

My son started riding this toy all over our aparment at age 10 months--well before he could walk. We took it to the park (You can hook the trike's handle bars over the handles of the stroller and carry it hands free) and our son was able to zoom all over the playground and even through the sprinklers--stomping his feet in all the puddles--all before he could walk. Now, at 14 1/2 months, he can ride backwards, he can propel himself up hills, and he picks both feet off the ground as he zooms down inclines. This morning we took it into town and our son rode up and down the side walk, stopping to wave and blow kisses to passers by. Adorable! And he's only just begun to walk this week.
summary: The best toy in the world!!!

reviewText: My father bought this for my nephew who is now 4 years old.  He is still trying to ride it even though his legs are now much too long.  It is still in excellent condition.  Every time he is at my house he will get it out and ride, his knees bump the handle bars and his legs extend past the wheels when he pushes but he still enjoys this toy more than any ride toys he has.

Unfairly labelled as a Frankie Valli clone, Lou Christie's soaring falsetto is actually a far more pleasurable listing experience. This decent package includes all his early records from his rock and roll teen idol days including a previously unreleased studio track, Money (That's what I want). Christie and his friend and musician Twyla Herbert wrote most of this material and some of the tracks are essential rock and roll classics. Aside from the many original tracks, Lou Christie's cover of the Pentagons 'To be loved' is fantastic, although the lacklustre 'Stay' and 'Tears on my pillow' are not as memorable. I found that the best records on here were some of the least known. To be honest I'm pretty tired of 'The Gypsy Cried and 'Two Faces Have I, purely because I've heard them millions of times, but 'You may be holding my baby' and 'There they go' are two of the best records that I've listened to on a rock and roll CD for quite some time.Christie didn't follow suit with his amazing two tone voice and opt for the typical 'Italian Doo Wop' sound, instead he was usually backed by female singers known as The Tammys, which is a neat and individual touch. Although his number one hit, Lightening Strikes is missing - due to him changing labels before releasing it - this is probably the best CD to get by LOU CHRISTIE. I'm a fairly harsh critic, but although not every track is excellent, I can find little to criticise on this fine CD. Buy this one and then get the one with 'Lightening strikes' and his cover of 'Teenager in love' on. They're so cheap on Amazon that you'd be a fool not too.
summary: If you're only going to get one CD by Lou Christie...

reviewText: It's a great first 'bike" for a toddler whose the right size.  My son received it for his 1st birthday and now at 17 months, it's still his favorite toy, although he's towering over it just a bit.  He has thrown it around many times but because of its simple parts, still remains in one piece.  Highly recommend this classic for a smaller child.
greatest figure ever just in time for the playoffs fits in my collection just what i need just in time thanks

This product comes with a booklet full of fun activities to do with your toddler to help them learn the alphabet. I've used many of their suggested games, and the children have enjoyed them all.  It isn't the most requested alphabet game that I have in my preschool, but never fails to entertain the group when I pull it out.  I'm pretty picky about what I use to teach, and I'd prefer that the letters weren't crooked and that a more basic font was used, but that doesn't bother the children at all.  They seem attracted to the bright colors and they don't seem to have too much difficulty identifying the letters.
summary: Good for groups or individual learning.

reviewText: Sturdy and fun.  My two year old likes to sit on it and get pulled or bounced on it.

This was a hit at a 4yr old birthday party.  The perfect size for a few kids and adults and super sturdy; we had some future s/he-mans yanking on the handles with all their might.  Play some music and do freeze dance, have the kids try to all run under before it goes down, are they fast enough?  Other fun games - through some ball on top and don't let them bounce off.  There are probably many more ideas out there if you search the world wide web of fun.  Now I am waiting for another turn where we have enough people over to use it.
summary: Perfect for the 3-6 yr old crowd

reviewText: Our two very active and agile little boys love the Radio Flyer trike.  When our 18-month-old wakes up from his nap, his first word is usually, "Motorbike," referring to the Radio Flyer trike.  He and our nearly-three-year-old do battle every day over who will ride and / or who owns the Radio Flyer trike.Our older son is very tall for his age but races around the house on the trike without any difficulty just as he has done since he first learned to ride it.  I highly recommend the trike for active, agile little boys.I can't imagine our boys without their Radio Flyer trike.  Our English friends often ask where they can buy one. As far as I know, it's only available in the U.S.  Radio Flyer would do well to start selling it in the U.K.

My kids love this parachute. It's the perfect size to play with indoors and outdoors. I think it has about 10 handles so it works with large groups of kids (holding one handle) or smaller groups (holding two handles). We've toted it all over the place and it's held up very well. This is definitely a great purchase.
The kids loved it!  When they visit grandparents next year they will have it to play with again. Colors were great.

My 2 year old daughter got this parachute for Christmas and just LOVES it...and so does her 11 mo. old sister!  They ask to get it out everyday.  She wants to play with it everytime a friend comes over.  She jumps on each color and says it's name.  The 11 mo. old loves to sit in the middle and pounce on the sides while we shake it around.  The girls are learning large motor skills and coordination while having a BALL!  I strongly recommend this "toy".

We bought this for our sons birthday party and all the kids love it. We thought it would be just a fun 10 minute game, but no it turned into an hour plus of the kids playing. It is prefect to take anywhere for kids to play inside, outside the best 20 bucks we have spent on a kids toy that will not out grow in 2 to 5 months but will play with for a while.

Easily packs up into its small bag, appears well constructed, kids*love* it.  There is a mesh vent in the middle, seams are reinforced.  My 3.5 year old likes to sit on top and be spun around, I was worried this might not be up to the task but we had no problem with 4 little ones totally nearly 100 pounds sitting on it and dragging it in circles on a soft carpet.  Ours was the color pictured.

Quality is good, but not as durable as I would like - we have a two inch tear in the fabric - but we did use it a bit rougher than intended. My hubby was dragging 3-4 five and six year old around on it through the leaves in the yard during a birthday party. I would recommend it for toddlers, and young grade school.
Purchased this for my Niece for her sons B-day party. All the kids loved it. Very well made bright nice colors.Can't wait for summer to take outside.I recommened this item.

We bought this for our daughters, age 6 and 4.  We used it for our 4 year old's birthday party and all the kids loved it.  There were children there aged 3, 4, 6, 9, 10 and my husband and I (30+).  We all really enjoyed it.  We threw on a ball and popped it around, put some leaves on it and tossed them all over, had one child run underneath and tried to "catch" them, and just "made waves."  Everyone was smiling and laughing and having a great time.  We're glad we bought 2 more to give as Christmas gifts.  We would highly recommend this to everyone!

Be very careful.  The description of the parachute ends with the following, "Comes with its own nylon carrying bag.  Made of 70-denier nylon."  I interpreted this as meaning the parachute was, "Made of 70-denier nylon."  It is NOT.  Only the bag is made of nylon.  I hope this was not meant to mislead potential customers.
summary: Read Description Carefully - NOT made of Nylon

reviewText: This product is best used by younger children as the older kids may put more force on the parachute while playing with it.

Among the concerts that I have attended over five decades  four Cherkassky performances hold a special place. His biographies inform us that a young Glenn Gould was mesmerized upon witnessing Josef Hoffmann in concert, and walked around in a kind of trance days afterwards. Well, I shared this experience during Cherkassky's concerts in the 80's, Hofmann, one of his teachers, could have been proud.Unfortunately, Cherkassky's quality of tone, about which libraries could be filled to little avail, is poorly reproduced in most of his recordings. His Nimbus discs are disastrous, his concert discs on Decca, Orpheo and BBS legends are decent, but offer very little in the way of the Cherkassky live experience. Fortunately, there is this disc that should be able to give an uninitiated listener at least some impression of the singing tone that the master could produce on any hall's standard issue.Just like Jorge Bolet, whose late Liszt cycle has endowed him with a distinctly better chair in the pianist pantheon, Cherkassky found his highest acclaim towards the end of a distinguished career. He started out a prodigy, found fame, was forgotten and survived under humble circumstances as the BBC house pianist, to reemerge in the 1980s and find well deserved acclaim.Whereas the likes of Ivo Pogorelich and Bruno Leonardo Gelber never failed to express the attitude "my audience, I despise you"; never more so when one attempted to even approach their dressing room, Shura was the very opposite. He knew who he was and was the most pleasant of after concert personalities. I remember discussing the Beethoven/Liszt symphony transcriptions that Katasaris was recording at that time with him. He responded "o, that is such a bad idea, those works don't work at all on a piano; and, "the Liszt version of Berlioz' Symphonie Fantastique, now that is a much better idea". However, my question "have you ever played it" only got one of his gentle "are you crazy" smiles in response.In his Cherkassky obituary Stephen Hough wrote: "no one who heard him play or met him will ever forget his unique personality, both on and off the stage. His golden tone, like sunshine melting a bowl of the richest ice-cream (two of his 'favourite things'); his contrapuntal voicing, like a child wandering into all the rooms he's been banned from; or, for that matter, his walk to the piano - as if treading on crushed velvet. We will try to keep our memories fresh with his recordings (particularly the 'live' ones), and will treasure amongst ourselves the many anecdotes which have now become part of musical folklore. Although he never taught ("I wouldn't know how"), perhaps we can all learn from him the lesson that elegance and entertainment have their place in the concert hall as well as education and elevation; and that there is no shame in loving and cherishing the piano for its own sake."And, although Cherkassky could wrap his arms around a Liszt sonata, the Tchaikovsky Sonata included on this disc, or other large scale works, his mastery was best attuned to both smaller scale works, or segmentable works like variations and paraphrases.It was in one of the after concert conversations that in response to a tease by what appeared a longtime friend Cherkassky responded "well, look at my repertoire, it ranges from Lully to Stockhausen, and a lot of what is in between". That was interesting, and after spending quite some time in those pre-internet days, I was disappointed to find out that there were no such things as Lully solo keyboard works. Two decades later, this disc came to the rescue.Technically this disc is so, so. It's a live concert with a lot of audience noise. There is tape hiss. Dynamics at the macro level are ok, on the micro level leave a lot to be desired, but timbre wise this disc is not bad at all.The concert starts with Lully. Now, in the internet age, I found out that the "suite de Pieces" that Cherkassky played is in fact the pianist's selections from an early 20th century transcription of Lully Opera pieces for the piano. Those interested should be able to find the score as a free download without trouble.In many interviews Cherkassky has admitted that sitting on a podium in front of an audience took him to a places that he would have never imagined during practice sessions, and that relistening to concert recordings often resulted in a "did I really play it that way?" response. Well, his Lully here is a fine example. Fine that is, for those who do not suffer from HIPP hang ups, since they may counter that Cherkassky's trance-like performance channels good old Beelzebub. But, and this is very relevant for Lully, the French state "c'est le ton qui fait la musique", and it is his pretty much unmatched tone control that enables Cherkassky's to open emotional doors, that don't budge for the great majority of his colleagues. Sure, one could remark that this performance -remember Hough's "his contrapuntal voicing, like a child wandering into all the rooms he's been banned from" - is pathologically anachronistic. But, that gently perfumed "Air tendre" represents the composer more credible than many a card carrying HIPP vinegar factory. To me, this Lully is amazing. And, admiration for this interpretation really blooms when one climbs behind the 88 with the score. Talk about artistic imagination.Mendelssohn's decidedly third-tier piano trifles were popular in Cherkassky's generation. He makes out of it what he can, but this Scherzo and Cappriccio has never impressed me.Next, we get to the meat and potatoes of this disc, the nowadays mostly forgotten Tchaikovsky sonata. It's sad Pjotr wrote so much great music, and yet when it comes to the piano all we hear is that mediocre 1st Piano Concerto war horse. In many respects, this sonata is much more interesting. Of course, a Hammerklavier it's not, but judged on its own especially melodic merits there is a lot to enjoy. The pianist has this music running through his veins and in all likelihood offers us a very close approximation of what Tchaikowsky had in mind. Not surprisingly, the interpretation is approached from the inside out, from detail to the whole -Leslie Howard offers an engagingly opposite approach. And, the romantically inclined among us will find a lot to enjoy in this neglected work.Next, there is Chopin's Op. 61, which may be considered among the composer's very best and most dramatic works. Although I don't want to imply that it represented a certain dislike of the dramatic, Cherkassky's performance here is in a much lighter vein than Ivan Moravec' standard performance. Just like he did in his Salzburg performance of Bach's 6th Partita, Cherkassky provides a more laid back approach that does not lack in validity. Chopin's masterpiece does lose some of its bite, but this lyrical approach successfully highlights the more subtle of the composer's modulations in a beautiful tone.Then there are two encores, an old school Chopin waltz that defines the word "charm" concludes the affair. Before that there is Hoffman's Kaleidoskop, that has been revived by Marc-Andre Hamelin. The Canadian is linear and metronomically incredibly perfect. Just like in Lully, Cherkassky dives into the piece, and uses his exquisite sense of coloring to get to this composition's true essence.Bolet and Cherkassky both enjoyed the label "the last romantic" at the end of their careers. Comparing them to today's highly homogenized lot turns even me nostalgic. Fortunately, this disc seves like the madeleine in "À la recherche du temps perdu".
summary: An adequate representation of a unique pianist

reviewText: Fun bright colors, wears well with young children. One of the few toys that easily fits back into its carry bag.

Played with this today in fact in our living room.  My kids love to make forts out of it with our dining chairs.  I think the fabric quality is good, and was what I expected.  It has a little vent in the middle so that kids can put it all the way to the floor sitting in it and the air won't get stuffy.  The 10 feet doesn't seem like much until you actually get it out, it's a surprising nice size.
he liked it so much, I bought it for my other nephew!  My nephews really enjoy it and are outside playing; just where kids would be.
summary: I bought this for my nephew for his birthday!

reviewText: We bought this parachute for my 6yr old son and twin 2yr old daughters. On the weekends they have a lot of their friends over to play. It is hard to find something that everyone can play with together when there are five or six kids.  It is one thing that they can all play with and is great for both ages. This toy teaches kids to work together as a team. I agree that you can not fit many kids under it at once, but that has also helped me teach them about taking turns. When they play with it outside they usually put beach balls on it, and when they use it in the basement they use pillows or stuffed animals. This toy is great for all ages. There are so many games to play with it. I don't think my kids could ever get bored with this toy.

Perfect size ... Durable/good quality...speedy delivery. My 2 year old son just loves this thing! He really likes using it as the roof of a fort.  Also great for going to the beach and using as a blanket to sit on as it washes up well. Great product!

With parachute play, we had campers ranging from two years old to over 60, and everyone was able to participate- together. Little ones ran under the billowing, bright nylon. They played with a giant beach ball under the covering like they had their own live forthouse, then we put the ball on top to see how many consecutive times we could cooperatively toss it from the parachute's center, then catch it to send it aloft again. Game possibilities are endless. Having ten sturdy, comfortable web handles all around the edges made it manageable for big and little hands alike. The parachute packs up small and light in its accompanying nylon bag, so we could use it as filler play for 5 minutes between activities, take it to the beach for anytime to warm up from the water, and even tote it on our hike to use as instant shade when draped over a piece of string strung between two trees! Every family taking a road trip should have one of these as standard travel gear along with a soft frisbee and a kickball. One unexpected benefit: This is a perfect solution if you're looking for a colorful, lively photo op to advertise a camp, children's program, cooperation seminar, or just to capture a memory that will make your heart smile.

As a grandma, I've given two 6-foot parachutes and thought they were too small to be exciting. So for this 4 year old, who had loved the big parachute at nursery school, I bought the 10-foot parachute. Caveat: It's too big to spread out in any room in a 1920s townhouse. Gotta be an outdoor toy -- unless they use it to make a hideout.

I know the size is clearly listed, but it is difficult to use it with kids as a parachute toy because of its size.  I have kids from 1-8 years old.  Only the two smallest would have any interest for more than 2 seconds.  it is not really big enough to play many games you did back in school.
Exactly as described. Used at a 1 year old's party so took a lot of abuse and look forward to much more usage once child gets older.
Cute appears to be in good shape.  Have not played with it.  I was happy it did not smell like any chemicals or cheap toys from china :)
It's a lot of fun. I plan on storing it in the closet most days and just bringing it out when we have friends over. It's better when there's more of a crowd.

We bought this for an activity to do at my 4 year old's birthday party. It was a big hit with kids and adults. Just throw in a few beach balls and let them go crazy! We'll have fun using this when the weather is nice.
summary: Great product for active play & parties

reviewText: Lots of fun...the kids loved it

This review is about this parachute compared to other parachutes.  It is not a review about whether or not parachutes are fun.  Of course they are.  On the positive side, this parachute is cheaper than others.  Unfortunately, however, I thought I was ordering a parachute with pink in it (see photo), but received a parachute with dark purple, instead.  It's not a very attractive parachute.  Also, I thought I was ordering something that would hold a lot of air and be fluffy.  It is not.  It's heavy.  Finally, I thought I was ordering something that a child could sit in and be lifted by adults (like in the gymboree).  The directions clearly state you can NOT do this with this product.  I'm sure kids can have fun with this, but the limitations break my heart.  I was so looking forward to this toy.
Holding up well to my daughters (11 and 9) as well as their friends. Doesn't always get used as a parachute...but rather the roof to a fort. Either way- they are having fun with it :)

I took my 3 year old nephew Jason to a childs party one Saturday...they had a clown who brought a play parachute. He laughed so hard I couldnt wipe the grin off MY face...I decided then and there to get him one of his own...this is a wonderfully educational toy for children. It gives hours of laughing and smiling fun for all..young and old!
summary: My 3 year old nephew adores it!

reviewText: He likes for us to play with this everyday. He likes to go under and dance. I also drag him on it around the house.
summary: My two year old loves it!

reviewText: Great for fun at home when you can't get to the Gymboree play class.Pros-  Colorful, good fabricCons- none!

this is more like a glorified round table cloth.  the kids (4 kids age ranges from 2-5) barely played with this.  so so sad bc now i have this bright round table cloth that calshed with everything in my house uuugh lol

I bough this for my other daughters B-day which is in the next few days. I don't know how well it will last or hold up but we played with something like this when I was a kid and I think the kids need to spend as much time outside playing as when I did when I was their age. This is the perfect thing because it promotes everyone being able to play as a group. It should make a great outside toy for the summer.
summary: Remember When I was in school?

reviewText: This holds up and works great, only wish I bought a bigger one. Also it didn't come with any suggestions like games to play with it. The box says there are hundreds of games but there isn't even a paper with a few.
This is a well made parachute. It has 12 handles, but lots of space for little hands to hold on to the edge also.It smells a bit chemically, but I am assuming that will go away quickly.

I didn't know how much my kids would like this item until I took it out of the box.  Oh my they played with it for hours.  Sharks and minnows is their new favorite game.  I love that it is an inside as well as outside toy.

This is a fabulous activity to be enjoyed alone--as, say, a cover for a fort or a large streamer or flag--or, with a gang of kids, to be enjoyed as illustrated, through cooperative play.  The colors are vivid and appealing and the fabric is fluid like a flag--or, a parachute, which it is!  I bought one of these each for my granddaughter and grandson and they both played with them endlessly.  My grandson's birthday party enjoyed it as an activity.  This 'chute has provided many fun hours for the kids and their families!

I bought this for my preschool classroom. It's a huge hit! We play traditional games with it, but we also drape it over a table for a multi color tent! It's very durable, and I love that it's machine washable. And the price- WOW! Cheapest I've seen it ANYWHERE.I highly recommend!
I was totally disappointed with this.  The fabric was too stiff not like the ones we have seen in preschool. Good thing I didn't pay more than twenty dollars .  I guess you get what you paid for

We got this for our preschooler. Love playing with it! It seems to be holding up very well, but we've not had it very long.  The colors are not as light as they are shown in the picture. Looking forward to using this a lot more with summer coming soon.

This is truly a great product..Children of all ages and sizes love running under the parachute or bouncing a beach ball on top, even the grown ups love it..Also it is grest for setting boundries for the children to help keep them seated during parties or just everday activities...best of all we have found that if it does get alittle dirty..we just toss it in the tub with woolite and cool water and within 20 minutes its dry and right back in its carrying case...It"s the BEST
summary: Playchute Parachute the Hit of the Party

reviewText: Personally, I may not see the greatness of this product, the kids LOVE IT !!  Well constructed, sturdy, right size.

This is my daughter's go-to toy when she makes her fort in the living room almost every weekend. It's light enough for her to maneuver, unlike the bulky blankets and sheets we had used in the past. I love that it comes in its own bag for tidy storage when she is finished playing with it. We enjoy ours so much I have bought more as gifts for friends' children. Highly recommend.
This was the perfect gift for my daughters at Christmas.  We have used it at family functions, on weekends and at b-day parties.  It has held up great!
summary: Just what we needed at a great price.

reviewText: Really durable and bright. We got it for our daughter's birthday party and all of the kids loved it.  Easy to wash and doesn't have any type of a smell.  Comes in a great sack for storing.
Perfect for a few kids. It was used and enjoyed by three rambunctious boys repeatedly on Christmas day with a varietyof different games and toys.
I bought this for my grandson's birthday. There are so many ways to use the parachute as well as play different kinds of games with it. Great for all ages.
This is great for my kids fitness classes! They love when I pull the parachute out especially when we bounce the ball with it.

I purchased this playchute for my playgroup. The kids LOVE it!!! While adults work the playchute the kids run underneath and out and have a blast. When the kids make waves with it to keep a plushtoy bouncing on it, they learn to work together as a team. It promotes gross motor skills and coordination. My daughter loves this playchute when I hang it from the ceiling over her little tykes climber and create her own little "house". This is a very durable item for a great price. In our playgroup there are only toddlers. When they get older they can play actual games with the playchute. (There are a lot of books with playchute games available.) We will have fun for years to come. The kids don't seem to get bored with this ever!!!! 5 stars....definetely.
summary: Great Fun for a bunch of kids (and adults...)

reviewText: I bought this for a grandson in hopes that he will grow up playing with something NON electronic. Kids need more outdoor play time that gets their heart pumping. Highly encourage this.
This play parachute holds less air than a plain old bed sheet. We spent an extra 10 bucks on a real Gymboree play parachute from eBay with much more fun results.
This is a really neat trike for those who are sick of plastic and like retro-style and real wood on their toys.  We've given this to our Godson and bought one for our son.  Both love it!

I hesitated to get this for a few years but so glad I pulled the trigger.  the kids use it as designed but also for forts.  too much fun with this- giggles always abound.  we have had it for some time and the chute always come out when friends are over!
summary: perfect classic toys for tots to teens

reviewText: This was a lot of fun for my daughters 2nd birthday. The kids loved it. I do feel like the handle could be a little more secure but they held up through the party with no breaks so I was happy!

I bought this for my daughter's 2nd birthday party.  She really enjoyed playing with her 4 year old cousin and other partymates.  It took about 5 adults/older kids to make the parachute go up and down.  We added a ball to the top and popped it in the air.  Come to think of it, I think the adults had just as much fun as the kids.  We will be using this toy for years to come.
I bought this for my nieces and nephews and we use it at birthday parties.  The kids love it, and it is surprisingly durable.

I bought this parachute to take to Ecuador, South America with me to use in the Elementary school.  I found it to be a huge help witht the language barrier and the children had a blast.  I left it at the school when I came back to the states and I plan on purchasing another one for my own classroom.  This is such a great investment!
We're really satisfied w/ our purchase, this is not expensive as the other ones and made of excellent material, hours of fun!!!
Fun for all - The local Gymboree closed, so we have "Gymboree" time in our own home now.Even our dog gets in on the fun ans still not rips in the fabric! :)
My friends kids received this as a Christmas gift and just loved it.  They made a tent out of it and played with it outside the following day. The colors were great and it is fun for kids and adults.
when i have kids over we get the playchute out we sing parachute songs & games  !! it's a big hit and an effort.

We bought this for our 2 1/2yr old son that has Down syndrome, he loves it!! I thought it would have been made out of a bit more thicker material, but for the price I can't complain! Would deff recommend to a friend!
Love the bright colors of this playchute.  It did get a small tear quickly but easily mended.  Used with children age 3-11.
Purchased this as a gift for my grandson as he gets older.  Watched kids have fun at a party with the parachute and wanted to be able to give this as a gift later.
A fun activity for all ages! I hope it holds up, but if it was made if more heavy duty materials I doubt I'd be able to lift it. For the price, a great purchase! Family fun guaranteed.
Perfect for a small group of about 4 kids.  Great indoor or out.  HANDLES are a must have!!!
I bought this for a costume party I had for my 2 year old.  All of the children from ages 2-10 years old loved it and it created hours of entertainment!
Got this item for my daughter's daycare! Great price, it was shipped here rather fast which was nice for the kids~ I have not heard any real complaints about it!

Love the mesh bag that stores the parachute; it was easy to fold the parachute and place back in bag.  There are handles, which the product description fails to mention, but are good to have.  Seems sturdy enough.  Good size (not too big or small).  Purchased for party play activity.  Children were excited to play with it.  Overall, good value.
This is an incredibly versatile and durable toy for all ages.
As I said - this is just what we needed or were looking for. The kids will enjoy this for years to come.
This is a great way to get the grandbabies playing things at the same time and having fun doing it.
I haven't used this product yet. But, upon opening the package, the playchute looks exactly as seen in picture. I anticipate the children having a blast.

I bought this parachute to use with my kids and my neighbors, which will happen come spring.  I also run a moms group at my local library and bring it with me most weeks.  The kids are all 3 and under and love it each time we use it.  They help hold it, run under it, stand under it and get static hair and even sit on it and we spin them around singing songs.  It is very large, and great for a group of kids. I would recommend to all.  Enjoy!
Great material. Really big. We will use this for years for many different events. We can use it at parties...when he is bored...or even to make a tent to play in.
summary: Great toy that will keep your kid entertained for years.

reviewText: I bought this for my niece for her birthday, and we had loads of fun with it. Not too big so if you only have 3 adults you can still get the effect of the chute. Kids love playing and running under it while it falls.
We use the playchute for groups of 3-6 year olds during summer camps.  It is very sturdy and the perfect size for our groups (6-12).  It is well sewn and we haven't had any issues with it at all.
summary: Great fun for a Great value

reviewText: The kids loved this and it was a great price.  I saw it for a lot more on other sites.  Great deal

This was a gift for my 14 month old grandson. He loves the parachute at story time at our local library and I wanted him to be able to enjoy one at home. This is well made and sturdy. It is large enough for him to get under it and for us to hold on to the handles. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to by a parachute.
High quality, perfect size.  My granddaughter loves it.
summary: perfect size. My granddaughter loves it

reviewText: I tried to determine the size of this parachute prior to purchase.  I guessed it would be 10 feet by the amazon pictures that I compared with the Pacific Tent pictures/literature.  The Playchute arrived today.  It is 10 feet as I expected and it's just the size I was looking for!
