First off, it comes with carpet of its own similar to what you find on mini-golf courses, so you don't have the irregularities of the house carpet textures.  It is about 9 feet long so it gives you an opportunity to truly practice.  There are 3 destinations the putted ball can reach...the hole itself, a water hazard (no water), and a sand trap (no sand).  If it goes in any of the 3, the ball is kicked back to you, and it comes back with sufficient force to bring it back the full 9' distance.We found that by placing small objects under one or both edges you can make the putting more difficult by requiring the player to take the angles into account so it is not a straight putt any longer.  Also, we made the 9' runner into small hills to putt over...all the different layouts made it a fun game for the entire family.It comes with a ""3D" background of trees, is simple to assemble, and high quality materials.  No clubs or balls included.Fun game for ages 4 to 94 (our household and relatives who have played this in the last few days).
summary: This was a huge hit with the entire family

reviewText: Good way to make a golfer out of me yet.  Can spend quality time with spouse and have fun.

I have to laugh at this one. The cheesy picture behind the hole, the fake "traps", the generally terrible build quality...it's so lame it is in fact kind of funny. But for 40 bucks the joke's on you if you buy it.At least it does return the ball. For that it gets an extra star.I'd give this four stars at 15, and five at 10. But all of these astroturf-y putting matts are basically the same, so look on craigslist and find one for five bucks, there's always lots around. Or buy one here for far less than this. Or just use a glass on its side on the rug. But OMG, then you have to take a couple steps and get the ball yourself!One tip: put tiny little tea bags etc under the matt at various places for a more realistic roll, makes it more fun too.

This putting green is great for practice.  Worked great from the time that I opened it.  the ability to send the ball back even when you hit the hazards is great.  I spent about a half hour putting and only used one ball never having to move from my spot.

We use this less than intended, but we like it.  The ball return feature is great and works most of the time.  Sometimes you have to get it manually, but be careful because the return mechanism is not good for fingers (little or otherwise).
summary: It's good but not used often

reviewText: As I write this review this product is coming apart,most of the workmanship was glue together and taped with doublesided tape which is not sticking and this item has not even been used yet. I have not even had the oppurtunity to use this product to to countining to make repairs.Very unsatisfied with this item.

This is a great little putting matt for minimal price (under $8 at the time purchased).  Balls do sometimes jam in the mechanism and the kick-back motor does sometimes get weak if you sink several puts in quick succession, but for the price it's a perfect indoor/winter/office practice aid.  I do not use the back-stop (looks cheap, wavy plastic) and very rarely have putts go off the back (thanks to the "sand trap" and "water hazard").One thing to remember, due to the incline near the cup, it's easy to "ram in" puts that likely wouldn't fall in the real world.  The best puts on this matt are the ones that just barely make it into the cup.
summary: Great putting matt for the price.

reviewText: Bought this for my son in law for xmas. The guys spent hours practicing in the livingroom . Setup is easy and stores away out of site.

Great bins for birdwatching! Wide lens to let in lots of light so you can catchup with flying birds easily. Lightish weight, clear vision,rubberised for inevitable knocks and drops. Have bought 4 pairs over the years. Excellant for learner birders, naturewatchers.

I saw a lot of negative reviews for this practice mat, but it looks like they've updated the device, because it worked really well for me!First, for the most part, it's all one piece.  The putting mat is all one piece; there is no gap or attaching of the putting surface.  You just unroll it.  It's not the BEST surface; mine has been unrolled for days, but is still "bumpy" from where it was unrolled.  But, it's all one piece.  The only things you need to do is attach the tree-backdrop (velcro is used here), add a sticker for the bottom of the "hole", and stick in the flag.  I noticed the instructions were not applicable to the putting green I received; the instructions talked about putting the ball-return in place, etc, but really this is plug and play.  I did notice a problem with the flag; the hole that holds it goes down into the ball-return area, so I just don't use the flag.  The neat thing about this is that if you mis-hit a ball into the "water" or "trap", it feeds the ball into the center area and shoots the ball back at you.  It's a powerful ball-return; it seems to depend on where the ball is located once the ball-return kicks in.  Sometimes the ball would roll back off the mat, sometimes it would make it halfway.It functions just fine.  Even with the "bumps" in the mat, I still made good putts.  It's more of a neat toy than a serious practice device:  the hole has an incline just before it, so you have to hit the ball harder than you would normally.  I had some solid shots get hung up on the incline at the end.  Your mis-hits have to be gentle; I had a few roll up onto the back of the green and roll back down, blocking the path of future hits.  Sometimes balls would get hung-up on the ball return area.  I would just hit a second ball, and the ball-return would shoot them back out.For the most part, I would recommend this toy.  It's nice to not have to walk back and forth for every shot just to get your ball.  The green surface isn't the thickest I've seen, but it's OK.  It's a fun distraction rather than a serious training device, and I think it would make a really good gift.
summary: Really good gift - more for fun than for "practice".

reviewText: Sure this thing has a fun water and sand hazard as well as a flag.  It was meant to be fun.  Doesn't mean you can't use this seriously to practice your stroke.  The mat is nice and long but does take a while to flatten itself down from it's initial rolled packaging condition.  Unlike other electric putting set, this one has a nice background.  I have loads of fun with this thing.

I thought these were going to be ok, but they do not bring any detail to the distant object being viewed.  I used these for just a little while and then bought a lighter and much less stiffer pair from Eagle.  Love them (from Eagle), though.  I guess these are ok for the beginner, but if you want to see detail, pass on them.

I chose  this as something fun for my Grandson to play with ( he is 12 yrs old)  . My thinking was that it will be fun and also give him some exercise/ movement, and  he would have to use his  head to figure out how to make a better shot.  It can also be used indoors which is a plus when those NC Thunderstorms roll in.  I am a firm believer in getting  kids outside  wither to play sports or a walk in the woods.  All the electronic toys they have these days are nice BUT  kids still need to experience the great outdoors.  He has a lot of fun with this and  after awhile started to challenge himself  .  It is easy to assemble. Does not need electricity. Does not take up a  lot of room and is very portable!  I wouldn't say it is the most rugged piece of equipment but then it is not something that  would get the work out/ abuse other sports related equipment might get.might get.  The ball return is nice feature especially for impatient kids. Price wise I would say it is over priced  .

My 6 year old is a budding golfer and we got him this putting mat to practice.  I like the variety of hazards and that it automatically returns the balls.  It is well made, and doesn't take up much room to store.
Very clear view, and easy to get in focus at any range. Brought these mainly for use on our property but will take them when walking.

OK I admit that is s little corny.The glasses are super. I had always wanted some good optics but the prices had always put me off until I decided the extra cost in headache relief wasn't worth it.I researched some and bought me a pair of H2O roof prism 8x42s which I loved and found a great deal on these which I ordered for my wife.These are a tad bit better and the Audubon Society endorsment stamped on the barrel is an extra bit of assurance.This pair also had a Bausch & Lomb pamphlet! My wife has started using every day from the breakfast room or sun room looking at the birds in the back yard.Sure beat the bargain levels we were using without breaking the bank. Both pairs will be with us when we travel from now on.PS the case is roomy, padded and can carry some extra objects when travelling. Nice touch.
Good lenses, not too heavy, great field of vision and multiple ways to adjust focus. An excellent set of binoculars at a very good price.

We considered many brands and options before choosing Bushnell 8 x 42.  We have used them extensively for sight seeing at the grand canyon and in our mountain cabin.  We love them!  Simple to adjust, light weight, and amazing clarity.  I highly recommend.....

This was a Christmas present for my wife.  She wears glasses and has always had trouble with binoculars.  These have special feature expecially for glasses wearers.  The picture is clear and bright, the binoculars are easy to hold, focus and adjust to accomodate glasses.  My wife is ecstatic about these binoculars.

I have had a Bushnell 8X42 Natureview pair i of binoculars for years and yearsand they finally just wore.  I cannot tell you how many rivers and birds I haveviewed through them.  I am now much older and only have my backyard feeder fromwhich to watch birds.  Fortunately, also a stream.  So I bought another paid andI am very pleased.  Makes my old age just a bit better as I loved birding.
A little heavy, but was able to see the sights I wanted to see. Used them for whale, glacier and wildlife viewing.

Binoculars are fair.  Made in China stuff.  Case is junk - thin plastic.  I worry it will not hold up and may break, dropping and  damaging the binoculars.  If you look through the binoculars just right they are very good but there is a dark spot that can mar the image.  Not the quality I had hoped for $90.
Excellent.  Just the right combination of power (8x) and lens diameter (42 mm).  Rugged, durable, not too heavy.  Fold-down eyecups are great when wearing glasses.

I love them!  We just built a new house for retirement which is situated overlooking a large pond.  Daily, there is always something "happening" on the pond.  Have these binoculars readily available to catch the activity as it happens!
I read all the reviews and was excited about this. I love this piece but the renditions of it on here were completely boring. I threw the CD out.
My husband is loving this music.  I, myself am not that fond of it. Have to listen for yourself to see how it makes you feel.

This cd is like listening to angels singing!  Awesome for meditation or relaxation.  I'm really glad I bought it.  I've had several friends and family members asking where I got it and wanting to get a copy.

This album takes Alleluia to new heights, sing-chanting the word to Pachelbel's Canon in D. The experience begins with gentle harp accompaniment, and then voices join in, singing "Alleluia" for  each part added in the Canon. As the Canon builds, so do the voices and the  multiple choral parts. This creates a guided "wave" effect in  experiencing the peace-bringing mantra "Alleluia". The entire  Alleluia chant lasts almost half an hour, and tapers off in the end to the  gentle harp accompaniment as the last Alleluia fades away.  I have bought  copies of this album for many friends!The "Kyrie" section  seems much heavier and more mechanical, but in the right frame of mind,  could be a worshipful experience.
summary: An exhilarating experience for the soul.

reviewText: Purchased these binoculars after using my sister's Eagle Optics binoculars while birding at a migratory hotspot. Her binoculars were such an improvement over mine that I went online and found the Cornell University site that reviews and rates binoculars. The Bushnell binoculars were highly rated at by the Cornell reviewers so I purchased them. I wear glasses and the eye pieces adjust easily to accomodate my glasses. I use them primarily for birding and have found the optics sharp and the binoculars easy to focus. These binoculars weigh less than some of the other ones I looked at and that is important to me since I have neck and shoulder pain sometimes. I am very happy with my Bushnell binoculars.
Bought this because I heard a short portion at my chiropractor's office and loved it. If you were into chanting, this might be what you want. I thought they would vary it a bit- not so.

The traditional Alleluia is married to the Canon in D by Johann Pachelbel, and it's a marriage made in heaven.  Listening to this piece, you'd think it was what Pachelbel had in mind as he was writing his melody.  Buy several copies.  People you know have birthdays coming up...
This is my second copy of this CD.  I just love it.  It's great for meditation and for doing body work on people.
I heard this CD for the first time at David Hawkins recent seminar and had to buy it. I'm glad I did. I can feel it in my chakras.

This is one of the best song/music meditations I've come across to date!  This is a beautiful, enchanting CD. I sing along with it and the repetition, along with the harmonies, takes me to a calm and fluid state of mind. I highly recommend this musical meditation and I'm so happy to have purchased it.

I wanted something to help my husband relax and fall asleep when he is in a lot of pain. This CD is very soothing,  simple and heavenly; good for hypnotherapy type of relaxing. I have listened to it before bed and love it also. We got another CD title Lectio Divina but it really was not- but this CD is - it takes a simple phrase and prayerfully repeats it until it is part of one's mind, heart, and soul.

I found this CD mind-numbingly boring to the nth degree and supremely wish I'd never squandered my money on such a monotonous, repetitious, and excrutiatingly irritating rendetion of a piece of music which needs no such affectatious imbellishment!  The addition of these words actually reduces the pleasure received from listening to the piece unadorned (ie, it was like fingernails on a blackboard).
These two chants, especially Kyrie, have the ability to shift me to a deeper space almost instantaneously.  Great for retreats.
I find this CD very soothing and uplifting.  I listen to this CD often as background music while working from home.
This CD was uplifting, I played it while working in the house and found it rejuvenating.It also calms the baby.

This music soars, I have owned this CD since 1994 and listen to it almost daily.  This music has the spirit of god all through it.  With only two (songs)on this album, Robert Gass brings you to a deep space in prayer.  First with 30 minutes of alleluia interwoven and blended only as angles can  sing this chant will help you recall all that you can truly say  "alleluia" to.  The second cut on this album Kyrie, is very much  a cry from the heart of all mankind, "Kyrie Elesion" from the  latin "Christ have mercy".  Surely we all can think of something  that we could ask the creator to give us a little more mercy for.  With 25  voices chanting to some kind of middle eastern tempo this chant rocks!  Awesome work from Robert Gass!
Been searching for years for meditation music. This CD has only 2 pieces of music on it, but each one builds from simple to complex and back to simple again. Works perfectly for my meditation style.

Alleluia and Kyrie are one of the 2 most beautiful songs there are in the world.Absolutely beautiful - puts you touch with the most beautiful and importantDo yourself a favor - get this album and listen to it many times... you will love it.  :)You will probably also like:Arvo Part - Da Pacem Domine == incredibly beautiful songKrishna Das - Om Namaha Shiva  == Awesome great song also - more energetic  than the others.  :)Aeoliah - Angels of Victory == beautiful song also :)Deuter -  basically all of the songs are great
summary: Alleluia and Kyrie -- The most beautiful songs there are in the World :D

reviewText: The CD is wonderful.  Well done and the song selections have a great rythum.
Oh, this is such divine cathedral music.  It is so beautiful and very well done.  You can just close your eyes and you're in a cathedral.

This cd is surprisingly good, the only problem I have with it is that J. Bowen was not that good of a singer, I thought,and about half of the songs on here are sung by him, but Buddy's singing makes up for it and makes it a enjoyable cd, altogether, not bad.

For the large percentage of the world that knows and loves the religion that is cricket (like Scott), this CD will become a favorite. For  Australians like myself, raised on hot summers watching Ritchie Benaud and  the crew commentate on Australian battles, the 12th Man's work is the  Gospel according to Saint Hilarious!
summary: Cricket is the only sport played in heaven.

reviewText: I was a big Buddy Knox fan as a teen in the late 50s.  As far as Jimmy Bowen is concerned I had a copy of his "Warm Up To Me Baby" (which is not included on this CD) but didn't really recall any other of his recordings.All the big Buddy Knox hits are included.  One notable that is lacking is Buddy's "Whenever I'm Lonely" which is one of my favorites.  For some reason Jimmy Bowen recorded a very mediocre version of the song which is on his section of the CD.  I'm not sure there was any reason for Buddy to remake "Mary Lou" & "Maybelline" since they were far better done by the original artists, Ronnie Hawkins & Chuck Berry.  But overall, considering all the Knox classics included, it's a nice collection.Jimmy Bowen's offerings were in my opinion fair to poor.  I really couldn't get into any of his songs.  His hit recording of "By The Light Of the Silvery Moon" is nothing to write home about and his version of "Blue Moon" is just annoying.  Why he decided to make his own version of Knox's "Whenever I'm Lonely" is a mystery.  While I'm sure that Jimmy can pick a guitar with the best of them he just doesn't have the voice to carry any of these tunes.  Fortunately he later found his nitch as a successful record producer.

This has got to be the funniest CD I have ever heard. The guy is hilarious with his brilliant impressions of all the favourite commentators, including Tony Greig, Bill Lawrie, and Richie Benaud. If you like cricket, this CD is  for you.

For those who appreciate the subtlety and sometimes crude humour that is so popular in the UK and all over the world, this is an absolute must. Very "Alan Partridge" like in presentation, it is a spoof on real life  commentary on sports and the personalities behind the scenes. It can be  offensive if you are over sensitive, but if like myself you are more  interested in the pure comedy instead of political correctness, put this at  the top of your shopping list.It's a cracker!

A great album. Australian comedian Billy Birmingham (aka the 12th Man) does an hilarious take of Bill Lawry, Tony Greig, Richie Benaud, and the rest of Australia's Channel Nine commentary team in this special release packaged for the UK market. The two albums packaged here are called "12th Man Again/Still the 12th Man" in Australia, and the "Just Not Cricket" track from the 1980's appears on the "Wired World of Sports" compilation. So if you're an Aussie who already has those, there's no reason to get this.But anyway, on to the album. It's Just Not Cricket was the first major release by the 12th Man, and it's bloody hilarious. Richie goes through a wrap up of the scorecard for the day's play, with Sri Lankan players such as "Shewanda Piasuriya". The 1990 release of "12th Man Again" is included, with hilarious musings from not only Richie and Tony, but Bill, Max, and Geoff in the control room. Probably one of the better releases in the 12th Man's catalogue is included here, the 1992 release "still the 12th man". It follows a day in the life of Richie, with a hijacking of the commentary box by Bill and Tony, as well as Richie being locked in with Max, taking a SWAT team to get him out of there.

Guitarist/vocalist Buddy Knox (born in Happy, Texas on July 20, 1933), bassist/vocalist Jimmy Bowen (born in Santa Rita, New Mexico on November 30, 1937) & The Rhythm Orchids (guitarist Don Lanier and drummer Dave Aldred who would later become a member of Dicky Doo & The Don'ts), were among the originals of R&R; and between them, from 1957 to 1961, put 14 songs onto the Billboard Pop Top/Hot 100, with two R&B; cross-overs, taking turns fronting the Rhythm Orchids on 9, with Buddy adding 5 more as a solo artist and, in 1968, adding one to the Country charts. And although Buddy is an inductee into the Rockabilly Hall Of Fame, he continues to be ignored by those empty-headed members of the board of the R&R; Hall Of Fame.This Collectables release pulls together two Roulette albums, tracks 1 to 12 from the 1957 LP "Buddy Knox" (Roulette 25003) and 12 to 23 from the 1958 LP "Buddy Knox & Jimmy Bowen" (Roulette 25048), with excellent sound and 3 pages of notes by Mark Marymont along with the original LP sleeve notes. In terms of their nationally-charting singles, the two albums included 4 of those billed as Buddy Knox & The Rhythm Orchids and 3 of their B-sides, 2 charting singles billed only as Buddy Knox, and 1 charting single and its B-side billed as Jimmy Bowen with The Rhythm Orchids. Their complete singles history, both charted and non-charted including Buddy's 2 hits with Liberty Records, is shown in the Comments below with an asterisk (*) preceding those included in this release.The fact that Buddy was the more talented and charismatic of the two was born out by the decision of Roulette to release simultaneous singles showing Buddy Knox with The Rhythm Orchids and Jimmy Bowen with The Rhythm Orchids, and the obvious preference of the fans for Buddy's material. That began with their first hit, Party Doll which was initially released in 1956 on their own label, Triple-D 798 billed as Buddy Knox with The Rhythm Orchids b/w I'm Stickin' With You billed as Jimmy Bowen with The Rhythm Orchids. After leasing it to Blue Moon 402 the strong showing regionally by both sides prompted Roulette to pick it up and then  split the sides into separate discs. Bowen's side, as Roulette 4001, reached # 14 Top 100 in March-April 1957 b/w Ever Lovin' Fingers (also charting at  # 63), while Party Doll, as Roulette 4002, surged to # 1 Top 100 and # 3 R&B; in the same stretch b/w My Baby's Gone.That simultaneous release pattern would continue more or less into 1958 and always the Buddy Knox sides came out ahead, as you will see from the results shown in the Comments.If you're looking for more of their charting sides I would highly recommend the 2-CD 61-track 1996 set from Sequel of the U.K.Buddy Knox sadly passed away after battling cancer at age 66 on Valentine's Day 1999. If Gene Vincent and Eddie Cochran are in the R&R; Hall Of Fame, then they have to induct Buddy Knox.
summary: Collectables Pulls Together Two Roulette LPs From 1957-1958

reviewText: You've gotta have the 12th man cd's in your collection.Some of his jokes at first sound a bit dry,but they kind of stick with you,and you end up walking around saying What A Catch and A Marvellous Effort That!The situations he creates are very humorous.He loves hanging it on Bill and Tony.Great stuff.

I love Ewan MacColl's work, and I downloaded this expecting it to be a collection of traditional fishing songs. I was pleasantly surprised to find it was a whole vintage radio show of interviews and music from the herring ports. A fantastic listen!
Well gang, this is one amazing film.  It has all the favorites, from the A-Train to my hero Trent Dilfer.  I highly recomment this video for anyone who is interested in real football...END
summary: I just loved the highlights, honey.

reviewText: I remember, back in the early sixties, my Dad telling me how wonderful Ewan McColl's radio ballads and particularly Singing the Fishing were. The problem was I  had to  take that on faith because they had only been heard on radio and had never been issued on record. Sure, some of the songs (The Shoals of Herring, the North Sea Holes and others) had made it onto record but I  had no way of knowing what a masterpiece this was. Finally, in the 70s, it got published on Argo. Even the opening announcements, in perfect BBC English, were exciting. I was mesmerized. I wish I had a way of explaining just how good this is and why. It is a documentary but it is so much more than that. It is about singing but that only begins to say what it is. Look at the price and think how often you have paid more than that for an indifferent dinner. To be able to pay that llittle for a masterpiece?
summary: A classic in the true sense of the word - excellent

reviewText: A great collection of Haindling's older and most famous songs. My number one album so far.

I saw this on the BBC years ago and was reminded of it since the character folk singer Llewyn Davis sings its pivotal song to his senile father and gets a reaction from him in the Coen Brothers recent movie.The song is Shoals of Herring by Ewen MacColl and the CD features fishermen singing traditional songs and talking about the herring fishing that even in the fifties was on the decline.in the North Sea.
summary: Love the song "Shoals of Herring" and it was sung, beautifully, in thr Coen Bros. latest movie

reviewText: My sister loved the gift! She was extremely excited to see this version of monopoly! Arrived quick and in perfect shape!
summary: Cool and awesome gift for lovers of Baltimore!

reviewText: bought used but I knew the product I was getting and I expected to look a little worn , no complaints here.

This new Atlanta-based group is nothing less than astounding and brings a fresh chilling sound.  Billed as hard rock or alternative rock, it's actually difficult to put a tag on them.  The music is strong and vibrant it let's you know its here.  I woke up at 2 AM the other morning and heard the beat and lyrics in my head.  That's never happened before.  Magda, the group's singer has a delightfully strong and versatile voice that blasts out in pure sincerity straight from the heart.  I'm looking forward to more of this.

E-Toys should be ashamed of themselves for selling such a poorly constructed toy. Ours arrived with scratches and gouges all over the horse. The quality of the assembly was akin to something you'd get from a candy machine. The real kicker was how poorly assembled the wheels in each hoof were. One was assembled so off kilter that it interfered with the hoof and wouldn't even turn! (hmmm, you'd think that'd get caught in quality control???)We're waiting to see if E-Toys will have the integrity to cover the shipping costs back. Big disappointment.
summary: What a disappointment - very poor quality

reviewText: This toy has been around for some time and is a "Classic," More fun than the usual rocking horse for kids. I know that my son would love one, unfortunately it's never available!
summary: It would be Great to Get One if Amazon Ever Gets it in Stock

reviewText: My adult children had this toy 30 years ago and loved it.  I was thrilled to find it for my granddaughter who was 22 mo. at Christmas and weighed 23 lbs.  Her aunt out west sent her a real cowgirl hat and chaps.  First, putting it together was difficult as the inside was not turned properly.  Customer service helped and we had received an extra part we were told.  After one month of a 22 year old (not a wild child) basically pushing it around, it is broken--almost sagging to the floor.I hate to say this but they don't make toys like they used to.
summary: Whoa!! before you buy this toy!

reviewText: I was lucky enough to find this toy at a garage sale and thought it was the cutest thing I have ever seen, especially when you push the button and the horse whinnies. The only problem is that my two year old does not weigh very much and therefore can't get it to move...I found that you have to put quite a bit of weight on it and then release that weight almost completely to get it to "ride" which may be difficult for very young toddlers...this horse may be perfect for a three year old or so though! Too Cute!

Our son who is 31 years old had Marvel the Mustang when he was young.  He enjoyed it so much. It was great for a young active boy.  He felt just like he was riding a horse.  Marvel never broke.  Wish we had kept the original one. Now I look forward to our grandson having the same toy.  Thank you "Back to Basics!

I received my Marvel Horse in August 1974 for my 4th birthday and still have him and photos of me riding him around the house on the hardwood floors.  What fun I had.  The best toy I ever had!  The only toy I really remember!  I'm so glad Marvel the Mustang is still around for children to enjoy.  I had hoped to pass my Marvel on to my children one day, but unfortunately due to a spinal cord injury I probably won't ever have children.  But at least I know that when there is a special child in my life, I can give the greatest gift - Marvel. Great riding for children who have lots of energy and love horses.
summary: 30 Years Old & Still have my original Marvel Horse!

reviewText: I bought this as a Chrismas gift for my 3 year old. The horse doesn't move when she gets on it to ride. Thank God she has a big brother to pull her around on it or it would have been a total waste.

The mustang is beautiful, but functionally, it's below average.  The horse is so stiff that my 2 year old son cannot make it move. Adjustments to make it more flexible don't work.  The engineers for Marvel need to do more work on this mustang.

I was disappointed that the mechanism that makes the horse go up and down is very stiff and does not allow a small child under the age of five to work it. I don't know if I received a defected product. I would be interested to know if you have had this comment before. My four year old that weighs 40 lbs.can not make the horse work. It says that children under 60 lbs. should not use it.I would appreciate your response.Lisa Ficarra Shepherd
RIOT RIOT UPSTART is a great HARDCORE album from AGNOSTIC FRONT!!!!! It's PURE CLASSIC HARDCORE...FAST, RAW and HEAVY!!!!!!WELL DONE, AGNOSTIC FRONT!!!!!!!!!!

I had to leave this review after reading all the other reviews.  I did have one of these when I was little and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I saw one at a resale shop years ago and snagged it for my neices who loved it.  And well I bought one for my first child too.  As for difficulty riding... that is nonsense.  My daughter has been riding her Marvel since the age of 18 months unassisted.  Prior to doing it herself, we would bounce her along or she would lead him around the house.  But once she wanted to ride by herself she just did.  She herself bounces up and down and he moves right along.  Now at the age of 2 she is 35inches tall and 33lbs and she rides him even better.  She still does not put her feet on the foot rest as she just pushes off the floor... but when her legs are long enough, I am sure she will.  The toy is for age 2-5 and so I assume the height and weight range are variables in ease of use.  But I can attest that coordination is needed.  And nothing more than my 18month old could handle.  It would be beneficial to know your child's skill level before purchasing any toy.  But if you are like me... I just enjoy giving my child different toys to stimulate her problem solving through a tactile environment.
summary: Had one as a kid and bought one for my neices and now my own child.

reviewText: STRONG,POWERFUL RELEASE BY ONE OF HARDCORE'S FINEST. I STARTED LISTENING TO THE FIRST SONG AND WAS ALREADY BREAKING THINGS.LOVE IT!

This is a very expensive greatest hits CD.  The first disc is 40 minutes long and the second is 52 minutes.  The sound quality is very good.  The packaging is very cheesy looking.  This is the second cover.  The earlier cover showed photos of the band playing live.While the music on this CD rates 5 stars, I only give it one star because it is another misleading BMG product and because it so expensive.  At this price, you would be better off buying the first 3 PFM CD's.Gli Anni Settanta translates to "The Seventies".  If you know Italian, you might guess that this is a compilation CD, but wouldn't know for sure.  With the cover, especially the original, you might think this is a live CD (which I did when I bought it).BMG can be a very evil record company that repackages music with misleading covers, so you end up buying music you already have.  Their biggest scam is the "Extended Versions" series, which is just repackaged live albums.  No wonder CD sales are down.The CD contains tracks from all of the Italian PFM studio albums from the seventies.  Some of the PFM albums were reworked for the English market with new English lyrics written by Pete Sinfield, of early King Crimson.  However, none of those English versions are included on this set.  I prefer the Italian versions, as the English lyrics were dumb, and the group did not speak English or understand what the lyrics meant.I would recommend buying one of the early PFM CD's, like Impression de Septembre instead of this and seeing if you like it.  If you do, you will want to get the rest.PFM's studio music was lush, rich and multi-layered.  It is very beautiful.PFM was a totally different group live.  They were a jamming and rocking band.  You might want to check out Live In the USA (called "Cook" in the US) or the great boxset Gli Anni Live.

This game is terrible!  NBA Live 97, 98, 99... (EA Sports)are much better.  Insidedrive gives the minimum gameplay options, only season, playoff, single game, and practice modes.  No custom teams or players. I was stupid by not returning it.

I know, all you non-skin head punks are probably thinking that all Epitaph released Agnostic Front CDs would HAVE to be 5 stars. Well, I would have thought that too. But I was wrong. Sure "Something's Gotta Give", and "Dead Yuppies" are great but "Riot Riot Upstart" really lacks something (by AF standards). On "Riot Riot Upstart", the background music is purposely muffled a lot. Sure, it is like that on pretty much all Agnostic front CDs but this was much more muffled than usual. Not to mention it wasn't really that hard either. The simplicity, muffledness and lightness in the background music really leave something to be desired. The vocals on the other hand are as loud as ever. In fact the lead singer seemed to be focusing more on singly loudly then singing well on a lot of the songs. The lyrics aren't that great either. They have the same lyrical flaw that a lot of their earlier work did. That flaw is that the lyrics really only apply to people in New York. Not everywhere. If you don't live in New York, most of the songs have nothing at all to do with the society you know of. Either that or it is about being a skin head which also doesn't apply to me. Don't get me wrong. This is still a good CD. However, I would recommend picking up their 2 other Epitaph releases, and the digitally enhanced "One Voice" first.

I somehow managed to enjoy this album a lot more than "Something's Gotta Give."  Roger's lyrics on this one sound better.  He's much easier to understand, doesn't sound like he's gut wrenching as much as SOME of A.F.'s other releses, and the lyrics are catchier.  The songs aren't as Hardcore as A.F. usually is, but their written pretty well regardless.  Bottom line:  far from the best, but better than the worst. A.F. still has it, but they're just a lil different now.  Good effort, all around.

I loved this game. It was well made and was worth buying. If you do not like sports games this game is stupid. But if you love them you should pick up NBA Inside Drive 2000, from Microsoft or any shop..

This is a great game, if you don't feel like spending the money on NBA live '2,000. Latrell spreewell is the best player on the game. The computer is not easy to beat either. Buy this game, you're in for a treat!

Just because this game does not have a good franchise mode does not mean that it should be regarded as a one or two star game. I found that the graphics were awesome and the exhibition games were great. This game can be good for many hours of non franchise fun. The seasons are not that bad just because you cant make more players or teams and you cant carry on seasons. Microsoft spent a lot more time on graphics and gameplay than frachise mode, the opposite tactics of the NBA Live Creaters: EA Sports.This game is not a 3 star game. Worth about 4.5, i think i should give it a 4 because it does not display the qualities of a 5 star game.

This is one of the more quiet of Osho's meditation techniques. In the first phase, each part being 15 min., you do a special breathing technique, where you retain the breath after both in and out breath, breathing in through the nose and out through the mouth and holding the breath as long as possible. In the second you gaze at a candle (or a special lamp with blue, stroposcobic light), kind of tratak, while the third phase is latihan, standing up and letting the body move freely in slow, organic movements.In the fourth you lie down with closed eyes, leaving the everyday mind and its chatter behind and opening up for a meeting with deeper parts of yourself.Gourishankar is the Indian name for Mt.Everest, and it's said, that if you do the breathing in the first phase optimally, you will be as high as this mountain (havn't experienced that I have to say, but still hoping that someday...).This enhanced version has a videosegment helping the beginner to the best possible start (and of course instructions in the booklet).

This is a cute little kitten. He is a nice golden or tan color. He is very durable. He also has white paws, and white in the ears. His nose is cute and pink with white wiskers. He would be a nice addition to any cat collection.
I can't say there's anything special about him except my late husband's name was Nip and he loved cats.  I have many beanie babies but he is special for sentimental reasons.
Good toy, My daughter love it! this is the toy she play much longer than all other toys she owned before.
My granddaughter had one like this one for years and recently lost it.  Found this one and it was exactly like the one my granddaughter received years ago.  Very pleased with this item.

Ty Beanie Babies Nip the Cat and her sisterTy Beanie Babies Silver the Catperch on the dashboard of my SUV and keep me company. Sometimes they sing along with the CD (if they know the song), sometimes they nap, and sometimes they just purr and purr.They've been with me all winter. Before, they sat with the other Beanie Babies and whiled their time away. One day they spoke up: "Hey, Mom. We want excitement." I didn't know who was talking. I admit I was startled, but finally I located the tiny talking cats. That's when they let me know they were bored and needed adventure. Being the adventurous sort myself, I loaded them up, set them up, and we've been a threesome ever since.There's nothing like some fine kitty friends to keep one company traveling through city streets on the way somewhere. I recommend it. After all, the choices are amazing!!Come summer I will move them to a cooler spot. It is mighty hot on the dash for two bewitching kitties.
My granddaughter needed this mdse for a school report on Amelia Earhart--She had to give the report and dress the part--She was delighted with the Helmet and goggles--

It's a nice plastic rack, with two standard high-quality decks of cards, and the crappiest chips I've ever seen. The chips have big gobs of flashing on every edge. You'll need to trim them with a knife (that should only take an hour or two) before you can use them. And don't bother trying to stack them with standard Ace or even Bicycle's own boxed chips -- the serrations are much coarser.
Perfect for dressing up if you need an aviator costume. Even though it is adult size, it fit my child who needed it for a project for school.
If you are Looking for an authentic type aviator hat with attached goggles which could stimulate a child's interest in airplanes this product is not it.

I was a little disappointed at the size of the wheelbarrow, I had expected it to be somewhat bigger. Definitely for the little ones to wheel around, and not for adults to assist, unless you want a bad back to follow. Still, it was very simple to put together and was durable in our graded and bumply garden.
summary: Compact but good on rough grass.

reviewText: Yes, it's just a cheap blow-up bottle but it served it's purpose for our costume.  My son was Ninjini from Skylanders and this was great because it was lightweight and I attached a magnet to it and his shirt so he could have it on his back (Ninjini throws some sort of power-attack from her bottle).  Don't have high expectations but it worked for us!

This item is advertised as a replica of the I dream of Jeannie bottle from the series of the same name.  It's an inflatible item as stated by the vendor.  The problem is it's very difficult to inflate and even when you do (and it takes a long time) it is not a "replica" of the I dream of Jeannie Bottle.  It's described in a mis-leading matter and after this I found a real replica and it's night and day.  This one I deflated but that sure didn't take long.I feel it's also a high price between the tag price and shipping for what it is.  It looks like something you'd float in a pool.

This is a hard-to-find trackball controller that gives an arcade feel to old-school games such as Missile Command, Centipede, Crystal Castles, and Marble Madness. The trackball gives you much more precision than a hand controller with the aforementioned games. The trackball itself is solid plastic and rolls smoothly in all directions. There are buttons on either side of the trackball for left or right-handed play, and also a turbo switch on top in case you want rapid fire. Overall I am very pleased with this controller and would recommend it highly.

this track ball is great but it only works with PS1 mouse compatable games. PS2 GAMES WILL NOT WORK. best disc to use (ATARI ANNIVERSARY EDITION REDUX)for PS1. and (MIDWAY'S ARCADE'S GREATEST HITS THE ATARI COLLECTION 1 and 2) PS1. can be used on PS2 while playing PS1 games.

I used to own this product, until it broke a couple years ago, and had a very hard time finding it again, until now!I DO have all the old retro-games for my PS2, and would love to be able to play them again....the way they were meant to be played (Centipede, Crystal Castles, Marble Madness)I grew up on these games, and own them on my PS2 system, and still love playing them, but, using the OEM controller is NOT easy.

i bought atari classics and this . i was hoping for the old 80's missle command expierence the game ruled . this controller was incompatible. i looked it up very few games actually work with this! booo!
summary: only has 4 buttons incompatible with most games

reviewText: One of the two best multi-tools on the market today. (the other being the Leatherman SuperTool 200)PROS:1) Strong pliers with comfortable grip2) All blades can open while pliers are closed and all blades lock3) Useful Chisel blade4) Anti-rust finish5) Heavy Duty steelCONS:1) The file on the "X" model seems to be made of aluminum. After some use the "steel" plating chipped off. The Leatherman file is much tougher and can be used on wood or metal.2) You might break your nails trying to open the blades.*UPDATE*>> I sold sold the "X" model and purchased the "RS" model thereby trading the cheap file for a curved serrated blade. I like this tool much better now.

This is my second Swiss Tool, I lost my first one about a month ago.  I got the first one as a gift and was very impressed with the quality of its construction. I found it built rugged enough where I could use it just like a regular set of tools.  Other replacement multi-tools just seemed to flimsy for me.  I discovered that it was hard to live without.

This is a high quality precise well made piece of art. Also the steel used in this tool is of high quality and not brittle like other tools. I gave this tool five stars. I give leatherman and gerber tools three stars each. If you don't believe me put this tool in one hand and any other tool you wish to compare in the other hand and compare. The only thing I like to have in this tool (new version) is a larger scissors. The one I have has small scissors. They are fine but a larger one will make them more practical.UPDATE:This review is for the new version tool (the one with scissors). I recently bought a Leatherman Wave tool...try to compare the two and give an honest opinion about the quality and the practicality of the two. The finish and the built quality of the Swiss tool is much better than the Leatherman. There is really a big difference here. The Vic. Swiss Army tool has a bigger and smoother pliers. The Leathermans Wave tool has too many small useless low quality bits without locking system. The Victorinox tool has an excellent smooth locking system that keeps the bit you use in place (think safety). The Swiss tool was designed to make it easy to open the bits you want to use. On the other hand, I have to figure out how to open the small bits in the Leathermans. You open one of the bits you don't want just to open the one you want hoping there is enough friction between the two bits (poor design).The truth I returned the Leatherman Wave...because there is a big big difference between the two tools. The only good thing in the Leatherman is the metal file...The Swiss saw is an efficient fast great wood saw. Gerber new models may compete with Swiss Tools but The steel seems to be brittle and prone to breakage. I bought an extra (new version) Swiss Tool...The balistic pouch is of low quality...The tool is still high quality Swiss made. However, you can buy a high quality leather pouch from eknifeworks...The truth is that the Swiss Tool is the best tool I saw and used so far with a wide margin.

This is a fantastic multi-tool, incredibly durable. However, there are two versions, this version and the "RS" version. Beware that this version does not include scissors. If you are used to regular swiss army knife scissors, you might think that missing scissors isn't a big deal. Not so with this tool. I've had the "RS" version, with scissors, for over 5 years and the scissors still work fantastic. I would highly recommend getting the version with scissors. I own both, and the scissors are sorely missed on this one.
summary: Best multi-tool out there - NO SCISSORS

reviewText: I purchased my swisstool when I came back from my tour in south korea back in August 2000. I've still got it today and it works great. I've been in Europe, Asia, Kuwait, and Iraq and it's nice to have. The Army had given me a leatherman and I used it till I shopped around and saw the swisstool. I quickly noticed the flaws from the leatherman, like you don't have to open up the tool to get a knife or screwdriver out. It's quick access. I've given this as a gift to my dad and brothers. This tool is the best among other multi-tools.
Product of high quality and to shared in common prices. The salesman gave the product he offered as it, would return to him to buy in the future.

title says it all. i am a tradesman and i use a multitool EVERYDAY. this thing is solid, its heavy and i admit i use this in ways the manufacturer would not approve, and it holds up. and has held up. ive broken blades and shipped it back to victorinox, they shipped me out a new one. ive gone through 3 of these in 13 years and i admit the reasons for failure are mine alone. i have destroyed gerber, leatherman, and sog within months of using. the swisstool will last years of my abuse.
summary: Best multitool I've used, hands down.

reviewText: I once had Victorinox Swiss Army Tool had it for ten years or more. That was to me a very useful tool. I used it everywhere I go and so I know what this tool looks like and feel like. There nothing like the original Victorinox Tool and once more its pretty hard to know what your getting without looking at it or feeling it. That's online shopping, there is know way to know just what you are getting. Let me just say by now you would know what you are getting online shopping. I'm a person that if something I see I like pretty much know when I get it if it don't have the WoW factor, then you just wasted my time. Here is the bottom line, if its not of organically than it not wrath having.Regards,delcast

The Victorinox SwissTool is one of my favorites. I have other MultiTools and prefer this one overall. The handles are smooth and comfortable where you grip them. Some tools out there are terrible in this regard. All the surfaces are rust proof shiny stainless steel. I will not compare this tool with a knife or other "one-handed" opening cutting device since it is not a fair comparison. That means if you are looking for something you can snap the blade open with one hand then go find yourself a knife made for that purpose. This is a TOOL. It is strong and has many useful tools attached. Personally I would not want my knife blade to pop open while I am holding it in one hand. Yikes! All the tools have a great snap closed position and the lock is very positive. I have not had any tool lock fail. Best of all the Victorinox name means quality and a great warranty should something go wrong with your tool.
summary: Swiss quality in a solid MultiTool

reviewText: I am an Airline Mechanic so I have the opportunity to see and test out all kinds of tools. Quite a few guys have the leatherman wave, probably the next best multitool, but I have seen quite a few of them go sloppy after much use because the only thing keeping it folded up is friction. The Swisstool on the other hand, uses leaf springs and locking mechanisms so the durability is head and shoulders above the leatherman. Some complain about the size, but if your looking for a TOOL and not a stocking stuffer, you are going to want the Swisstool... It is just a plain better guality tool.
summary: Best tool I've seen out there

reviewText: I've owned this multitool for five or six years, using it for everything from wiring, drywall and plumbing to skinning a beaver.  It has withstood tremendous use, and some abuse.  I find the serrated blade to be most useful.  The pliers are sturdy enough to do almost everything except the heaviest work you would normally use a lineman's pliers for.  The more typical "Swiss Army" tools (e.g. screwdrivers, blade, bottle and can opener) work just like they do in a typical SAK.  I've used the saw a few times to cut small branches and drywall, and it seems as sharp as new.  The only damage I've been able to do was to dull the wire cutters a bit; I only use them now on copper, and I overtorqued the smallest driver and twisted it a bit.  It seems to fit better in the hand than the Leatherman, though I haven't owned one of them.

I used to carry a well known name brand multitool until I found THREE superior options ( my decision was based on 40+ years as a fire fighter, police officer and bomb disposal technician ( EOD ). I have owned a number of multitools over the years and abused them all ( that's why the good ones have a lifetime warranty ). The three best for the money in my opinion are the 1. SOG Powerlock , 2. Victorinox SwissTool and 3. SOG Pocket PowerPlier - don't waste your money on anything else - no other multitool can come close to a SOG or Victorinox in performance, functionality and warranty. I do own other brand multitools and have a desk drawer full of them and they are used solely for opening envelopes and packages. When I need a multitool at work I want a `real' multitool that I can depend on to do the job at hand - the following 3 are my choices, depending on the assignment.The first rescue multi-tool worth your money is a SOG Powerlock ( various models are now available to suit your needs - " including the assisted opening "). I prefer the S66 because of the tool / implement selection. This folding tool isn't new, a fact that speaks to its highly regarded Compound Leverage mechanism that generates twice the pressure and gripping power of lesser tools. To wit: this thing is the Jaws of multitools. Beyond strength, you'll love the pivoting handle covers that really do improve comfort and dexterity. All the essential tools are intricately positioned for deployment and for you showoffs out there, the PowerLock's ability to open with a quick flick of the wrist is undeniably cool. The PowerLock features removable, pivoting handle covers that improve the comfort profile for your hand. More pressure can now be exerted on those tough jobs! Like the rest of the family in the series, the PowerLock can be opened and closed with a one-handed flip of the wrist. This is a basic requirement from SOG as so often one is holding wires or standing on a ladder and does not have both hands free. All tool components are easy to access and lock in the open position. The Phillips even locks in two open positions. With one of the simplest and safest locking devices ever engineered, just press the back of the lock and close the component into the handle. Included components in the S66 include a plier / gripper, 3" straight blade, 3" serrated blade,3 sided file,large screwdriver, Phillips screwdriver, small screwdrive, medium screwdriver, can opener, bottle opener, "V" cutter, wire crimper, blasting cap crimper, compound leverage, comfort grips, rulers and lanyard ring. The PowerLock also comes with a heavy-duty, dark leather pouch. A standard design issue with any SOG multipurpose tool is the advantage of it's hex bolt construction. This essential design element gives you the greatest versatility to clean and change tool components ( additional tool components are directly available from SOG for a modest charge) - with hex bolt construction holding the SOG's together - replacing tools is a snap. The SOG features all stainless steel construction ( also available in a black oxide finish #B66) and comes with a heavy duty leather pouch, a Lifetime Guarantee and they are MADE IN THE USA. Street price is around $55.00.The second multitool in the lineup is a Victorinox SwissTool which comes equipped with both a plain edge AND a serrated blade / seat belt cutter which can be life saving in a auto accident.  Victorinox Swisstools are quality unsurpassed , as are ALL of the lineup of Swiss Army Knives. The implements on the SwissTool are well thought out, each tool is individually accessible and locks securely in place. The knife blades are scary sharp and probably the sharpest of any production line knife made today, plus they are stainless steel. The heftyness of the tool speaks of it's quality, ruggedness and ability to do the job. I have broken the plier head jaws on several other manufacturers multitools , never on a Swisstool, including the smaller Swisstool Spirit, they are made to last a lifetime. I have had occasion to send Swiss Army Knives t Made in Switzerland with a lifetime warranty. Street price around $50.00.My most recent addition to the "Best of the Best multitools ", the third, in my arsenal of multitools and I find it adequate to do 99% of the jobs handled by the two mentioned above. Lighter and more compact than the SOG PowerLock, its big brother, the Pocket PowerPlier ( Model #S44 ) is very easy to carry and use. SOG's Pocket PowerPlier is packed with essential tools that include pliers/grippers, wire cutters, partially serrated blade, Phillips screwdriver, three-sided file, can opener with a small screwdriver, bottle opener with medium screwdriver, an awl, rulers, lanyard and heavy duty leather pouch. Again the PPP's advantage of hex bolt construction leaves all the other multitools running for cover as this essential design element gives you the greatest versatility to clean and change tool components ( additional tool components are directly available from SOG for a modest charge) not offered by other multitool manufacturers. With the interchangability you can replace the partially serrated blade with a 3" plain edge blade and I also removed the 3 sided file and replaced it with a serrated line cutter. I find carrying the PPP a benefit because of less weight hanging on my belt ( 5.5 ounces vs 9.6 ounces for the PowerLock) . Also noted is SOG's Deluxe Pocket PowerPlier ( Model S45) whichs adds a large screwdriver, 1/4 socket drive however it loses the awl as a tool and weighs in at 5.5 ounces - same as he S44 model. Backed by a Lifetime Guarantee and they are MADE IN THE USA. Street price around $45.00revised 05/2009
summary: Swisstool is a multitool you NEED to own ...

reviewText: I purchased this GEM when it first came out and have never regretted it.  My job requires me to do a variety of network installations from regular Phone lines to Ethernets.  The wire cutter and strippers have proven invaluable.  The Crosscut saw has proven a worthy  drywall saw, and the chisel has proven more handy then I could ever  imagined.  But one of the most outstanding feature that sets this knife a  step above the rest is the fact that each item securely locks into place  (no more worries about knocking your knuckles).  If you need a SOLID  multi-tool that can help you at home or on the job, You Have Found IT!
summary: Great Tool for the office or at home!

reviewText: I use it every day at work. The few days that I have forgotten it at home felt like missing a limb. My dad and I have been using this style of tool for years and it is definitely an electricians must have.

Pros:1) Good steel quality, excellence anti-rush finish, well build and heavy duty.2) Tools open individually (no clumping), lock in place, fold with push button. Feel comfortable in pliers mode.3) Victorinox's brand name and warranty, need i say more?Cons:1) You cannot adjust the tool yourself since you can't unscrew the tool, because it uses pins as the pivot pins.2) They should minus the big flat screwdriver and use individual spring.3) The file in original and x model seems to made of casehardened steel, so the plating will chipped off(i suggest the RS model the best)4) I hate that they use the cheap springs in the locking buttoms and the scissors, the springs will degrade over time.

The only thing that slightly bothers me is that the pliers are a little rougher (lot rougher than my SOG powerlock), but the implements are readily available (pliers closed).  I cut myself on the serrated blade on the first opening.  Remember that these are spring loaded implements and not loose like the Leatherman and Gerber (and *sigh* SOG)
This tool rocks.  Great construction.  Decent holster.  My only complaint is the difficulty it takes to unfold the numerous tools.
Everything about this knife is better than my leatherman super tool, except the shorter needle nose, and the wire cutters on the needle nose are half the length.
summary: Great knife, needs better wire cutters.

reviewText: I have great experience with that tool. In my work, all my technicians and my partners use that tool in a different kinds of field activities. The tools are versatile and durables. I tried the leatherman wave too, but itsn't the same quality. I recommend the Victorinox CS PLUS Model, with a useful scissors and a six bit set!!!

I own several multitools, in different brands. All have their pluses and minuses, all have at least one "cool" factor, as well as one or more questionable design choices. But if I had to pick just one, it would be the SwissTool.The SwissTool is not sexy, like Leatherman's "Wave" or their new "Charge" series. It doesn't have spring-loaded jaws that pop out at the touch of a button, like the Gerber "Recoil". And it doesn't have geared jaws like the SOG.However, what the SwissTool is, is jaw-droppingly precise, gorgeous, and superbly executed. The stainless steel is polished, not matte or roughened. Each tool is easy to get out, slides out by itself (not in a clump), and has just the right amount of friction. The fingernail nicks are positioned very well, so that you don't need another tool just to open this one. Once the tool is out, it locks into place so firmly you can tell you'd break the tool before the lock itself would fail. And when you need to put the tool back, the unobtrusive spring-loaded release lets you fold the tool back with no effort.While this page seems to list the basic SwissTool, when I ordered it, I received the RS model, which is the one I wanted anyway. The RS model does away with the metal file, metal saw, and serrated blade, and replaces it with scissors, and what Victorinox calls a "seatbelt cutter", which is a very sharp, curved serrated blade.As I said, I collect multitools, and none comes close to the individual tool precision, polished fit-and-finish, and comfortable heft of the SwissTool. When you factor in the low price (compared to other tools at this quality level), getting the SwissTool is a no-brainer.
If you like tools, and like swiss army knife you must have one of this series. Obviusly is not for a work shop but it's an excelent help in the field. And it came with a belt bag.

I really love this tool.  This was a replacement for one I had for years that was "borrowed" and never returned.  It is a bit heavier than Leatherman tools or some of the others, but that is because of its very high quality stainless and rugged construction.  Every edge is polished and rounded.  This tool feels good in your hands.  Extremely versatile.  It goes everywhere with me.

this tool is awesome and can do most anything, snip wire take anything apart and even a good hammer.I have had mine for a long time and just sent it off to be fixed under warranty gotta love it.this eviscerates the leather man devours the little gerber toys and laughs at the boker 125 years experience makes a perfect tool.

The SwissTool is by far the best built of all the multitools I've handled (including Leatherman, SOG and Gerber).  I have had mine for about a year and have used it for everything from fixing leaky faucets to replacing amateur radio antennas.  It is well made and extremely durable.  If you plan to make serious use of a multitool, you want the Victorinox product.  That said, it's not perfect; a slight redesign would make the knife blades easier to pull out.  They aren't terribly difficult to get to, but the design of the blades on the Leatherman Wave is a bit better.  On the other hand, while the Leatherman product is of good quality, it doesn't come close to the fit and finish of the SwissTool and isn't nearly as durable.  If you want a light weight multitool to throw in your backpack as a back-up knife, get the Leatherman.  If you want a more solidly built multitool where all the components really work, there is none better than the SwissTool.

Im not satisfied with the Item you send me. The swiss Tool you sent It is not the same as the referencial photo. It is not only that the Victorinox Label is not right, also the tools includes are not the same. This is an Misleading advertising.Other preocupant thing is that the victorinox swiss tool was not in perfect conditions, there are some scratches in the corners. I am a regular customer and it is the first time that I`m disapointed about any Amazon product. I did not write after because I Live in Venezuela and the product arrives yesterday.

I like this multi-tool a lot.  I took it camping in the grand canyon and tried the knives, can opener and a screwdriver.  All worked very well.  I even cut myself with the knife.  You really need to be careful with the blades they are extremely sharp.  I'm really impressed with the quality, but since it's from Victorinox I'm not really surprised.
This tool functions better than the "Leatherman" series - the implements extend, lock, unlock and reseat smoothly and the steel sharpens and keeps an edge better.

What first struck me was this thing is heavy compared to 20-30 dollar multi tools I have.  Everything fits with surgical precision.  The tools snap in place and are steady as a rock.  Quality like none other.
summary: Wow, this thing is like a work of art

reviewText: When I decided to buy a multi-tool last fall I did a thourough research on the Internet, reading up on what others said, then I went to the store to touch and feel the tools to really sense the difference, and I must agree: This is the best. My first choice, if I hadn't done my homework, would have been Leatherman, mainly because of brand recognition. I never regretted that I bought the Swiss Tool instead. Why?1. The best feature are the spring locks that lock each blade and tool securely. NO fumbling and accidental slips.2. The knife blades are razor sharp, even after long use, so is the saw.3.The size is comfortable, and you grip it very easily.P.S. I suggest you to get hold of the version with scissors. They may look small, but they're not wobbly at all.

I bought this from Sam's Club in 2003. It's been on my belt and used every day since then. Unlike other multi tools that I and friends have owned I've never broken any of the tools. None of them are worn to the point of not being usable either. I've been looking to get another one of these for a few years so that my wife or kids can have one as reliable the one I have so I'm glad to see Amazon carries them. None of the stores in my area sell it. Many of the cheaper ones sold locally do no have locking tools, which is a must for me. I use it for car, home, and computer repairs. I've even used it as a hammer when I didn't have one nearby, and yet it's still it perfect condition.Only the red paint has worn off, and there's some welding splatter from using it while welding. The rivets and hinges have not come loose like other models I've had either.
summary: One of the best multi tools out there!

reviewText: I purchesed my SwissTool about a year ago.The quality is excelent.All the Leatherman I have seen got loos shortly after they where perchesed, my SwissTool is still tight. I like the lock for all the tools and entry to all the tools from the outside with out haveing to open the tool is great.

This is absolutely the best multi-knife you could own.  It has all of the gadgets you would need and none of the fluff.  I've worn out 2 over the years (and I do mean years).  So of course - I'm getting another.  And here is a tip for you.  When you open up this or any other knife to turn it into a set of pliers - how sharp are the corners of the handles that dig into your palm and fingers???  This one has round corners when opened - so there is no dig.  Very comfortable to squeeze the pliers hard if necessary.
I bought this as a gift for my husband, who does logging for a living, and he loves this knife.  According to him it is better than his Leatherman, which he loves. Very well-made.

Have not received this yet but I will write the review because I am buying this as a replacement.  I have a leatherman, and It's nice, but this one is my favorite.  When I lost it I did not waste any time and ordered this one.  If I was stranded I would want to have this tool with me.  You won't be disappointed.
Its just amazing. Im really pleased with the swiss tool and its price. The only "bad" thing about this tool its its weight.
Our son uses these for everything...the only reason this is his third is because he wares them out! And he did loose one while helping someone on the highway!Highly recomend

Having had many Swiss Army Knives (Victorinox Multitools) in my scouting days I knew about Victorinox's quality. However, they became relegated to my knife drawer (it's a sickness, I know) because of more useful multitools (Leatherman, SOG, etc.). I've never been impressed by Gerber's fit/finish and mystery knife steel, have been impressed by SOG's toughness/compound pliers but never purchased, and became dissatisfied by Leatherman's fit/finish/QC. When saying I have owned/handled many brands of multitools, I mean it!As I work in an industrial environment as a maintenance mechanic, am married and father of two girls, and a general handyman, I use my tools all the time and take them very seriously.  While I use them heavily, I don't abuse them.I used to be a loyal Leatherman customer, having owned a Leatherman Kick, Core, Super Tool 300, a couple of Style CSs, and owned and/or given away more Micras than I can count.  Then I bought a Core because it was on clearance in a chain sporting goods retailer (they were clearing them out to make room for the Super Tool 300).  Within 1 month, I cracked the frame while bearing down on a bolt and broke the smallest screwdriver trying to back out a small screw (I used a cheap pocket screwdriver to ultimately back out the screw). My older Leatherman Kick has survived much more! I bought a Super Tool 300 to take its place while it was being serviced. The fit/finish was so poor that I returned it immediately.Now for the actual review. Amazon has some impressive prices on this multitool from time to time, and they are worth every penny. I liked mine so much, I bought two more as gifts for the excellent price offered at the time (51% off list price). I would have preferred the X, as it comes with scissors instead of the serrated blade, but it was $15 more. The Swisstool is definitely heavy duty, and does not ride comfortably in the pocket.  Good thing it comes with a good quality sheath.You really have to this tool in your hand to understand why everyone raves about the fit, finish, and ridiculous amount of engineering that went into this product. For instance, each 'secondary' tool is accessible from the outside when the pliers are closed, have their own dedicated spring (sized according to anticipated amount of use), and lock into place with a precision not seen in any other multitool.  It came lightly coated in a clear, odorless, rust-resistant oil (especially in the pivot points) which I deem unnecessary because of the tool's amazing rust resistance. I work in an environment where water and peroxide are everywhere, and this tool has not rusted one bit (another advantage over the Leatherman). I use most of the tools on a regular basis and love most of them!Now for the cons. A minor one is that the picture on Amazon doesn't accurately portray the product. Vicorinox stopped engraving the plier heads and putting the red sticker on the handle as a cost saving measure (Leatherman has too on their value multitools). The major disadvantage of the Swisstool is that it has blunt-nosed pliers. I do occasionally miss the needle-nose profile of my Leatherman. If you want a multitool with excellent quality, needle-nose pliers, and a smaller form factor, everyone seems to love the Swisstool Spirit series.In conclusion, if you find one of these on sale @Amazon, buy one! You won't regret it. A coworker of mine liked his so much that when his got stolen (he got it as a Christmas gift from his kids), he bought another one for $120! Highly recommended.

In my humble opinion, the best supertool around, and I own probably two dozen of them that I've collected over the years. The tool exhibits a fit and finish better than anything else out there, and one great feature is that the tools fold out from the outside of the handle. It featured a positive locking mechanism when most of the other tools still had yet to offer it, including the famous Leatherman. Even with all the innovative multitools of recent years with each new one trying to outdo the other, this took remains head and shoulders above the rest. Next to this, as with a previous reviewer, I would rate the Leatherman Supertool as best.

Quality, Durability and Easy to Use Locking Accessories! I personally have owned this Swiss Tool for over 12 years and it still works like new! My recent purchase was for the Firefighters in my Company as Christmas Presents...I also had the Swiss Tool Laser Engraved with their Names and Fire Dept. I would Highly Recommend this product if you are in the market for a Multi-Tool!

I've enjoyed using this tool for the last two years.  The serrated knife alone is worth the price of the multi- purpose tool. My only complaint is that the nylon pouch did not hold up.  Not sure I want to spring for a leather one.  If only they put as much thought and quality into the pouch as they did the tool.
summary: Tool yes - Pouch, not so much.

reviewText: I have carried one of these for about seven years and it has proven it's worth. Recently I lost it and am replacing it with the Spirit version. I want the scissors instead of a serrated knife blade.

Victorinox got it right with this design.  Best Multi-tool on the market.  Ive owned or used Leatherman, Gerber, and SOG multi-tools.  None of them are as comfortable in my hand or as easy to use as the Swiss Tool.  I love that I dont have to open the tool to get to the blades or other items.  I broke a blade once, and got a brand new replacement tool no questions asked.  Great company.
This product is very well made! I bought a few of these and gave them as gifts, everyone I gave it to raves about it! I have a leatherman wave and this product is better all around!

I have two of these multi tools now. I thought I lost my old one and I just can't live without it. Soon after I found my old and am thankful for that these tools are great. If you get one you'll love it. You'll use it more than any other tool you own. Kepp it on you hip and you never need to look for a typical screw driver, pliers or cutting edge again. can save you allot of time digging through you tool box or truck. My father buys the $90.00 leatherman but thats only becuase his work pays for them and there supplier only stocks leatherman. But he agrees that this tool is better built than his. This tool pouches last longer than the leatherman pouches do. I recently bought another one for my brother and he has it with him everyday at work or trout fishing on the lake we all love them. and the make wonderful gifts.
summary: Gets more use than any tool in my tool box- it will yours too

reviewText: ITS  good Im to lazy to write a long review but this is definetley better than the leatherman. And a better price the wave is like 70 dollars and this is 50 you wont be dissapointed with this product!

To the best of my memory, I believe I picked up the original Swisstool around 1997 and still have it to this day. I have to be honest that I haven't shopped or researched any new multi-tools since I've owned this one but that in itself is a testimony to the quality and how happy I am with the product.  After all these years I just now decided to see if others felt the same way about this product and from the looks of it many people love it just as much as I do.Needless to say, the construction is supurb and holds up to about any task. From camping to construction I've put this tool through almost every test over the past 15 years and it has never failed me.  I cannot count how many times that this tool saved the day, even when there was nothing else that seemed to work. The chisels seem to be the most versitile tool in the bunch, just this morning I had to take apart a laptop for a cowrker and used it to unscrew tiny star headed screws that would normally need a specialty screw driver... no problem.I've pryed things open, bent things back into place (the rounded outside edges give you amazing grip without cutting into your hands), chiseled wood and metal, cut through any and all materials imaginable (having multiple blade options has been invaluable), pulled nais and used it as a hammer. It's been covered in glue, oil, paint and more and still works smoothly.  From being stuck on the side of the road to getting me out of a bind on a mountainside, there hasn't been a job it couldn't handle.As I mentioned before, 15 years and I have never even considered looking for another multi-tool.  I wish I wrote a review earlier but maybe after all this time my words will carry a little more weight.  This has to be one of the best products that I've ever owned.
summary: 15+ years and still getting ALL jobs done

reviewText: When you order this item you get the pictured SwissTool.  You do not get the RS.  It's still a great tool, though.

I've had multiple Leatherman tools, and a SOG multitool, but the Victorinox is far superior overall.Both the Leatherman and the SOG have the main design flaw of having the tools open only when the pliers are opened. This is truly an inferior design. The SOG has stronger pliers, but that's its only advantage. Otherwise it is difficult to use, sometimes it's outright frustrating.I guess the one thing I can say about the Victorinox is that I *use* it, all the time, for everything. It has the tools I need, in a form that makes them practical to use. And they are of high quality so they last. I bought my first one to replace a Leatherman, lost it after a couple years, replaced it with another, then a couple years later, misplaced that one. I then replaced that one with a SOG, a purchase I am not entirely happy with. Fortunately, my SwissTool showed up a few months later, and the SOG is now residing in a drawer. If/when I manage to misplace it again, I won't fool around again, I'll just buy another SwissTool.

I've had this tool for over TEN YEARS and w/ occasional oiling and cleaning it has LASTED. There's no rust on my multi tool despite the fact that it's been everywhere I have for sooo long. The locking mechanism still works and the plier hasn't loosened much. I will say that I don't use this daily but I DO carry it ALL the time. The machining on all the components is clean & smooth all around. I won't get into how many times and in what ways this tool has helped me because it would make for a looong review. My good friend has an older Leatherman that he swears by and I imagine that Leathermans are THE best around but this tool is so well designed and made from such high-grade steel that I don't think I'll ever need to buy another multi-tool. All in all, this is the kind of piece that I like to call "Heirloom Quality"
summary: Ten Years and Still Solving Problems

reviewText: In the world of technical theater, almost everyone carries a multi-tool, and I've used most of them. I got my first SwissTool in 1998 and have yet to find one I liked better. The tools can be accessed without first opening the pliers. Each tool has an individual spring so that when you open a tool only that one comes out. The thumb lock is easy to use and sturdy. To me the full size and very solid phillips screwdriver is the biggest plus. The only downsides are the weight and the bluntness of the pliers. The first is an acceptable trade off for such a solid tool however.
The best Multi-tool I own.  I give them as gifts.  People love them.

I bought this as a gift for someone who used the same one (for work and as a carrying around everywhere item) all the time before it was lost. This tool is very handy and has been a lifesaver at times, especialy in places you wouldn't have a tool box laying around.
