This 18 minute  epic starts off simple enough, a song about how America is stupid. A common  topic in punk rock, but the way NOFX incorporate lyrics of songs they made  us sing in elementary school, they really bring the cover image of a small  boy crashing a toy plane into the Capitol, into the lyrics. And this is  only the first verse. Throughout this epic NOFX covers everything from  religion, to guns, to marijuana, to American brainwashing, and the  correlation between them all. The songs main point is demonstrated in the  end of the song, which details the point of view of the average citizen.  "Why go against tradition when we can admit defeat?" Fat Mike  asks. It seems today that most people would rather go along with whats  standard then whats true. This is not a punk record. This is an anthem.

This CD is not just for punk fans but everyone.  It only has one 18 minute song but The Decline is by far the best NOFX song ever written.  It has really deep, powerful lyrics.  The first 5 or 6 minutes is typical NOFX  style punk but from then on it changes in many great ways.  There is this  real cool part with a horn.  All in all this CD is great I recommend this  CD to anyone out there.
summary: Simply the best NOFX song ever!

First of all, let me say this, NOFX rules!!!!!!!!  Led by Fat Mike, Eric Melvin, El Hefe, and Erik Ghint, they are the best punk band of all time!  I own 16 CDs by them but this E.P. hasd been my favorite NOFX album of all time!  It has only one song on it! The song seems to go on forever!  The song is 18 minutes long! reviewText: That's kind of a hard statement to believe these days since there's so many punk bands out, and even harder if you were raised up on Bad Religion and have listened to punk for 20+ years.  I've listened to punk for about two-three years.  I've been a big fan of NOFX for about three months.  And I'll be totally honest here, even in my relatively inexperienced knowledge of punk:It does not get any better than this.This is the seminal NOFX release.  One song, one CD, 18 minutes and 21 seconds of the most amazing lyrics and musical technicality in punk today.  No one in punk is really as accomplished or as talented as El Hefe these days when it comes to guitar.  I have yet to see any band in history match Fat Mike's powerful lyrics and excellent bass riffs.  The usually-underrated Erik Sandin on drums is one of the best and fastest drummers I've ever heard (and he only uses one pedal).  There are so many different things going on at once and so many different parts of the song where they combine past and present techniques, it's impossible to list them all.  And did I mention the lyrics are LOADED with puns, hidden meanings, and messages about the society, government, drugs, guns, etc.  So many different aspects of this add up to the best punk song ever.  Like one of the other reviewers said, it's not really considered a song when you think about it - more like an anthem for the whole punk ethos and generation.  YOU MUST BUY THIS.
summary: Far and away the greatest punk song ever... hands-down

nofx has always been amazing. but this ep is even better. they blend everything together in one track. as you listen to it you realize that they made this cd in like one take which is VERY impressive. i recommend this to  anyone who is a long time nofx fan or a new school punk fan who wants to  hear what good punk should sound like.

One way to describe this CD/Song is saying the word "masterpiece".  I have never heard a song quite as smart, or as good as this.  NOFX has taken punk rock to a higher level.  For those of you who don't know, this album consists of one song.  But don't let that sway you, because this one song is 18 minutes long.  When I first started listening to this song I thought I'd never be able to listen to the whole thing.  I was wrong, I sort of floated right through it because every element of the song is absolutely perfect.  This cd will make you think, and think really hard.  Another really cool aspect of this album is the clear disc.  It really adds to the "wow" factor.  If you're looking for true art, buy this album now!

Dude, this one track cd is amazing and on a clear cd too. It's the coolest  looking thing. Anyway, there's no ska, which rocks. It's only hardcore  punk, then some softer rock, but continous, not ever stopping. You can hear  Fat Mikes awesome bass guitar skills many times, and their traditional  theme in their music. The 1 song idea was great and it turned out to be one  of their best recordings and songs so far. Buy it!

Honestly, i can't stand most punk music, i think it's dispassionate, anger thats just people who don't really know how to play or write songs. (obviously i don't know how to write a sentence)But this song is drastically different. It really is a Prog-Punk song. An incredible Epic with a _subtle_ political meaning. I don't really agree or care about the politics, some people may, but the songwriting is spectacular. NoFX really is the best punk band out there.It kind of reminds me of a Punk Close to the Edge...so even a yes fan could like this song.
summary: I don't even like punk music.

reviewText: Wow.  This song is so damn good.  I just heard it for the first time and I have to buy it...Now.  The unbelievable part is that this is that this is an 18-minute plus song that never gets dull.  The music keeps evolving so that it is always fresh yet remains a unified whole.  And the lyrics are ridiculously good - this is true poetry.  I could easily get this on mp3, but these guys deserve my money.  Whatever I pay for this will be cheap for what I'm getting.
Although the price I paid for this was ridiculous ,  I don't care. It is a masterpiece of a song.

OK, so I have really not been the biggest NoFx fan in the past 4 years. I loved Ribbed, White Trash, and Punk in Drublic, but man these guys were on "The Decline". Maybe thats why they released this amazing song.  "The Decline" is very different from  the other NoFx albums, and  I have to admit, the first time I played it I thought it was more of the  same dribble that had been coming down the pipe from Fat Wreck Chords. But,  like I normally do, I gave the album a second chance, and listened to it  all the way through. Very impressive, and it grows on you fast. This is the  best thing they have done since Punk in Drublic... The price is way to  high, but the song is great.
summary: Best NoFx Since Punk in Drublic

reviewText: NOFX has come through with yet another crowd pleaser.  The Decline provides a social and political commentary that, as usual, isn't very optimistic.  Heavy guitar licks, along with lightining fast drumming, gives this album an edge that can only be obtained by NOFX.  The Decline is reflective of both musical creativity and social awareness, and it proves that NOFX will continue to produce good music as long as the fans demand it.

Let me start off by saying that although I have a few NOFX cd's, I definitely think they are one of the most overrated punk bands ever.  I mean, they're not bad, but I've heard better stuff before.  Anyways, now that that's out of the way, let me tell you this: The Decline is easily the best punk song ever written.  In fact, it's so good I wouldn't call it a song, it's an experience, an anthem if you will.  Obviously the length, 18 minutes total, gives it some extra browny points, but that's not what makes it so good (it doesn't hurt, however).  Just the whole song itself is constructed so beautifully, so perfectly, that it just completely, and utterly amazes me.  The lyrics are so politically fueled it's almost surprising: And the weird thing is, unlike some political jargain, this one makes complete sense.  Thing may seem disjointed at times if you follow the lyrics from the book, but when you hear the last line "he's got his, and I've got mine, meet the decline," everything just clicks in your brain and you'll find yourself saying, "wow, that's amazing!"You may think I'm weird; well, call me what you will, but I just can't give this song high enough praise.  Listen to this, I've had the MP3 on Napster for about a week now, but the song was just so incredible that I went out and bought the CD.  Now I know you may be thinking, "Why buy it when you have it already?"  Well my friends, I found it to be so awesome that I felt like I HAD to give NOFX my money.  It was like my way of saying good job.Okay, I'm done ranting.  Point is, just go buy the CD.  You won't be disappointed, and you will love all 18 minutes of it; I promise.  Easily the best song ever written.
summary: Umm... Wow.  Could this be it my friends?

This is the kind of CD you listen to over and over again, you take in the music, you take in the lyrics and it sticks in your mind.  I listen to it with my kids (19 and 17) and their friends and some incredible conversations have come from it. The political commentary is contemporary and speaks volumes about life in the US today...land of the free??...Listen to it, reflect on it, if it doesn't make you stand up and say "How the he!! did we let it get like this??" then you must be living under a rock!  18 minutes well spent!

I bought this album skeptical of a punk song that is 18 minutes long, but who better to pull it off than NoFX! It doesn't seem like one song however, it is very emotional, political, and hits a lot of ups and downs. It's very  PUNK! The actual CD is almost worth purchasing (it's clear except for the  very center) alone. Some awesome musicianship on this one. These guys  continue to blow me away, only in the way NoFX can. Awesome harmonies  compliment this one (except for one backup vocal that struggles to find the  note... but that's the "real" element that these guys strive  for). Seriously, a must buy. You've got to hear to appreciate this. You  won't regret this purchase!

The Decline was the first NOFX cd I bought because the first time one of my friends played it in his car I was hooked.  It's far more political than any NOFX song I've heard but that's a good thing. All in all this is NOFX's best song besides Kill All the White Men.  (sing it while walking down the halls of a school full of imbred white hicks)

reviewText: The Decline is the best NOFX album to date.  Containing only one 18 minute song, the band has finally brought punk rock to a level I never thought I'd see.  This is more than a song, it is an opus.  Outstanding political  lyrics, about 7 different progressions, and amazing display of talent make  this a CD even my dad likes.  Thanks guys.
Wow. Wow, wow wow... a 20 minute song? By a punk band? That keeps the listener listening? Another gem from some of punk's finest.

Punk was a direct and opposite reaction to Progressive Rock and its sprawling excesses. Instead of the veritable Rock symphonies of pretension and musical frippery drawn out over twenty minutes or more, Punk created sub-three minute gobs of snot which meant anyone who could pick up a guitar could get noticed. So what did NOFX go and do? Not afraid of doing the unexpected, NOFX went and created `The Decline', an 18-minute Prog-Punk behemoth.OK, so Prog-Punk is a fairly inaccurate sort of description, but it seems the most appropriate. Basically, it is progressive in that there is a lot of experimentation. There is a lot going on through the song, and close and repeated examinations with headphones help the listener pick up more and more nuances and details. On display is a mix of differing Punk sounds, a number of rhythms, vocal effects, and non-Ska horns feature prominently.The music starts in typical NOFX style, galloping along to Fat Mike's lively bass lines, but then it all suddenly pulls up for a dreamy interlude, before powering back into the same rhythm. The melodic gang backing vocals make an appearance. The sound toughens up somewhat, to a point about a third of the way through the song where a horn makes an appearance with a simple yet catchy little riff, revisited throughout the rest of the song. One of the later breakdowns has an electrified drone mixed with a muted guitar and whispered vocals.`The Decline' was a turning point for a new, more politically aware NOFX. Sure, there had been political songs in the past, like "Rico" and "Murder The Government", but the tone had been less than serious. If Propagandhi are the Noam Chomsky of North American popular Punk, then NOFX are the Michael Moore. The underlying Left leaning message is similar, but like Moore, NOFX takes the populist route, packed with catchphrases and aiming at easy targets while trying to shake the zombified public out of its addled stupor. That's not to say the message is unworthy or not thought through. Lines like "There's no answers/When the questions aren't ever asked" and "Blame it on human nature, man's destiny/Blame it on the greediocracy" or any one of a number of other quotes show Fat Mike has been thinking hard and is trying to pitch his ideas in a manner that Generation X might understand.This song apparently took six months to create, and it shows in its complexity and depth. It isn't the sort of song which would have won NOFX any new fans, but sometimes even the converted need to be preached to.
Buy this. It's awesome.  The sample that you get to listen to  here doesn't make the song look  that great, but it is.
summary: The Best Punk Song in History

reviewText: Man, this is one heeluva song. If you are bored or want to spend a couple of weeks with just one song blasting, this is the one!! The one track cd gives you 18 minutes of pure NOFX bliss and tells a fast-paced story of their view on politics and the decline of society. If you're into that, good, if you are not, who cares, the music will take you away with drums blaring, guitars riffing, trumpets hooting and Fat Mike's bass strumming - add to that his vocals Eric's stunning backup screaming and you've got a song which you probably won't get bored of until you've listened to it over 50-70 times - Honest!! It is just one of thos things that you've gotta keep coming back for more. If you've got a spare tenner lying round, don't spend it on hot dogs, don't spend it on your girlfriend, don't spend it on your car - spend it on The Decline, one of NOFX's finest creations.

This is definitely a NOFX album worth buying.  It is a concept album with only one song, however, there are several smaller songs within it.  The several smaller songs contribute to the whole song.  Very political.  This  is unbelievable.  Of course this is not for everyone, but if you like nofx  or want to hear a very interesting album, then it's worth a listen.

A lot of punk songs that I like are fun and stupid, others are straight-out screamfests. But this EP/song is the most incredible thing I have ever heard. Even at 18 minutes, it never gets boring, and, I get new meaning from the song every time I listen to the song. This is the only song ever that has ever made my skin tingle. It is hands-down amazing.
summary: A New Level of Punk Rock

FatMike just puts his best skills into the basslines of this song. The Trombone is  a pretty good touch and the backup ooooozzz and aaaaahhhhs are the sharpest  yet. It's a must have for a NOFX fan.
Simply put, this is the best thing i have evr heard

A couple years ago I really liked NOFX, but I recently kind of lost interest after "So Long and Thanks for all the Shoes." I also should say that not only the music, but also the lyrics were just awesome.  So, to sum it up, buy it.  Buy it now.
summary: The best 18 minute long song I've ever heard.

reviewText: i love this cd i recomend it to all of you punkrockcers out there. it is the best single song that i have ever heard in my entire life its so great

Jello Biafra would be proud- Stinging wit, sarcasm, and humour drip from this brilliant song. Attacking many controversial issues from Gun Control to Drugs and the Prison System, NOFX kicks out the political punk as good as any other.They've been on the scene for decades, but proves they only get better with time. They get the job done with sharp wit, backed by even sharper riffs. Legendary political punk reminiscient of Dead Kennedys, Bad Religion, but with the unforgettable humorous NOFX style. A must-own.

ive heard many songs from the cd and i will say that the cd is worth buying. its not as good as Punk In Drublic, White Trash, or Heavy Petting Zoo, but snce nofx kicks o so much its still awesome. its a little slow but  their still big punks.

This CD is not worth the eleven bucks NOFX thinks their one eleven minute song is worth.  While punk is supposed to be about social commentary, NOFX gives us the usual overdone whinings that we can all hear for free from Tipper Gore, or Rosie O'Donnell  They need to listen to more Dead Kennedys  before they attempt something like this again.

yeah, 8 bucks for one song, i know. but it's the best song i've ever heard. NOFX gave everyone a scare with heavy petting zoo, then so long... came out to restore hope, and now, after hearing the decline, i can't wait  for the new full-length next year. but thanks to this album i'll be waiting  18 minutes at a time. besides being such a great song,  you have to just  respect it, and the talent necessary to accomplish such greatness.  imitators be damned, NOFX is still the best band alive.

The Decline is the greatsest song ever created. It is punk rock at its purest form. NOFX is the best band period.  Anyone that dare call them  sell-outs or poseurs are just that themsleves.  To say NOFX and sell-out is  an oxymoron, for the name itself is against selling out.This song is  an 18 minute epic journey about politics, religion,and many other big  issues. The concept of the song is that all the issues discussed during it  is leading America in a downfall (Decline) and how society is so corrupt.  The end of the song even suggest America is in a Fascist state.  NOFX is  disgusted with society today and that is the point of this piece of art.  There are no answers or suggestions merely rhetorical and sarcastic  explanations to the problems of society, and that is what is genious about  the song.  Such is the line "start with the assumption, that a million  people are smart-smarter than one" poking at democracy and how just  because everyone agrees on something does not make it right.  The song  mentions how we destroyed ourselves based on our own creation of this  nation.  It is just an excellent song.I strongly recommend this to  everyone.  This is my favorite song.  I do not consider this an album as  some people complain about the shortness, I just consider it a single.  There is nothing to complain about the shortness of this disc.  After the  first listen youll be mesmorized by the musical brilliance.  This is the  greatsest song ever and will never ever be surpassed in terms of  originality,musicianship,talent, and overall greatness.

The Decline is amazing.  It reminds me of a suite written by a classical master, like Stravinsky or Rimsky-Korsakov.  Each part of the song blends into the next, like movements as parts of a greater whole.  The chord progressions and key changes are complex and add a lot to the music, which is something that can't be said about a lot of punk out there.  Each instrument adds to the song, with the trombone riffs being well placed, and the guitar never getting repetitive.  The harmonized voice parts are especially well done.  NOFX manages to find an underlying musical theme that ties all of the different vignettes in the song together, while maintaining enough variety to keep the listener from even thinking of getting bored.
summary: A whole that is greater than the sum of its parts

reviewText: This is an 18 minute long epic masterpiece. NoFX have outshined all previous work with incredible lyrics and even better music. Although it's 18 minutes long, it could have probably been separated into two or three  separate songs, so it doesn't drag on. I highly recommend this album to  anybody who is an intelligent fan of punk music, especially those who  appreciate the more melodic side to punk.

I mean, don't get me wrong, NOFX are an incredible band and they've been going at it for very long but this just takes the cake.  And what a beatifully scrumptious cake it is.  This is 18 minutes, 21 seconds of pure holyness.  It never dies down and becomes crap, it just goes on without getting dull.  Thank you Lord of Fatness for this gift of joy.

This is the greatest song I have ever heard. It is not just one of my favorites, but the favorite. NoFX is one of the most original, creative, and downright hilarious bands I've ever heard, and this album shows it all. The 18:21(!!) song is full of fast paced snot-punk, as well as a couple of slower parts, and some more melodic parts. The song covers a wide variety of topics on what the world is coming to, and that we, the people. need to do something about it. They sing about how America is dumb, but also how the average American knows this and just ignores it, like in the part where they repeat: "One more pill to keep me safe/ One more prayer to keep us warm." They also make a point of saying that with guns, it is too easy to kill someone, thus making the shooter forget that he is actually commiting murder and killing another person. But, all these messages are told very creativley, not making it sounding like social commentary, though that's what it really is, and most listeners probobly won't even pick up these messages the first few times they listen to the cd. The song never gets boring or monotonous, which is amazing. Every few minutes, the style changes, and there is even some trombone parts in there...Not to mention the fact that half of the freaking cd is actually see-through---...who could go wrong. Buy iy now; you won't be dissapointed.

By: Sixto Limiac IIIHere's one definition of Punk Music, accelerated music which summons comedic lyrics blended with brisk and furious guitars, bass, along with a moderate smashing of drums! Such great, and at times,  annoying music! NOFX are the masters of punk. Punk is not Blink182, who  now, are Pop stars. NOFX IS Punk. NOFX's efforts are so brilliant it leaves  me giant goosebumbs just thinking about all their albums, a very vast  collection indeed! Their latest installment of music has a different touch  in comparison of their previous CDs. The fact that they changed a bit was  an outrage at first, but after listening to The Decline about the third  time I fell in love with this CD.  Simply a classic.  The Decline is  composed of one song, lasting about eight-teen minutes. Some may be  disappointed by the abrupt end of the song, but believe me you can listen  to it over and over again. And the best thing is, it'll sound better each  time you press that triangle button. For slow idiots, the play button.  Mike's singing is stuffed with bravery, bearing a narrow view on religion  and politics. Rhythm has upright timing with a respectable choice of words.  Anyone can sing along with it. Hell, even my Dad joins me in doing so.  It has nicely executed guitars, bass, and drums. There are even sound  effects that really enhance the music, although I prefer the rawness of  NOFX. The Decline doesn't seem like one song, because after a few minutes  it'll have a different beat and execution of melodies. Mainly the Pro is  everything, lyrics are tasty as the paste of music, and the main Con is the  shortness.  NOFX's masterpiece is original. Lyrics are finger-pointing  on who's to blame for today's society.  Most lines are very accurate and  down to the point. If I were to be stranded on a remote island with only a  CD player and one billion packs of batteries, The Decline would be on my  top 5 list for which CDs to bring. The elite, underground band is at their  shiniest quality, having many, many years ahead. Hearing the musical  masterpiece as I write this review, it leaves me an overbearing  anticipation for their next album. NOFX Rules! Truly, this is worth all  your Abraham Lincoln's!
summary: NOFX Is Utter and Raw Horsepower!

reviewText: I tended to stay away from buying this album, because it only had one  track on it. However, a few mates played a glimpse and I didn't think it  was too bad. When I came into some money, I bought it, and I couldn't stop  listening to the 18 minute song. I just listened to it over and over, any  chance I could get. I never got sick of it. It is brilliant. If you are  ever going to spend $10.87 or whatever, this is the way to do it. Support  NOFX, because they are the best punk band ever produced!
summary: NOFX - Music Making at its best.

reviewText: One unbelievable 18 minute song.  Simply said, if you like NOFX, you're going to love this album.

The thing about the people writing the BAD reviews of this album is that they don't realize what punk music is. Punk music is something that will never be played on the radio. Punk music is something that is not accessible to the radio listeners. Punk music is something that goes against anything radio related. With NOFX being the peak of punk music (modern punk music, not taking into account The Ramones, The Sex Pistols, The Stooges, The Clash, etc.) they are anti-radio. A long song is not going to be played on the radio (with the exception of Tool songs after ten p.m.). A song anti-government is not going to be played on the radio. A song with so many different tunes in it is not going to be played on the radio, even though it should.NOFX put out The Decline after three weeks of recording. Recorded Punk Rock style (all band members play at the same time, one recording, very little production) and still retaining a small bit of feedback in the background (very noticeable, about a minute and a half into the CD) it's 18:21 of genius. Not much more to say. Anything else would be too mainstream.

this cd is a lil bit different from their previous releases but it's a refreshing change. they have a lot more ska in it, (well at least toward the end of this cd, around minute 15). the song itself has pretty  insightful and interesting lyrics, and the real keeper is the cd itself.  purely for novelty purpose, 3/4 of the cd is clear plastic without the  alinum shiny coating on it. so basically most of the cd itself is  transparent and it looks quite cool. as i will say once again, the song is  really cool. its 18 minutes and it's split up into a few movements in which  the speed, tone, and lyrics change direction. quite cool. i reccomend this  cd to all fans, its just great. i love it.
I was expecting the yellow one and that's the reason I bought it. Ended up with a silver one but it works well and for the reasonable  price  I would buy another one if it comes in yellow.

This is a cheaply made tool with all kinds of irregularities--looks like a "second" at best.  Very awkward to change the blades or rotate them.  Most of these are dangerous and this no exception.  You have to loosen the whole assembly, which makes it very dicey.  Not for kids, klutzes or the distracted.  Does small jobs okay but wouldn't want to use it all day.

I bought this cd at a store called Hot Topic when I was buying a NOFX shirt. I hadn't heard of "The Decline" yet but the guy there said it was really good. So I bought it and when I first listened to it I  thought Ok, this is wierd but then I listened to it again and I loved it!  The lyrics are deep and true, and the music is top notch, with some great  gutair and trombone work in the backround. The price is a little high for  one song, but it is well worth it. You'll love this cd if you like punk or  not, just give it a chance.

Few things can really sum up what a certain band has in terms of style and talent. Well, The Decline does just that for the NOFX crew. This EP is, in my opinion, the best song they've put out to date. All tweny or so minutes  of it (I didn't pay attention to how long it was since I was bobbing my  head into a coma at the time it was playing) is great listening from  beginning to end. I popped it in my truck, and I completely loss myself in  the guitar, horns, and drum sonic boom that they've completely perfected.  It deserves all five stars from NOFX and non-NOFX fans alike. Man, if this  ONE SONG is this GOOD, can you imagine their next album? The boys have  really outdone themselves this time around...
Needed a few more for the store and found this carpet on line.Great price. Metal body. Durable. Knife uses slotted blades in case you did not know.

Okay, my best friend is a HUGE Nofx fan, and I hadn't heard them before. He told me to get "The Decline" first, because I like the anti-government stuff. After about 3 hours of downloading it,...I listened to it for a little while and thought it was great. I like the part where it talks about humans teaching each other to kill. ("A kill is what you want, a kill is why we breed") This song is frightening, mainly because everything is true to life. If you like the government, don't get this CD--or do get it, to see how wrong you are....

Ordering process and delivery was very good.  We did not find the product to be 5 star worthy but it is still a good product anddoes the job. Our old knife was better quality and thus the 3 star vs 5 star.

I have owned this knife for 10 years, This retracting unit is the best design due to either retacting for carrying or changeing blades by loosening the screw and pulling out forward (no need to pivot handle).  Recently I thought I lost it and bought 2 knifes by roberts first a cheap one with a screw to remove blades then a openable pivot one both are anoying to replace blade vs this one.  A carpet layer replaces a blade or filps it about every 3rd cut so having a blade that changes so easy is very handy.  I keep this retracted in tool box or walking around and is much safer.

Took me several tries to figure out how to make it work properly but once I did it was simple to move, change and flip the blade around and to retract blade back into handle. Easy enough to use cutting the carpet without hurting your hands.
summary: More awkward then it looks if you never used one before

reviewText: Bought this product as I was going overseas and had a fear of toads, so does my sister.  Not only did it keep the toads away but also the snakes which seemed to be on the rise this summer. Amazing product.

Worked great for cutting my flor tiles.  I only did a little bit so can't really review the actual blade or how long it will last.The only reason i am giving this 4 stars is because it was not that intuitive to assemble the blade.
summary: Solid knife, not intuitive to assemble blade.

reviewText: Beware that this stuff wreaks!  I put it around the perimeter of my house and now everytime I walk outside, or open a window I'm overcome by a strong moth ball smell.  My advice would be to keep this stuff away from your living areas.I can't say whether it works or not, but I haven't seen any snakes yet.  Also, the product seems to hold up to my daily lawn watering.
Happy with the knife.  each blade is good for about 3-4 ft cuts before needing to be replaced, if you want perfect cuts.  we used this to cut FLOR.com floor tiles.

Ok I live in Florida and we have all kinds of animals running around. Snakes are part of living here in the sunshine state. I however do not like seeing them near my house. I have used this a few times and think it may help but it is hard to tell because snakes come and go on their own. In my opinion it cant hurt to try it and see how it works for you.

Used this to repel a black snake that insisted on hanging around my front door and slipping into a gap behind my front stoop.  Useless.  I watched the snake slither right through the stuff on several occasions.  Turns out that moth balls from the dollar store works better !
This seems to repel the garter snakes that live on my sunny patio and i haven't seen any since sprinkling the product.
I found some snakes in the yard, freaked and bought this stuff. It smells like moth balls for a few days. I haven't seen a snake. Safe around my dogs.
summary: Had great reviews so I tried it

reviewText: I don't know if is working or not I haven't seen any snakes on my property. I placed the snakes away around rat holes next to bushes in hopes of keeping snakes out my yard.

We applied the Snake Away spreading it like the video suggested.  The snakes just laid on top of it.  We could not believe it!  It was a waste of money. Can't find it on the store shelves, so we ordered on website. Maybe the stores have determined that it does not work and will not carry it anymore. Bought two different times to get the amount we thought we would need to go around the house.  Now I wish there is a way to get my money returned. Please tell me how to get my money back! If you like wasting your money, this is a way to do it.
summary: Does not work!  Waste of your hard earned money!

reviewText: I have a house on the mountains,where there is a lot of snakes. I spread Snake A Way and I have not seen any snake around, so it looks to be working.

My wife is deathly afraid of snakes, eventhough the only snakes we'll see here in southeast missouri are garter and black rat snakes, which are both non-poisonous and keep mice and bugs away, i still dont want them in my house.  so i put this stuff on the crawl space entry as well as the dryer vent.  i have seen snakes in my hard, but that doesn't bother me.  so long as they stay out of the house! stuff stinks, it's pure sulfur, but you have to determine how bad you really dont want snakes around and if it's as bad as my wife's desire, you will put up w/ the smell for a bit. it doesn't seem like a lot comes in the container, but it goes a long way, trust me.

The snakes love our pool.  I have had 6 or so in the pool.  I started using Snake Away about 2 years ago and it seems to help with the snake problem.  Good News - 1)  No more snakes in our pool and 2) It does not kill the snake - just keeps them away.  Bad News - 1) you do have to re-apply every 3-4 weeks or after a heavy rain 2) The smell is awful (strong moth ball smell) - no wonder the snakes stay away.  The smell does get better over time, but for the 1st day or two after use, the snakes aren't the other thing that won't go in the pool as my son and his friends refuse to go in while the smell is at it's strongest.  I think its worth it!

The product does work, but only for certain snakes. The deal breaker for me is that it gives off a very strong smell of mothballs.  Mothballs themselves would probably work if you ground them up.  They cost more than the Snake Away.  We unknowingly put it where the fumes could get into the house via the air handler and it was pretty awful until the stuff wore off.So, if you have a problem with the strong smell of mothballs, then you need to find another way to control the snakes.
summary: If you can stand the smell of strong moth balls

reviewText: This has got to be the best product for keeping rattle snakes from crossing the boundaries where you have applied the snake away. Living in the mountains has been made more safe and comfortable since finding this product to help protect my family and animals.

Have watched, with my own eyes, garter snakes simply slither over a fresh barrier of this without little more than a pause. It certainly is not a sure thing. Smells a bit like mothballs so it might keep them away.
I do think this product worked.  I put at area by river and didn't see a snake after.  Snell not bad. Easy tomuse

I spread this around my yard and deep into holes that I think might be snake holes.  I did not see any snake since.  Of course they are hibernating now.  I will probably buy again.  A friend told me you can just use moth balls (which are a lot cheaper).  And this product, to my nose, smells a lot like moth balls.  But from viewing it, it seems to have much more in it.
summary: I cannot believe it works but I guess it does

reviewText: followed directions for use, had 3 snakes in my attached garage.  Had snakes in garden  I keep garage and yard clean with no trash , weeds, or overgrowth---still horrible snakes visit

we have very short grass and garden mulch and our yard looks quite neat but my neighbor with the same neat and pretty yard had a huge snake coiled in his patio flower pot....Now he no longer worries.....I recommend this seller...
summary: I no longer worry about my cat in my yard

reviewText: The product that I received was in a bag and not container as indicated in the photo.After using, I'm not sure how I feel about it. We have a lot of large garden snakes and I was desperate for a solution to our problem. I used the product as instructed but continued to see them. It was toward the end of summer so likely not as active as they were months prior so I'm not sure if it was the product or season. The smell lasted over a week though and I had to ensure the windows were closed on that side of the house as to not irritate our kitten but the odor is basically of moth balls. I gave this an average review because I can't judge the effectiveness of it. It is like an insurance policy, can't really see it but mentally makes you feel better. I wish it were more affordable though as I can't imagine using it every few weeks / months.
summary: Not sure how I feel about it

reviewText: This did not work at all! Same smell as moth balls which were much cheaper to buy. But in the end, did not distract the Black Racers & Rat Snakes from living in my backyard. I will not purchase this product ever again.

I tried this product because I was have a terrible problem with snakes in my fish pond.  Went from about 75 to 7.  Put the repellent down between the creek and the pond.  In two days I had two large (2.5 to 3 ft) brown water snakes and one copper head.  It seemed to attract snakes rather than repel them.

I have put this stuff out behind my back fence and have not had any rattlesnakes in my yard since!  It smells strongly of mothballs the first couple days but then it dissapates.  I buy this and out it out all summer long.

I ordered this product because my house backs up to a huge empty field and this year everytime I walked out back there was a different snake. I was scared to open the door. I followed directions and I haven't seen a snake since. Thank God. I am scared to death of them and I love working in my garden.

I tried to cancel the order.  It was being shipped to my son, in Oklahoma.  4 minutes after a quick click, I realized it was going to the wrong address, and there was a handling charge.  The manager told me it was too late to stop it, it would have to be refused on the other end.My son is mailing it to me instead.  That's]what I get for trying to avoid going to the hardware store.

I wanted to wait a little bit before reviewing this stuff, but I figured - four rain storms later, it's only fair to say that this stuff works.Have not seen my "friendly" yard companion the garter snake since application.This stuff really stinks the first few days, so if you have neighbors over the fence, give them a courtesy of a heads-up.  It's been about a month now, and I have not seen my snake yet.  It had rained hard on several occasions, and the snake is not back yet - the smell is gone though.We'll see if the snake returns.

I bought this stuff last year.  I kept it in the container on the front porch.  I live in the country.  I bought it after I found a rattlesnake in my house.  It smells terrible, so I was afraid to put it out around the house because it smelled like it would poison anything that ate it.  While this stuff was sitting out on my porch in the container all year, I did not have one single snake or other big critter like a raccoon or groundhog visit.  I got tired of the smell two weeks ago, and threw it out. Suddenly a week and a half ago, an animal-I think a groundhog-started hanging around the porch breaking stuff; and  tonite, I went outside to sit on the front porch , and there was a BIG snake on my living room window eating the little nestlings that a flycatcher pair had been brooding for the past two weeks. Terrible sight, the snake was hanging down with a little bird in its mouth.  So, I am now purchasing this stuff again, and will NEVER throw it out.  Smells terrible, works great.  I recommend it highly.

Well, I've been battling rattlesnakes for over 24 years in the remote AZ desert where we get approximately 12 to 15 every summer, and when I saw this convenient repellent I thought I'd give it a try.  Gee, once those monsoons hit, which by the way is the rattlesnakes mating time period, the granules wash away and here comes the snakes, but this time they are in mating balls.  Honestly, nature has a way of overcoming almost anything we attempt to use to keep them at bay, so perhaps it's best to learn to live with these annoying critters instead.  I'd have to say that unless you have a way of keeping this repellent constantly dry and not tampered with by other animals (like my dogs) it will not be affective.  Also, I now wonder just how many nasty chemicals I sank into my water table?  Snakes are nasty, but drinking chemicals can be even more scary.

I've used Mr. T's pest control products for years, and they are very effective.  Just a note that the picture shows a hard plastic container, but I received a soft bag of granules instead.  Not a big deal, but I'd prefer the container in the photo since it's easier to store.  This product does not repel all snakes, and as someone else said, reading the instructions is crucial to its success.
summary: Mr. T's products are very effective

reviewText: This product is shown to come in a tub that would be easy to spread.  Instead it comes in a bag, that is USELESS to srpead.

Follow the directions so you don't trap snakes IN your yard. THis is very effective. I reapply every 3 months in snake season, and we just don't see them. We did before: at least 2 rattlers a year in the back yard, pls 5-6 others. DO NO HANDLE without gloves. I'm sure it has ground up mothballs in it. The odor goes away after a day or two, esp. after you water.
summary: I've used this in my 1-acre lot for 4 years. It works.

reviewText: As a Custodial Technician at LAX I find this product very useful for getting rid of snakes. It is difficult to dislodge snakes on a plane; they like the enclosed surroundings. This gets them right out.Also very good for home use. I recommended it my neighbor Sam who loves to complain about his snake problem ("We got mother****in snakes!") and this cleared the problem up in no time.
Hubbi is in Afghanistan staying in a cave where there WERE a lot of snakes. Not anymore product works great, only offset is its really strong!
This is a great product for the home brewer because it can easily be converted to a mash tun. Just remove the spigot and screw in a valve and a kettle screen, both of which can be purchased at [...]
summary: Igloo cooler converted to a mash tun for brewering

reviewText: Keeps things cold/warm.  Not the most attractive thing, but you won't forget about it and leave it on the job site.  Great for homebrew and fits a 12" false bottom like a glove.

I upgraded to this from a Charlie Papazian double-bucket special.  This really holds the heat well and the volume is nice for doing heavier beers or larger volumes.  The worst issue I had was finding a decent washer to use to seal the plumbing fittings to the vessel wall without leaking.  It cleans very well and has improved the quality of my beer.

I love St. Patrick's Day. But I'm tired of the old holiday routine -- dye myself green, glug down the Guinness and floss leprechaun blarney out of my eyeteeth at four thirty the next morning. This year, I wanted the AUTHENTIC Irish experience.Nobody's Irish-er than Saint Patrick -- and there's nothing more Saing Patrick-y than shooing away snakes. So I bought these granules to give it a try. Just imagine -- these might be the very same concentrated chemical pellets old Saint Pat used, way back in the whenever-it-was. Amazing!And they work wonders, too. A while back, I noticed a few small snakes in the back of the yard. So I sprinkled these granules back there, waited a few days and presto! Now all of the snakes are in the FRONT of the yard, near the house. Crawling up the walls, that sort of thing. It's like a mamba party on my porch, and everyone's slithering.Worse yet, now I'm all out of granules. Maybe I'll pitch a tent and sleep out in the back of the yard, where it's safe. That seems like the IRISH way.
Good price delivered use at golf course. Good for employee hydration at job sites as well. Better insulation than I expected. Ice stayed overnight
Excellent Product.  Using it to store water for emergency purposes for 3 people.Easy to empty and refill w/fresh water.

You can't go wrong with this cooler. Its cheap and is ready to work with other parts such as "1/2" Weldless Bulkhead w/ Stainless Steel valve" and"12" Stainless Domed False Bottom". If your looking to brew 10+ gallons of beer in one batch or making a Imperial or Barley wine style this cooler is big enough.

I use this cooler as a mash/lauter tun for brewing 5 gallon batches of beer. It also works for high gravity beers as well. It's nice to have the extra space. I lose hardly and heat! If i do, It's maybe one degree over a 1 hour sac rest. Very sturdy and well made. I use a bazooka tube instead of a false bottom. I had to bend the end of the tube a little to get it to fit. Very easy to covert for brewing.

Using this for all grain beer brewing.  So far so good.  Using nearly boiling water and no warping.  No discoloration or signs of melting plastic.  Holds temp for 1 hour no problem.  No loss of heat at all.

These are really great coolers. Naturally, they are VERY heavy when full of liquid. I purchased three and had to return one due to the fact that the spigot was cracked. That may have happened in shipping - don't know. I can foresee getting a lot of use out of these
This item was just what I needed for a large festival my work group was doing. Did the job great!

I bought the iGloo to take camping at the beach.  We used to buy a ton of water bottles to make sure the kids say hydrated.  Of course, they loose the bottles or mix them up with the other kids (yuck).  We decided to get this and keep if filled with ice water and have the kids use reusable water bottles.  Its sturdy!!!!!  I read a complaint about the rope that holds the lid on.  Well funny thing is that on the way to the beach, I saw no less then three coolers (only one was a water cooler lid) on the side of the highway.  My lid holds tight, but I'm betting those other people wish they had a rope :)
summary: 4th of July camping with my iGloo

reviewText: This product worked out perfectly for our outdoor beverage station, at our country club this summer.  I was impressed & it takes alot to impress me.

Excellent cooler for use as a mash tun. It holds temperature perfectly. One cautionary note for home brewers: If you're doing 10 gallon batches, this is NOT large enough for some high gravity beers.  I'd say the absolute most grain you can mash in here is about 21-23lbs.
summary: Converted to Mash Tun for Home Brewing

reviewText: Yeah, you can drink cold water out of this thing. But why doom such a beautiful piece of hardware to such a mundane task?MAKE BEER.If you're brewing all-grain batches, this thing is the ideal mash tun.  Seriously, look at what other people ALSO bought with this thing, it's pretty obvious.

This is Igloo's commercial version of the 10 gallon beverage cooler. It is a bright easily seen OSHA approved yellow color with a red lid. The lid has a handle but for about $9 you can get a flat lid that provides seating, if needed. This cooler is super rugged and has a recessed nozzle that provides some protection when handled in a rough fashion. Igloo sells the nozzel and handles seperately (very inexpensive) should replacement ever be necessary. There are various lesser incarnations of this unit for the consumer but this is the real deal for commercial applications. There is also a rugged steel truck mount (#25043) available that securely allows mounting this cooler on most any vehicle or location. This cooler keeps contents cold all day long in 95F+ temps, easy to use, super rugged and is a life saver on any job.
summary: Really good commercial grade beverage cooler

reviewText: Along with the stainless steel false bottom 12" also on Amazon...this makes a great mash tun really holds the temp
summary: Used this for my Home Brew Mash tun

reviewText: Homebrewers delight.  I purchased the Industrial model as I wanted something that would maintain the desired heat and it does.  I've used it twice already for a Robust Porter and a African Amber and after 60 minutes of mashing the temps were the same as whan I started.  I also purchased the 12" false bottom and it fits perfect!!!!!
This item works well and was recieved promptly.  The lid comes attatched to the body with a small piece of rope which turned out to be a nuisance so I just cut it off...  I would rcomend this product
I purchased this knife for a gift and it was just what I was looking for.  As always Case knives are great.
A very sturdy well made knife which is a convenient size for carrying on a key chain. Case makes a quality product, made in the USA.
I bought this as a gift for my brother in law who is a doctor.  He loved how slim and simple it is.

This pocket knife is very well made for the price.  It's the perfect size that can handle most jobs needed for a pocket knife.  I like how it fits in my pocket without feeling too big or bulky.  I carry it with me and use it all the time, even when wearing a suit.  This my second one.  I lost my first one that I carried for many years.  After looking at many similar knives of different brands, none compared to the quality, craftsmanship and price of this case knife.  I would recommend this knife to anyone who's looking for a good quality, small and sturdy pocket knife, you won't be sorry you purchased it.
summary: Well made, very practical, perfect size, thin and sturdy. Well worth the price.

reviewText: So nice and slim it literately disappears in your pocket and that may have been a  contributing factor to me loosing my favorite pocket knife yesterday. W.R. Case steel is the finest blades I've ever used. I usually sharpen this surgical steel blade at 15 degrees for slicing and delicate cutting. Softer blades won't last a day at that angle. It holds up for months with daily use. It may not be the prettiest knife on the market but multiple trips through the washing machine have no effect on it either. Also the blade opens easily and locks up tight with no slop in the fit at all. It's a well made pocket knife and for $20 you'll find no finer blade for everyday carry

Good for carrying in slacks or a jacket pocket for whatever you need.  Blade has good edge retention, and has served me really well for months without a decent sharpening.  Just remember to leave it in your checked luggage at the airport or the TSA keep it to find out what a useful tool this is.

I just got this knife today. So far I really like it. I enjoy its the minimalist and understated styling. And it comes with a very sharp edge. Nothing much more to say. Two reasons I did not give it 5 stars.1: The edge that is available to take the blade out is a little small. I'd imagine that someone with large fingers might have a little problem doing so.2: Depressing the lock to get the blade back in is a little hard, I think it might loosen up a little with use.Otherwise, I'm very happy with the knife.
For that amount of money, I thought I would get a nice knife. It is so small it may get lost if I put it on the kitchen table. What a waste of my hard earned cash.Wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
great gift gave it to my dad and he loves it.it is cheap and worth the money you spend

I looked for a suitable pocket knife for a long time, having lost the one I purchased in the UK. Tried a number but all were too small, too bulky or too heavy to be real comfortable pocket knives.The Case executive lockback is JUST PERFECT!!  Well made and finished, neat and light enough to carry comfortably in my pocket.Very sharp blade and once used a few times the closing action became smooth. I am really delighted with this little beauty and recommend it highly. (Being raised in England I always looked for the "Made in Sheffield" sign for a quality product but so far this knife meets my demanding requirements!!).
Easy to carry in my pocket and easy to sharpen.  Easy to forget in your pocket when going through security at the airport.  I have given up two of them at Charlotte airport.

W.R. Case makes some of the very finest pocket knives currently available, and this model is an excellent example of the high quality of their products.  The blade is sharp, holds an edge extremely well, and is easy to care for, since it's made of stainless surgical steel.  The knife is easy to use, since it includes a lockback mechanism that holds it open firmly and safely during use.  It's convenient to carry because of its extremely slim profile.  It also includes a lanyard hole which makes it possible to carry the knife on a key chain, if one wishes.  This is a great knife that owners will cherish for many years.
summary: A great knife: easy to maintain and convenient to carry

reviewText: I am getting ready to purchase my second knife for a friend.  When I first openned the box I was not that impressed.  Looks are deceiving.  Not many folding knives have such a slim profile.  I put it on my key ring and hardly notice that it is there.  This doesn't mean that it isn't durable.  Number one in my book is utility. It is nice to always know where your knife is when you need it.  I use it several times each week. It is the best knife I have owned for every day openning of boxes envelopes, cutting string etc.
summary: Handy knife to have on a key ring

reviewText: It is the same knife I had on key rings for over 30 years. I gave look for a replacemt but case had it on line.

I give this knife a 3 star review only because it does hold a nice edge like case is known for. As far a the apperance of this knife I was Disappointed to say the least. This is nothing like any Case knife I have ever seen before. I have to say though it serves the purpose it was created for, and that is the only reason I am keeping it. It is a nice knife to have by your side if you need something sharp, however if you are a case collector, and are looking for the nice looking knife that case would usually sell, THIS IS NOT IT! This knife is NOTHING like I expected, and I advise you to read the description well before buying because the picture isn't the best.
summary: Not what you expect from Case

reviewText: It's a well-known brand, and a good product. Holds a good edge and is slim enough to carry without a big lump in the pocket.
Bought it as a gift for someone being in my wedding so I can't speak to the durability but out the box the knife seems very well made and should last a lifetime.
Very dissatisfied with the pocket knife. Blade was sharp, but so are most of the edges of the stainless handle. Lock is tight and when closed blade is not centered. Buck is a better choice.
summary: First Case knife is a dissapointment.

reviewText: Bought this for my husband & the blade broke at edge of blade!! VERY UPHAPPY & DISAPPOISED WITH THE QUALITY & IT WAS NOY ABUSED!!!

2 of these knives were purchased as gifts. I've rated this a 5 star because both recipients had previously owned this item.  Both used their knives heavily from cutting wire or other item of a household project to slicing an apple.  One was used hard for ~30 years and has been misplaced.  Both recipients are completely satisfied and appreciate receiving it as a gift.

This was purchased as a gift, and was just horrible.  It looked really cheap, in fact, if I didn't know better, I would have thought it came from a dollar store.  The edges when holding the knife when it was closed were sharp, it felt like it would be easy to get scratched or even cut on them.  Opening the knife was very hard, it was not a smooth opening at all.I had heard this brand of knife was supposed to be top-of-the-line, so that is why I bought it.  Upon receiving it, it looked like poorly made junk.  This was returned, and we bought something else as a gift.

I compared this to other brands and took the chance because of the good reviews. It's heavy and solid but light enough for 2 people to carry up to a bedroom which was my purpose in getting a smaller safe. I wish the barrel holders were notched deeper so rifles are more secure like the more solid rubber notches from Stack-On but overall Im happy.

Purchased this to go in a small home office. Very slim and fits well. Currently there are 5 long guns, 3 handguns and two ammo boxes inside and some room left. The cabinet is not fireproof. It is not super heavy (160lbs) so you can move it.  It is very safe and effective storage to keep children from opening. For a small collector it is a good size. With Amazon Prime it shipped free!! Nice surprise. The shipper will call you to arrange delivery and they were on time.

I really love the Safe! It is perfect for my needs. It is a little taller than the others and that allows more room in the safe above the shelf . The quality is excellent! Not a scratch on it. It was delivered to my door and with the detached Safe door it was not to bad of an install ( Just have a couple friends on hand). It comes with quality anchor bolts for the floor. I think the were 5/8" or 3/4' Nothing to bolt it to the wall. I had to purchase that seperate. I didn't think it would come with any anchors. It is fully carpeted even the shelf and my friends all thought is was one of the best they have seen too. Completely satisfied! Thankx for posting.
summary: Excellent! Not too much or too little! The Mechanical combination wheel is smooth and accurate.

reviewText: I don't understand why this is so expensive here. I was at Lowes today and saw this 10 gallon model 1610 cooler. The same cooler is only $47.96 at Lowes and that's not a sale price it's everyday price. Further more this is only $54.95 right on Rubbermaids web site. Sorry Hugo, the cat's out of the bag.The 5 stars is for the cooler. The cooler doesn't know it's being over priced here.
This cooler is great. I use it for home brewing (as a MLT) and it works amazing. It holds the same temperature for an hour when I am mashing. It makes brewing so much easier.
I bought a few of these awhile back for emergency water and since then our water has been cut off and we have had to use them for drinking and bathing.  Worked out really well.
Product works perfectly as a water cooler for our team practices and games. Just wish Rubbermaid offered it in a variety of colors - so it could match our school colors. Otherwise, it fits the bill.
Does whatever a cooler is supposed to do only with more style.  Well built, robust, pretty - the orange color is a plus.

We have used the this cooler several times and have had great results:* This thing is monsterous! We made Koolaid in it for one of our events, and at 10 gallons it took almost 20 packets and 20 cups of sugar to fill it!* No leakage* Easy to clean* Increadible cooler (we had ice in it for 3 days - and we ran out of water before the ice melted!)* Durable handles and lid (the lid is almost 2" thick?)* The small "black button" system is easier to clean than the handle types, and is less prone to breakingThe only down side is that some of the external seams have extra plastic, making them a little sharp - that may be just our unit though.We're going to buy another one for our scout troop - the solid handles don't catch like the hinged white types, so it can take a bit more of a beating.

The ad for the item got my attention, the description of the item was pretty good, but my imagination can only take me so far and the like the saying goes a picture is worth a thousand words.  I tried to find something that I could click to to the view the item clearly, but there was none.  My suggestion is a clear color picture.  That's is why you lost this sale.  Thank you.

I purchased one these 10 Gallon Coolers for the all grain process of brewing of beer.  I'm confident it would work well for other applications such as holding water, lemonade, etc.  I've used this several times with liquid ranging from 100 to 170 degrees farenheit with no problems.  I did replace the spigot with a high end stainless steel one to attach 3/4 inch tubing to it.  It was very easy to both remove the old spigot and put a new one on.  The lid is a little funky, but it spins on and off pretty easily.  It has a very durable feel to it, and I believe this is the same model that many home brew shops sell.  Overall it's a simple, but great product.
This knife is awesome.  I am a hunting guid and skin and quarter deer every week.  I can quarter 20+ deer befor needing to sharpen it.  Love it

High carbon steel, inexpensive good blade to skin with, my nephew skinned an entire elk without having to sharpen the knife so I bought one.  Perfect ergonomic feel to the knife, looking forward to using it.  I have many knives and know steel, this one is OK.

This is a sweet knife. The handle feels great in your hands. Great for when you are skinning a deer or hog. Knife comes very sharp. The sheath is alright, a little loose but that's fine. I like leather sheaths anyway and know a guy that makes some really nice affordable ones.

I recently got two of these knifes, and several others of different brand, thru a safety program at work. I like the appearance and general shape of the blade. Handle fits my hand nicely. The sheath is kind of cheesy in my opinion. My main concern is the blades of both knives are badly rolled over. I mean REALLY ROLLED OVER. Not what I expected from Case. Granted this knife isn't the most expensive you can buy, but this is a workmanship issue that really shouldn't have been. Not from Case. 2 stars.

I own the Case 00362 Hunting Knife and I have used it to skin several deer.  It is a good handling knife and keeps an edge while working wih it.  When needed you can touch up the edge with very little effort.  It use is not limited to the hunting field.  It is a good all around knife for house hold use.

This is an extraordinary item! The knife is very sharp and has a curve to it that makes it ideal for making way through weeds, etc. I've found varoius uses for it already. Also, the case makes it able to carry the knife on your side so that it's easily accessible and yet also somewhat hidden. Very, very nice combination. I couldn't have asked for more.

sharp as hell, has a handle that grips well and thumb grips along two places on the spine of the blade.  Even when your hands get covered with guts and blood, this won't slip out of your hands and your thumb won't slip off the grooves.  Great Knife!  Kinda tricky to sharpen well IMO

COULDN'T HAVE ASKED FOR A BETTER KNIFE!!!!!My grandpa gave mine about 3 years ago (as I didn't get it from here) but it has been my daily carried knife and go to knife and it always will be. I've carried it from just around the house all the way to skinning a deer. It's always their for and is super easy to sharpen, so couldn't ask for a better knife. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT FOR ANYBODY THAT NEEDS A NEW KNIFE!!!!!
summary: COULDN'T HAVE ASKED FOR A BETTER KNIFE!

reviewText: a really solid knife, made very well. very nice and practical design and a good grip (i wouldve gotten the wood but it was more money). overall definitely worth buying, cant wait to use it
This knife was perfect.  The description was accurate.  The package arrived early and in tact.  No scratches or dentson the package.

Unlike most small-sized, stainless steel pocket knives, this Case & Sons model is exceptionally easy to open.  It has a great vintage look and smooth action.  The blade is stainless steel, sure for a long life, and  comes sharp as ever.  The only draw back is that is has no blade lock.

We bought this for my brother in law and he is going to love it. Its a Christmas gift so he hasnt received it yet, but as soon as he does he will be tickled. The blades are sharp and the knife itself is awesome quality. Comes in a nice box too.

My husband thinks these are the greatest, he likes the light weight but the blades are very sharp & stay sharp. He forgot to leave his at home the last time he flew so he thought he need a replacement.

The Peanut is small, but it looks and feels like the quality you'd expect from Case.  I bought 10 of this knife, and 3 more with real bone handle, as gifts for my groomsmen, ushers, father, and father-in-law (and one for myself!).  The yellow handle looks classic and a bit vintage, I think.  Everyone seemed to appreciate the quality right out of the box.

Hard to find a product like this in the UK and harder still to find UK reviews, but definitely worth getting hold of one of these.I've hunted high and low for the perfect pocket knife and I've lost count of the times when I've needed something for an everyday job and had to make do. I've looked at and tried a whole variety of brands, designs and sizes over the years.Considering UK knife law, weight, size, blade material (My Dad always used to go on about Chrome Vanadium - with good reason I realised when I got older), blade strength, ease of sharpening, edge retention, shape, style, build quality, looks, heritage and just plain usefulness this has to be the perfect solution.It goes in jeans pockets or suit pockets easily and unobtrusively.If you want an everyday pocket knife that'll do all-sorts of jobs big and small, and sit unobtrusively in your pocket then this is the one.
summary: Perfect EDC in any trouser pocket

reviewText: i am looking for tuxedos and other exotic handled knives.
Excellent quality for the money. Exactly what I wanted. Very happy with my selection. Prompt delivery. This is my everday knife that I carry.
I couldn't be happier with this little knife. Just the right size for the pocket. I have owned Case knives for years and they always live up to their name.
summary: Excellent Quality In A Small Knife.

reviewText: This knife is small enough to fit comfortably in my pocket, so I take it with me everywhere. The blades are very sharp--much better than stainless steel!--and have stayed that way for several months of everyday use.Note that the blades will be hard to move at first, but will losen up after using it for a while. You should also oil the blades regularly (use 3-in-1 or something similar), and use metal polish to remove spotting when it occurs.
Every time we have steaks out over a fire, I had to constantly ask hubby to borrow his knife, this one is perfect!!!  No more borrowing, this one is the perfect ladies knife that cuts like a mans!!

I ordered this knife and both the quality of Case and the fast service of Amazon were 5 star.  The peanut is a perfect knife for everyday use. (unless you need to dress out game or other chores better designed for fixed handle knives.)  The CV steel stays extremely sharp and the quality if flaw free.  The handle is comfortable to hold in the hand. The size makes it easy to carry and yet the blades are of a very useful size.  I highly recommend Case, the peanut size knife, and the service from Amazon.
summary: peanut the perfect pocket knife for every day use.

reviewText: The Case Peanut is a wonderful little pocket knife.  Like all Case knives it is a quality product.  It is real  pleasure to carry.

My Case Peanut came in the mail today and I am very happy with it. The quality is above most other brands that I've tried over my lifetime. I will be using mine for daily carry which is why I chose the yellow handle and Chrome Vanadium blades (for easy sharpening). As I look over my new peanut knife, I can't find a single defect or flaw - it's polished shiny and smooth and the blades open and close responsively. In the open position, the blades are firm with no wiggle whatsoever and they close back with a decisive "snap" aka; the knife "talks."  Long story short, mine came to me absolutely perfect.
Buy two, another well made in the USA product, beautiful design and very sharp, should hold a good edge for a long time.

This knife fulfilled the two things I was looking for -- made in the U.S.A. and chrome vanadium blades.  Considering the quality of the knife, the affordable price, and the Case reputation, this knife is hard to beat.
small but very handy!  don't even know it's in my pocket.  used it 3 times my first day after arrival.  perfect small pocket knive.
I was looking for a Calliumas Knife and this was in that line but i should have read more its not the knife I was looking for, but its a great knife

Perfect size pocket knife for all adult. My husband loves it, and so do I. He uses it all the time. I found it in the washer one day (after washer completed it duty) the knife was fine! Opens easily and sharp.
Anticipate the blades to be stiff, at least at first.  It is heavy.  A single blade would actually be a better design.
Perfect watch-pocket knife. Needed an edge touch up when I got it, but every knife does. I would buy another just to have a spare.

My yellow peanut Case goes everywhere with me, except the airport and federal buildings of course.  Small enough to forget its there, useful enough to always remember it (how about that!).  The blades are NOT stainless, but are chrome vanadium - making them superior for sharpening.  You'll never realize how bad you needed one of these in your pocket until you start carrying one.  Wonderful little machine.
Classic style pocket knife without frills or gizmos. Very Cool!
This is a great  pocketknife I'm really impressed with the quality is great for everything you do I highly recommend it to everyone

For years I carried a tiny Swiss Army knife on my keychain and used it all the time for small duties like opening packages, trimming rope, cords, string, etc. But it finally got to the point that it needed replacement. Since I almost never used anything but the main blade, I thought something slightly larger might prove even more useful. This Case Peanut fits nicely in the change or watch pocket of jeans, where's it's handy for those same jobs and the larger blade gives it added utility. This is a finely crafted little instrument. The fit and finish are flawless. The blades are razor sharp and lock firmly into position. I really like the traditional look with the pale yellow handles. Everything about this knife says quality.

I was not completely satisfied with this product. I have been purchasing Case pocket knives for over 20 years and I have always been satisfied with the quality of Case Knives. I love the style of this particular knife. I have two others just like it with different handle material. This knife has a hair line crack on both sides of the knife where the handles are attached to the sides of the knife. This is the first time that I have purchased a Case knife that was not excellent quality. I was sent a second knife to replace the one that I purchased and it also had the same defect. I must say that I was disappointed. Thanks, for asking my opinion. William J. Wells, Case knife collector.

The Blue Ice isn't what is pictured.  It comes in a white plastic bag with the top folded over and stuck together so it doesn't open.  I've used it a couple of times and don't think it's as good as what I used to have, that was like the Blue Ice that was pictured in the advertisement.A.L.

This Case Peanut is a beautiful classic knife.  When you hold it you really understand what design is - beauty, function and form.  The machining is excellent, everything lines up, the materials are good, and the blades sharp.At 2 3/4" closed, the Peanut is similar to a classic small slip-blade pen knife, only the 2 blades (longer clip and smaller pen) are side-by-side rather than one on each end.  This makes it a little bit thicker, but it's still very much a light, comfortable to carry loose in the pocket every day, knife.  Both blades have 90 degree half-stops.The Peanut is sold with either "Chrome Vanadium" (carbon) or "Tru-Sharp surgical" (stainless) steel blades.  The CV steel should take and hold a sharper edge (mine was very sharp out of the box and is holding it well), but will loose their luster and develop a light patina over time.  Mine's doing pretty well - you only get minor graying around the tip and thumb-nail mark unless you use it to cut fruit.  Cutting an apple caused some near immediate discoloration.  However the luster came back with a bit of metal polish.  Several months later, I bought my brother-in-law the SS version.  It has a really nice blade with a great edge - sharpest SS pocket knife blade I've seen out of the box.  Given the quality of Case's stainless, I'd lean towards it.The Peanut is sold in a number of handle materials / colors including synthetic, bone, stag, corelon, and mother of pearl.  The handle material you choose affects the price greatly.  Yellow Synthetic is a popular lower cost option that provides good looks, durability and value.  It is solid and quite hard (like Corian, not plastic) and very resistant to dings.  The color is a soft lemon cream that looks really nice against the polished silver / nickel bolsters (to me at least). The brass side rivets are flush and all seams are smooth to the touch.  I really like it and would choose it again.Not much to add.  It's a well made, well written up, elegantly designed classic little knife.  There's a reason Case has such a following.  This is about my 20th pocket knife but my first Case.  It is something special and doesn't have a crazy price tag.  It's become one of my couple favorites.
summary: A beautiful, classic, small pocket knife

reviewText: As always case delivers a great pocketknife.  i bought this one for my dad to replace the knife he lost.  I bought specifically because he wants a knife for every day use and this one has chrome vanadium blades and can be easily sharpened, unlike the typical stainless steel blades.  This is an excellent product with a high utility value, not juts a show piece or a collector's item.
Bought two,each developed a leak in less then a month. Very disappointed in quality of merchandise.Quick delivery and well packaged.
summary: Rubber Maid 1006 Blue Ice Soft Pack

reviewText: That pretty much sums it up. I would definitely recommend these. Two months of daily use, and they still haven't leaked.
summary: A bit large for lunch boxes, they stay cold forever.

reviewText: This little ice pack keeps frozen for hours.  It's normal use is for ice chests, but I use it for back pain.  I can put it in a pillow case, apply it to the hurt, and it's a big help.  The cold packs sold in drug stores are filled with a jel that does not freeze, so they only stay cold for less than an hour. I like to use it while I watch tv at night to reduce inflamation before I go to bed.  If you want to KEEP something cold for hours vs. minutes, this is a great choice for the price.
I was looking for something to give more back to my employees throughout the day, this helped and was very reasonably priced

casting was rough around spigot., 60 secs with a razor knife and i was good too go . had so many over the years , but this deign always held up best  ,usually my negligence when they do die , then u have a planter
summary: been drinking water out of them for 35 yrs

reviewText: For when 2 gallons isn't enough but 5 is too much in the 120 degree AZ heat. I was late posting this review but Rubbermaid is a solid product always

I take my lunch to work every day to save money. I bought these packs at our local Target and I'm the ONLY one who uses them, so I know the care that's been given to them. One day, less than 30 days after buying them, I noticed that the outside of my sandwich bag had blue streaks on it. I was mystified as to WHERE it was coming from, thinking my blueberry yogurt had leaked. Fortunately for me, the discoloration was on the outside of the sandwich bag, so I could eat my lunch. When I returned home at the end of the day, I opened my small lunch pail cooler to clean it out and refreeze the bags, only to find a quagmire of blue goo all over the inside of my lunch pail!!! I still couldn't figure out where it was coming from (hey, it took me a second!) until I read "Blue Ice" on the split open bag and then it was a "D'Oh!!!" moment. BOTH of the bags had broken open and leaked and were immediately rinsed and tossed into the recycle bin. I went to Walmart the next day and bought 4 Coleman Ice packs. Five months later, they are working brilliantly with NO LEAKS!!!NOTE: I'm not used to a BLUE gel, in my defense. I'm accustomed to a CLEAR freezing gel from my freezer mugs and ice cubes. :)
When I bought this cooler it came in a box and the part for the cupholder was glue on not properly and i believe it use. don't buy from them.

Great product. My husband had his previous one for 15 years on a work truck. Needed the same one to be able to fit in the box.I would reccommend this product.Rubbermaid #1683-01-11 3gal Orange Water Cooler

First trip, I filled 2/3 of this cooler with ice then lay it on its side on a roof rack.  A day later, I got it off the top of the car and although some ice had melted, I was amazed that nothing leaked from the lid.  Filled the cooler up with water at that point and 2 days later, still had a little bit of ice.Second trip, filled about 1/3 with ice and water to about 3/4 full.  Next day, most of the ice was gone even though outside temps were about the same as trip #1.So now I know not to skimp on ice (I already don't like drinking water so if I have to it better be ice cold) but I'm impressed the lid holds so securely.  The spout is easy to operate with one hand and our 5-year old has no problems with it.  Handles feel sturdy and are comfortable enough to carry a full jug with just one.
summary: Not the best insulator, but no leaks!

reviewText: I bought this for the guys to use in the shop.  Each morning I would put chunks of ice in it that I had froze the night before in cool whip containers.  It kept the water cool all day and is a nice size depending on your usage.  The only downfall I can see is the fact that the lid is often nearly impossible to remove.  We always leave the lid somewhat loose to allow for air, but if a large amount of water is taken at one time removing the lid can still pose a challenge.
It holds everything from drinks to ice. The build quality is nice, and I have had no issues with my cooler.

Converted this into a mash tun to use in the brewing of beer. It's been used to hold boiling or hot water and has held up well. Slight warping from the heat but not very much. I find it loses around 3-5 degrees F for a one hour mash. It's a little on the small side but big enough.

Very durable construction. Just like I remember as a kid at soccer games this cooler will be for my kids to drink out of at their soccer games. The spout is so easy to operate my 5 year old can use it. Will probably buy some more of these for camping.

This is a very big water cooler that is handy to have around for gatherings and outdoor events. I fill it with ice tea for BBQ's in my backyard and have gotten a lot of good use out of it. Build quality is excellent and construction is sturdy. A grown adult can even sit on this with no problem. It's a nice, attractive bright orange color that's fun to look at and easy to spot.
