The side has a cup holder, but I never use it as it's clumsy to keep attached.The spigot is easy to push and automatically shuts off when its released. It enables one-handed operation: use your fingers to grip the cup and your thumb to push the spigot, important when you're trying to juggle several things at once. The spigot does not leak or drip. Because the spigot is positioned low on the unit, you do have to place the cooler on the edge of a table or other raised surface so you can get a cup under it. Gravity draws liquid out.I'm very satisfied with this cooler.
Ugly orange - but extremely functional.Had to replace one (its spout broke due to too much traveling - we'repretty hard on them) - I didn't even look at another brand.

We got two of these for our annual 4th of July party and they're great. The full-width lid makes them very easy to clean; our old Coleman five gallon works well, but sticking my hand a foot and a half in through the four inch hole to scrub it out while trying to see what I'm doing is work for a contortionist. They're extremely well insulated - my wife made a gallon of lemonade ice cubes to chill the three gallons of lemonade in one container, and they were only about half melted thirty hours later despite of the eighty-plus degree heat. I've seen them a little cheaper at a local chain store, but it was worth the extra three bucks to not be advertising that store in five inch letters on the front of each jug. For the quality, the value and the ease of use, I highly recommend these containers.
Works well, no problems.  I like that the cap screws on and stays on.  It does not spill in the car.

I bought this cooler at Wal-mart a day ago with the purpose of having my neighbor fill it with filtered ionized kangen water. To my dismay the spigot is poorly designed and slowly drips out. I walked into my kitchen for a glass of water and ended up with a big headache, water was all over the kitchen!!! Maybe I just got a defective product but judging from another reviewer with a similar problem it seems like a reoccuring problem. I will never buy another Coleman cooler again...
We use this for camping trips.  We put two blocks of ice in it and it will keep water cold the whole 3 day weekend.  Made in USA!
summary: These work great!  Made in USA too!

reviewText: We use these water coolers to provide water areas on the outside fields. They're easy to clean, and are sturdy enough to handle tons of day camp kids and staff. I've bought these for years, and will continue to do so if one breaks (Usually caused by someone knocking off the dispenser in front).
summary: Perfect for field / heavy duty use

reviewText: Classic sports cooler.  Sturdy. The typical standard ice and water container.  Perfect for teams or for check points at running events.
It is roomy, keeps cool, sturdy, easy to clean so far and a nice color.  We purchased two and they are worth it.

We bought this to hold hot water for an event for Thanksgiving to feed those without a home. I was not sure how this would hold up so I made sure to put boiling hot water in it. To my surprise this thing kept the temperature perfect! Very happy!
I use this for when I go where there is no running water. It did the job. No leaks. However, I have found similar water jugs cheaper at Home Depot.
This item is rugged , excellent for construction worker, I'M a landscaper and it does the job perfectly, keeps the water cool and works just fine +++ the price was the best RECOMMENDED !!!
summary: Best Deal on the web for this item !

reviewText: Sturdy enough. Top is easy to remove.  I have seen no leaking issues so far, whatsoever, and it gets some pretty harsh use.  The handles are on there good as well.

In my opinion, this software is great, especially for a backpacker who just wants to use a GPS as a "toy".  There are 15 major national parks with 4 map views and more than adequate zoom capabilities.  In addition, it is possible to create your own routes (by drawing them with your mouse), obtain elevation gains/losses, and automatically create and upload up to 30 waypoints per route to your GPS.  There is a search engine to find various points of interest (mines, cemetaries, overlooks, etc) off the beaten path that will give you an exact waypoint to go exploring with a GPS unit.  For the average person who likes the seclusion of the backcountry of national parks, who for the most part stays on the trails and assigned backcountry campsites, and who wants to use a GPS, this program is perfect.
summary: Highly recommended for the average bacpacker

reviewText: Small number of Parks with limited trial information. Not worth it. Not easy to transfer to GPS unit.

I simply love the fact that if this cooler gets dumped out of the truck or boat or off the porch, that nothing spills out.  The screw-top lid is the most secure of all.But the problem is with the spigot design.  When the rubber "cover" gives out, you've got a leaker.  What a bone-head design.  I'm going to seal up the spigot hole as I don't use this cooler for water anymore.  It was used for that for a couple of years, then became my camping/fishing/truck cooler.  Now it is side-lined until I repair (permanently) the leak.I'll buy Igloo the next time i want one of these type coolers-especially if I want to depend on it as a water cooler.  But also note that I'm very hard on coolers.
summary: screw top rocks, leaky faucet stinks

reviewText: According to the specifications this product is only available for Windows 95, 98, or NT and supports just a few GPS devices. But it is based on the same program (Topo) used in National Geographic State Series, which is compatible with windows 2000, XP and 60+ GPS receivers. You only need the free Topo upgrade available at Nevertheless, TrailSmart series was created by scanning Trails Illustrated maps, so don't expect the quality of USGS maps found in the State Series. In my opinion trails don't have enough accuracy in this product (I tried Yellowstone).
It doesnt work. Clear and simple. I have a Sega Genesis that plays all my old games, but this copy of NBA Jam doesnt work.

TrailSmart/Topo offers the best Maps on CD that I've seen, at least for people like me - hard core hiker, map nerd and computer geek. The viewer allows seamless display of USGS 7-1/2 minute quads as you pan across, up  and down exploring the cyber world. You can draw your trips on the maps,  add text labels and symbols; and print them out on your color printer. You  can also download tiny .tpo files from the topo website where people like  me share their favorite trips with you.Each area covered comes with maps  at 4 or 5 levels of zoom - so you can make good driving and overview maps -  and still get all the detail you need. The closest version is usually  1:24,000 (regular USGS 7-1/2 minute) and contains most of the information  found on the quads.(Some areas of coverage do not go down to 1:24,000  and are not useful for hiking).I use the Zion, Arches and Grand Teton  Sections, and have not used the others. It really helps to have a color  printer to print the maps out.
summary: Easy to Use Maps on CDs

reviewText: I don't know what other people are talking about when they claim the game isn't "realistic basketball". The only basketball I've ever played was 2 on 2 with balls that burn the net and absolutely no fouls, ever. This game has the coolest announcer in the history of announcing. He proclaims "He's on fire, BOOM-SHAKALAKA, FROM DOWNTOWN" and other awesome stuff. This is as real as it gets too. All 26 NBA teams including the Charlotte Hornets and Seattle Supersonics.
Not a real basketball game. but you can dunk from all the way across the court. so its a pretty good game.  i would recommend it to anyone who wants fun, but not to true b-ball fans!

BOOM SHOCKLOKA! This game is a tru!e blast from the past. Was a lot of fun 2 play on the Genesis and on the Arcade. Def classic game where you could slam dunk while bursting into flames! LOL this game was kinda wacky like a lot of old school games
summary: Oh my god he's on FIRE!

reviewText: To the game play the sound graphics anything you could ask for is delivered in this one!  A Top game in my collection!
I remember playing this game when I was little, playing it again over ten years later brought back a lot of memories!

I have ordered at least 3 systems and bout 20 or 30 games and they all came within 4 days after shipping!!! All classic video games are all here from sega genesis to n64 amazon has it all and it's so legit. Games that I always wanted since the tender age of 7! I know where to shop for throwback games now.
summary: So Legit Can't Quit on the games

reviewText: Game was defective. Was strobing light while playing video quality was poor.wish it worked I loved this game as a kid.
Its great fun just as remembered. The teams the dunks the gameplay the big heads. Although Hangtime is better. Still recommend it .
Not as great as I remember, but still good.
NBA Jam T.E. is one of the best acade style sports games in the macket right now.
This game is still as much fun to play as I remember from Jr. High days. You won't regret adding this back to your video game collection.
summary: One of the best Genesis titles ever.

reviewText: I use this for cleaning burnt on food from my glass cook top and it works just fine.  I would recommend this product.

I've been using this scraper since i bought it and can say it's not worth the money. Came in a bright yellow, i was expecting the one in the photo, blade quality is poor, dulls quickly, blade also rusts like no other. But will get you through a job or two. I am now using Ettore's scrapmaster and as a window washer love it. i would recommend ETTORE'S scrappers, and of course this is all from my experience and personal preference.

Very functional, works just fine.Nice ergo design so comfortable to use.  Decent quality , a good value.Still don't understand why some people insist on saving a fw dollars and scrape with bare razors....Aren't your fingers wroth a few bucks ?

I am a sharp edge junkie. Utility blades top my list of good clean cutting action. This tool has expanded my use of utility blades from being just the point to be my flat scraper of choice for push or pull applications. Finished and unfinished; glass, drywall spackle, wood, butcher block, pots, and granite have come under the blade of this simple tool. It takes less then 10 seconds to change the blade. Or, if you are like me, grabbing the utility blade out of the tool and getting that last bit of goo from the corner.

As a painter for over 15 yrs I have had a chance to use all types of scrapers and I still find using this as my favorite. It has double the practical use since the blades needed for it are actually the same that I would use for my utility knife. Its is definately a good buy!!!

I bought this thing thinking that I could use it to scrape the paint siding. It does not work. Very cheap material, all plastic. Made in China. Poorly made. If you read this and still buy this anyway because of the cheap price, you will blame yourself later.
No big deal.  I am disappointed the blade isn't held a bit more snuggly but that has not been a problem yet.
An excellent scraper I have used for years.  Can't find it locally any more so I bought two of them.
I am sure that these are great for some people. However, I am a tool junkie and have many other knife blades that are more robust and sharper.
This thing is GREAT.  The previous owner of my house put this crappy 'tint' on all the windows that I wanted to remove.  This thing did an amazing job without damaging my glass.
I recieved the blades and installed them in the knives, and they work the way they are suppossed to.
I bought 3 of the folding knives and a pile of the replacement blades. I use one in my wood shop as a marking/scribe blade and the others are in the house for whatever I want to cut.
I love this knife, and I have used it for years at my work.  Its been hard to find in the store, but glad I found them on Amazon.
just blade.I can't tell you anything about this blade.look sharp and nice cut.But I did no use yet.That is very cheap.If you need it. get it.

I use these blades (11-040 and 11-041)  and the Stanley knife (10-049) daily at my job. I can tell you with over 250+ cuts per day these blade will last well over a month. I have tried other blades and they just do not perform like this one. I have never known these blades to break or bend when used in an industrial setting for cutting everything from light plastics and paper to heavy duty cardboard. You will not be disappointed with this product

I had the Stanley knife that this blade fits into for many years, maybe 20?  I used it all the time, and then I put it away for a few years.  I decided to get a new blade recently.  The surprise in the title refers to the fact that the blade did fit perfectly even after all these years.  And the price was not bad, considering inflation.
Am using as a replacement to one I have had for a long tme I have used it for general purpose around the apartment; The design of the blade has been very versatile for me.

Since I bought the knife, I figured I better get a replacement. They are easy to replace with a screwdriver. If I have one gripe about the blades it's that they don't seem to keep an edge as long as I think they should. Of course, that may have something to do with the way I use the knife, so it's really not a complaint. More of an observation. At any rate, it's always good to have a replacement handy.
This is an ultra sharp replacement blade for the Stanley Utility knife.  The blade easily is replaced in the utility knife and is a good value.  I purchased three of them.
summary: Fine replacement blade for the Stanley Utility Knife

reviewText: Rather high priced but really sharp and fits the Stanley folding pocket knife like a glove. These blades may be sharpened a few times if you have some very fine lapping stones or diamond plate finishing stones.
this is my favorite utility knife, i use them for carving, they are razor sharp and can be resharpened; i have several of the handles and buying the blades "in bulk" is a real savings
It is a sharp and durable blade. I have used it for years, I just replaced what I knew that worked for me in the past.
These blades fit my old Sheffield box cutter perfectly, they are sharp as heck and inexpensive to boot. Definitely recommended.
No disappointments here, I received exactly what I expected to receive and was able to refill my utility knife and put it back to good use.

My husband is an electrician and he strips a lot of wire so he needs some very strong blades that will not break on him easily. He said these were much better than the ones you buy in a store. They last longer and much more durable. Well worth the price.
great blades.  fit most replacements. sharp and hold an edge very well.  always good to have some extras on hand.
These have lasted a long time, they have resisted rust and bending and have stayed sharp. I've stocked up on them, and given some to family for their home remodeling.
I have the switch blade style knife and these blades fit it perfect. They come pre-oiled and are very sharp!
Great!The product performed as advertised. It is the required blade for the utility knife that needed the replacement blade.

I haven't changed my box cutter blade since I purchased it. I knew it was dull but, I had no idea how dull it really was. Now, I feel like I can cut anything. These blades are so sharp that I now cut boxes like butter.
The blades worked well in my utility knife. I used one side of just one blade to cut enough cork to do my backsplash and I'm still using it.
It feels strong and heavy-duty.  Keeps all oiled blades together in the utility knife.  I used it and it worked well for me.
I love using this product! They are heavy duty and never disappoint. The five pack makes it super convenient when the blades become dull.
Bought a new utility knife and these blades to go with it.  Later I found out the blade size is standard & a lot cheaper elsewhere.

I didn't need 100 of these. I didn't even need 50. 5 I could work with. I don't go through blades like water, one blade will last me a year. This was a great purchase. Not too many blades, great price. If you're the occasional blade replacer like I am, this is for you!
I purchased these heavy duty utility blades for my Stanley knife, and they work well.  What else can I say?
It's Stanley, how can you go wrong! The price was fair and the blades are great. You can easily six months of use if you do electrical work like I do. Highly recommended
These are stupid cheap! I bought 2 packs and they both fit in the holster... Exactly what I needed at an awesome price!

Stanley 11-921 5-Pack 1992 Heavy Duty Utility BladesSTANLEY 11-921 HEAVY-DUTY UTILITY BLADES, 5-pack: Five extra high-carbon steel blades; 024-Inch' thickness fits most standard utility knives. Engineered for general-purpose cutting. Dimensions: 2-7/16-Inches length. Precision-honed edge for consistent and extended cutting life. Fits most Heavy Duty and standard utility knives. Everyone knows the importance of the right tool for the job. Stanley's "Application Specific Blades" are designed with unique features for cutting drywall, roofing shingles and paper. Each blade is constructed of carbon alloy steel. With Stanley's patented S3 Technology, paper blades start sharper and stay sharper, roofing blades are stronger, and drywall and paper blades deliver more cuts per blade. The entire line provides better performance than standard heavy duty blades. The rougher the cutting such as shingles will go through more blades than if you are cutting sheet rock or cardboard.Some of the product features:* Engineered for general-purpose cutting* Precision-honed edge for consistent and extended cutting life* Fits most 6-Inch standard utility knives* The blade is reversible* Blade is 0.024-Inch thick and 2-7/16-Inches in length* Limited Lifetime Warranty* Made in the U.S.A.Fits most 6-Inch standard utility knives. For use with KN110, KN111, KN112, KN113, KN114 and KN115. Double notch. Stanley 10-099 6-Inch Classic 99 Retractable Utility Knife, Greenlee 0652-23 Heavy-Duty Folding Utility Knife, Bessey D-BKWH Quick-Change Folding Utility Knife - Wood Grain Handle, Milwaukee 48-22-1901 Fastback Flip Open Utility Knife, ProGrade 82067 Utility Knife, Gerber 31-000345 E.A.B. Lite Pocket Knife, Fine Edge, and BOSTITCH 10-499 Quick-Change Utility Knife with Retractable Blade and Twine Cutter, SilverStanley warrants this product to the original purchaser for its useful life against deficiencies in material and workmanship. This LIMITED LIFETIME WARRANTY does not cover products that are improperly used, abused, altered or repaired. Deficient products will be replaced or repaired.It is very important to use some good safety gloves to protect your hands, fingers and arms from being cut by the sharp blade. You should cut away from your body to avoid injury. Wear safety eye protection as well. Keep loose fitting clothing away from the blade.

I use my utility knife quite frequently, and I would not even consider using anything but Genuine Stanley Replacement Blades. There really is a difference. Second rate brands fit poorly and dull quickly. If you want great performance from your utility knife, insist on Stanley! There is no substitute!
These blades are very sharp and work perfectly!  Also they fit well into my cheap box cutter!  I will repurchase in the future.
Durable, blades.  Great price, gets the job done.  What more do I need to say?I like Cereal.  Puppies are cute.

Stanley makes high quality tools.  These replacement box cutter blades are sharp and last long.  The five pack is priced fairly.  The blades are easy to replace and store in the handle of the Stanley box cutter.
these blades were sharp when I got them and still are. I've used them several times and they're still sharp. good blades.
summary: sharp blade, good for cutting things

reviewText: Sharp
Great mat for sleeping. Extra wide, bought it for sleeping on a dorm room floor. Most portable air mattress I have ever used and it is extremely comfortable.
Not sure what to say - it's a pool toy.  Does what it's supposed to....  Lasts forever, floats, fun to play on.
Great float for back and stomach floating.  You are in the water while laying on this float.  Holds its air well.  Bendable flexible float.

Overall the quality of these blades is satisfactory.  I cut up cardboard continuously for about 20 minutes before having to switch it around.  For everyday or around the house cutting these will work great.
Purchased these for an Aruba trip to use on the calm waters of Palm Beach and also the hotel's lazy river.Inflated it still rolls up and that was a big plus when carrying it around.
The Wave Raft was impossible to completely inflate. And impossible to completely deflate.I am not getting the full refund - because I am being charged for the return shipping.

This is my favorite raft.  I like that it is nice and wide (you can lay comfortably) and it is close to the water so you remain cool while you are floating (a big plus in AZ).  The only downside of this raft is when the water is freezing cold (pre-summer pool water temperature) it may not be the raft you would want to use.I keep several of these on hand for when friends come over to swim/lay out in the pool.  They are nice and thin/easy to store when not using.  These are also easy to roll up (secure with a strap) and take to a friend's pool or to the lake.  You can deflate easily/fast and inflate fast in case storage may be a problem.

Is it reasonable to give a five star rating to an item that has failed?  That's what I'm doing, which gives you an idea of how great I think this float is.  It is soo comfortable, even for a LARGE woman.  It is easy to climb on and off of, easy to shift positions, easy to transport and store.  I used mine at the lake about eight times over two months, then found it flat the next time I took it out of the bag I was storing it in.  But guess what?  I just ordered THREE more for myself and guests! (We have a few more weeks of summer here in SC.)I have not tried to patch my old one but may try if I can find the leak.  To be fair, it's possible that my kitty, who loves to lick plastic, found the float in my closet and had a nibble or kneaded it with claws.  I DID find him scrounging around in the closet.  With the new ones I will use two large garbage bags for each one with a poster board layer between the two bags and maybe a circular cardboard top and bottom to protect the rolled up float from my cat.  (Of course I don't know that was the problem.)Oddly, I would say that using it even seven times was worth the price I paid-- it was heavenly floating on that lake on just a thin layer of water.
summary: Five Stars even though it failed!

reviewText: Offered on Amazon at an unbeatable price,I purchased this Intex Tote-N-Float WaveMat as a replacement for one I previouslyowned for over 5 years.  These are VERYdurable and comfortable as well.  Since thefloat is 90 Inches in length, its perfect forthose of us who find it difficult to lounge on ageneric 72 inch mat, PLUS its almost 3 feetwide! I highly recommend the Intex Tote-N-FloatWave Mat for tanning as well as relaxing ... = )UPDATE-August 20, 2013: After using this wonderfulWave Mat only a handful of times, it developed a leakin the pillow and in one of the wavy seams ... = (Fortunately, there's only one more week of Summer.Maybe this year's batch of Wave Mats were defective?UPDATE-End of August, 2013:  After repairing the leakon the Seam of my Wavy Mattress, four other leakssimultaneously, one by one, started appearing alongeach of the seams directly below the original leak.Probably a chain reaction, but my wonderful wave mathad to be thrown away after only 5 pool visits ... = (
summary: The Perfect Float for TALL People

reviewText: I bought one of these at a store in my area two summers ago and absolutely love it.  The size, length, everything really makes it the best inflatable float out there.  I love that I can roll it up and store it inside overnight and not have it take up too much room.  It's a great float, so much better than floats that have the long tubes for air.  My one complaint would be that the brightness of the colors make it a little hard on the eyes when out in the sun.  I have a green and a pink one now and I find it's best to always have sunglasses on when using the raft.I purchased one here on Amazon this summer because I wanted to make sure I had an extra on hand in case the old one springs a leak (the stores are already sold out), and I really was hoping to find it in blue.  The ones I found at the store advertise it in green, yellow and pink and the box shows the three colors, green, yellow and pink.  The box I received in the mail was exactly like the one I saw in the store.  I have tried to find this raft in the blue color and I always see the green, yellow, and pink.  I know it says "colors may vary" but I honestly feel as though the raft does not exist in a blue.  I would love to have it in blue because I feel it would be the least straining on the eyes, but I don't think it exists.  So I'll just have to settle for the green and pink ones I have until someone can convince me otherwise that it does in fact come in blue.
Shipped quickly.  Lightweight and flexible so it is easy to transport.  Nice size.  Handles tall and large adult.  Only wish we could choose the color.
summary: Lightweight and flexible so it is easy to transport

reviewText: I love this mat. Perfect for what I was looking for. Plenty wide. Allows you to remain partially in the water while floating. Very flexible. Rolls up for storage.
These floats are fabulous.  They're wider than the normal float and just what ourfamily loves for having fun in the pool!
I love this float!  It is very comfortable, durable, and easy to store.  I also bought one for a friend as a gift and she loves it too!!

Loved the size so ordered a second one.  Unfortunately by the time it arrived the first one had developed a leak. The first one had been used only about four times.  It was hard to determine at first where the leak was but finally found it on the edge on one of the seams.  No apparent hole or damage just looks the seal wasn't sufficient. Am highly disappointed.  I doubt it is fixable.
summary: It was great while it lasted

reviewText: We have had two of these floaty's for over a month for use in our pool! They are of  good quality and stay inflated! We haven't had to reinflate them since we bought them! Very happy with the purchase!
i have tried filling this up a few times,must have a leak-impossible to find-due to wavy nature and small chambers..even when it is full,not very sturdy-flimsy

I had been watching other pool users with their floats and determined this was the kind of float I wanted.  I thought Amazon might be my best bet for finding it, and I was right.  Although color is not an option (I received lime green), the float work beautifully.  The seller sent it in record time, too!

I was thinking of buying a pool float to use as my camping mat and I found a great deal.  $10 for an air mattress SOLD!  Luckily for me I have an air pump with me when i go canoe camping because my canoe is inflatable.  If I didn't i would Not get this, as it is VERY hard to inflate.  Because I have a foot pump it takes me 5-10 minutes to pump this up and for $10 it works for me.If you have a pump then this will do for your camping or pool needs.  If you don't then I would not get it as it is VERY hard to inflate.Others said its also hard to deflate, i found if you cut/puncture the inner seal and just let it deflate on its own its fine.

I like Intex pool products. I have several and they are well-designed and an excellent value.The Tote-N-Float is thin and wide, which makes for a very comfortable float which holds you partially in the water but keeps your head and the upper half of your body above water - a very nice experience.But don't count on the color you get - even after you receive it.I received an orange - it was actually hot orange - which looked great in the pool. Unfortunately, the next day the Florida sunlight (though under a lanai screen) had turned it Canary Yellow.  Three days later it was pale yellow, and now, two weeks later, it appears to be moving toward Ivory with Canary Yellow seams. lolBut I like it a lot anyway.
I inflated this item and it had a leak, tried to patch, didn't work.  Did not get even 1 day of use out of it!
I've been using these floats for 15 years. They're my favorites!  Perfect for floating in the pool and easy to store.
First floatie that is a great length (plenty of extra room and I am 5' 8") and I am not hanging over the edges width wise. If I need to get new floaties I would buy this again
This is a great pool float.  Floats very well.  It's big enough for an adult to use comfortably.  It folds up a lot easier when deflated then others too.  Great for taking with you!
I received product very quickly as always thru amazon. I have enjoyed using it and would recommend it. It is light weight and rolls up for easy storage or mobility.

This is a great float if you don't mind getting wet/being in the water a bit while laying on it. It's not going to keep you completely out of the water because it's thinner. It is comfortable and I like it though. I probably wouldn't if I were swimming in a colder area (we're in Maryland, but I used to live in NH and I think I'd prefer a float up there that keeps me more out of the water).
LOVE these rafts! best pool purchase ever.  cannot beat these for floating and are extremely comfortable.  perfect product, good price
This raft worked great for us! We actually took it to Punta Cana on vacation with us.  When we left, we gave it to one of the workers there and he was thrilled with it!
Exactly what I'd hoped it would be.  Easy to get on and off.  Easy to roll up and carry around

UPDATE - First float was replaced by vendor at no charge as it would not hold air. The second one lasted longer but after using twice, also developed a leak. Threw away and gave up - bought a better float..
summary: Started leaking after minimal use - second with same problem

reviewText: This is the best float ever. I bought it 3 years ago and pack it up after each summer lake/pool experiences. Everyone loves it so much that we continuously stop at the same store I bought it at in search of another one, but no luck. I paid $6.99 for it in a shop close to Dale Hollow Lake on the TN side. It's very wide and sinks enough that you stay cool from the water. Highly recommend. Just buy more than one. :)

Cheap product!  Within two days of use it started to loose air where I found a pin size hole and is now no longer useable.  You could buy the same product (also made in china) at local stores for 1/4 the price. I would not recommend this product.

Many people complain that products like this get holes really fast. This is true of ANY inexpensive raft product. I have had pools all my life and typically rafts that are inexpensive and inflatable last for one pool season. They tend to need to be replace every year. That being said, so far these rafts are holding up just fine for me. I LOVE that the pillow inflates separately so you can change it based on your comfort preference. If you want a raft that is comfortable to lay on and keeps you cool by keeping you partially submerged this is the raft for you! Many rafts are designed with back rests or in a way that makes them only comfortable to lay on on your back. I wanted a raft that i could lay comfortably on my back or flip over and lay on my stomach. This accomplished that perfectly. The only complaint I have is that when ordering, they do not allow you to select which color you want. They just randomly sent me two colors. I was fine with the ones I got, but it just seems silly that you don't get the option to select your color.
Great pool float for anyone who likes to be in the water while sunning. You are partially in the water when laying on the raft, but still able to get sun.
A very colorful float that is light weight but really does the job.  Holds air very well also.  Not flimsy...good guality for the price.

I love this floatie...extra wide on my 2X womens size...it is BIG ENOUGH for even ME!!! Just a "little' of the body stays is in water which keeps me cool while my top tans...then I turn over on my stomach and the back gets tanned...GREAT!! Plus SOOOOO easy to get rolled up and stored in the pool shed!!!  YAY...WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!
summary: PERFECT FOR TANNING, yet keeps you COOL, COOL, COOL!!

reviewText: These pool floats are the best design by far. Wide enough that it's easy to climb off and on in the deepest water, extremely stable in operation. All around a great product. Unfortunately, like all of these plastic floats they eventually spring a leak and are very difficult to repair. The provided repair kits are practically useless. But great while it lasts.
Surprised at how much we liked it! It was huge and my 230 lb husband did not sink it! Will buy another next summer so we each have one

Bought 3 of these for the pool and they are very well made and best part is WIDE. You should have an inflater though to fill these. Love the way they roll up even when inflated unlike others that are stiff. They are thin but this allows water to enter the top of raft for cooling and roll up for storage without deflating.
summary: Best pool raft for the money.

reviewText: First, the colors I received were neon pink and neon yellow, I thought I ordered  blue as shown.  I did not notice the ( colors may vary) and I would think they would give you a color palate so you might see what colors you could receive.  Now, I bought 2 tote-n-float wave mats and the Pink one is fine, the Yellow one will not hold air, it has a slow leak.  So I guess I was disappointed in the color, but really disappointed that a brand new product is defective.  :(

I bought one last year that got damaged in a storm. It was the first thing I bought this year, and I got 2 this time. It is the most comfortable float I ever had. It's like a hammock, like lying on a cloud in the pool. It works for lying face up or down. Can read comfortably. Partially submerged in the water. Easy to climb on. Warning - pretty easy to fall asleep on, which for me is not a bad thing.
this pattern of mattress make it very hard to inflate. Not a good choose for travel. Does not hold large adult very well.
summary: very hard to inflate, even for adults!

reviewText: The mat is ok, but it is so flat that it doesn't really raise you above the water.  Its also very hard to blow up.

I camp out a lot and needed something lightweight and portable and not nearly as thick and heavy as an air mattress, but more comfortable on an aging back than a self-inflater or a foam pad.It's not terribly easy to inflate or deflate based on the way the cells link together, but comfort is outstanding and width is greater than with a pint sized mat (29 vs. 20 inches, and that nine inches makes a great difference). I wish it was sold AS an outdoor mattress and had a quick release valve, but it's a small price to pay for light weight, portability and comfort. If it were sold as an outdoor mat, I suspect color variations and a quick release would make their way onto the product. After all, neon pink raises some eyebrows as it rides with my bed kit on the back of my kayak, but for the comfort, it can't be beaten. Maybe the next one will end up being blue when it comes in...
summary: A different use for a terrific product

reviewText: Wonderful float for wonderful price.  I loved laying in the float in the pool because I was able to keep slightly wet in the hot sun!  Can't wait to use it again next year.  Only con, I bought a beautiful bright yellow float and the sun quickly turned it into a light yellow color.  Oh well, other than that, I am extremely happy with my purchase!
Perfect for floating in the pool - it is wide enough to hold the largest men in our family and floats low in the water so that you can stay cool.
Great simple raft for a great price easy to bring with u doesn't take up a lot of room or take a long time to inflate.
summary: Great raft great price easy to roll up and carry!

reviewText: Great raft. a little hard to blow up but really not too bad. It floats nicely. and its nice and wide.
Wonderful raft!

The only reason these rafts don't get 5 stars from me, is that these rafts are impossible to blow up with just your mouth. I bought 4, and could only get the first two halfway inflated. Luckily I have an electronic pump for a kayak that did the job quite well.Besides that, good price, pretty durable. People who stay over have used them as mattresses as well and said it was comfy enough.
summary: Warning, impossible to blow up without aid

reviewText: Bought two. The first one split at the seam after 3 weeks. Second one still going strong. really like the size and comfort. 6'2" weigh 260. Fits me great.

Got it to go under sleeping bag. Once inflated it is smaller. So I measured it for you. This  $10 matt plus a Coleman oak point sleeping bag for  $40 can even make a tile floor comfortable to sleep on!
These Intex Float Wave Mats are quality mats.  We have gotten a lot of use from them.  Seem to be sturdy built and are comfortable to be on.

This float surpassed my expectations.  Wide and long enough for my 6ft. 2 inch husband and thin enough so that you can easily glide on the water while paddling your hands.  Would buy again and again.  Mine came and it was yellow, so be aware that colors vary.
Love this mat... It's perfect in the pool!
This is great to put under the sheets to sleep on.........on any trip......great on the boat on the bed and to float in the water........
summary: I used this on a 50ft sailboat to sleep on and in the water as a float.  Great

reviewText: I had a fload very similar to this one from Walmart, it busted. So I purchased this one after searching high and low around my town for a replacement. This float is great because you lay right on the water, it's wide and blows up quickly. I dont like those thick air mattress type floats. Mine was green and it took a while to arrive but I was very satisfied with my float.
I love this float.  It's nice and wide so it's comfortable to lay on without feeling like you are going to fall off. I also like that it is close to the water so you can stay cool while sunbathing.

My sister and I both purchased this float and LOVE IT!! It gives you the perfect amount of water to sun ration while tnaning ;)I just came back to order another one and saw the price doubled though :(
summary: Best float so far for tanning :)

reviewText: I have owned two of these now. Both developed leaks very soon after purchase. The first one I wrote off to possibly the kids jumped on it and patched it as best I could. Worked ok for rest of last summer but not inflatable this spring and unable to patch again. So I purchased a new one because they are very comfortable. My second one arrived and I made sure I was the only one on it. I in fact hid it from the kids so they wouldn't use it. I used it twice and it developed a leak in same area around border seam. This one is being returned and I won't purchase again. To bad it is so poorly made because it really is a comfortable float. That is the only reason I gave two stars. If you happen to purchase one that doesn't leak, you will probably like it.

I got this because sometimes I like to lay flat in the water.  We have a similar one to this but with that one you stay pretty dry.  This one is great if you want to float, but also be in a little bit of water.  I find it very comfortable and relaxing.  We haven't had it that long so I can't speak for quality, but so far it's been perfect!
Bought this for Nuru massage purposes.  Popped within three uses.  No patches or repair kits included.  Wish I had spent a little more and bought one with thicker plastic.
summary: You get what you pay for...

reviewText: I've had quite a few floats over the years and this is the best one yet. It rolls up for carrying or if u need to, you can deflate. Doesn't take much to blow it up. It rides low in the water so you're IN the water somewhat, rather than riding atop the water like those other blow up floats.
It is perfect for floating in the pool and bright orange color that I love, well worth the money, thank you..

I bought this at the end of last summer and never had the opportunity to use it. I got it out last week (still taped and secured in the box from the manufacturer). Blew it up, used it in the pool twice -- the second time we went to use it we found that it has TWO large leaks along the seam lines! Save your money!
This is a float that can take some punishment. Kids jumping on it won't pop the seams and if taken care of will last for years! i bought my firston 2 years ago and I still use it.
I like the mat, but it took me 20 minutes to inflate. Small air hole that you can't hold open for better airflow.

this raft is flimsy and cheaply made. i inflated it and it already had a seam hole. i used the enclosed patch and it did not work. also the color faded within 2 days! i would give this 0 stars if i had the ability to do so.

We bought 3 different types of floats for the pool. This one is great for hot days when you want to lounge flat and still feel a little bit of the water. Doesn't keep you totally dry, but that's the point! Great length for tall people and nice width too! Also love the little pillow to rest your head on.
summary: love this float for summer! Very comfortable

reviewText: My husband bought this for himself, and he likes it a lot.  It floats nicely and it's very comfortable and relaxing.
Product arrived in reasonable time. I really like that it can be rolled up and stored in a closet or tucked away in a corner. This is how these things should have been made from the start.
Not a great buy.  Water sips right into the grooves as you sit in the pool.  May make great sleeping mattress.
These mats are very hard to find. They came quickly, and holds up so great. I have a little dog that loves to swim, and she uses this mat.
This float is very easy to inflate and i just loved it. The price is very good i have had good luck with it.

the float was durable and after filling it up with air once, only needed an occasional 're-fill' over the whole summer.  the wave design is really cool and makes floating in the pool a lot of fun as you are in and out of the water at the same time!  the pillow is great and width/length hold me (260lb - 6ft guy)...  recommend this over some of the cheaper floats which i also purchased and deflated every single day!

I normally buy those cheap 3dollar floats as i have kids and company which tends to destroy everything.  i love this float and it keeps you in the water when you lay on it.  It's also wider than most which makes you feel as though you wont fall off easily.  love it , love itIt appears so far very durable as well.  good investment for those who like to float!
The raft will barely hold up my 30 lb granddaughter much less an adult. This was a complete waste of money.
great quality.  I was hoping for blue but received green.  That's ok, green looks fine and I love floating on it.

Most sleeping bag pads are either paper thin foam OR big bulky blow up mattresses OR very expensive auto blowup thin padsTHESE 2 inch thick mattresses blow up reasonably stiff, are not huge bulky things are cheap and very comfortable and are quite large for their bulk.  Much larger than any sleeping bag.  I was amazed at how well they supported my 6ft 250lb frame.  and the pillow is an added bonus.EXCELLENT value in sleeping bag pads
summary: I got for sleeping bag padding and for that purpose these are excellent

reviewText: use this to add some padding at a hotel I stay at frequently for work.  the beds are hard as rocks and this pad cushions the pressure points nicely.  I specifically wanted a pad with the channels to allow air flow as solid surface pads don't breath and are unbearably hot.  I'll use it 100 times this year so when it wears out I'll buy another since it was so inexpensive.
summary: great for under sheets on a hard bed

reviewText: The description said color may be different I did not read that part until I received aa red one while I was waiting a blue one like the picture, because of that I gave it to another person, the complain babout it was how difficult is to fill it up, if you already haave one you understand me if not I recommend you not to try it.
summary: Color sucks, difficult to fill it up!

reviewText: This float is not made very well.  When it arrived I filled it with air.  Took it to the pool where it went flat.  Leaked at one of the many seams.  Tried too patch it with  patch that came with the float.  It did not hold.  Went to Wal-Mart and bought a cheaper float that was made better.  I would not waste my money on this float.  How ever, it has great design in that it will roll up too save space.
This large mat is nice to stretch out on, and the wave pattern keeps a low enough profile that you can let some water on to the mat to cool down.

This is absolutely - by far - my favorite pool float....If it would hold air for longer than one day, I'd certainly like it more. It's a love-hate thing with this float, really. I'd still recommend it because it is SO COMFORTABLE. But, blowing it up before and during every use becomes frustrating.
Very nice, my favorite thing about this is that it rolls up for small storage areas. When I purchased it, I wasn't sure if it were true, but it is.  I love it.

First of all I used an electric inflator to blow it up so that wasn't a problem.  I've had it for 2 weeks and so far they have kept the air in.When I first pulled the raft out of the box I wasn't very impressed.  I used it that day in the pool and I have to say that it was extremely comfortable.  It is really wide and you just sink right into it but still stay afloat.  I love this raft.Now we have found another use.  With the storms coming we have to leave one car outside b/c we only have a two car garage.  My husband took 2 of these rafts and put them over his car and then covered it with a car cover.  We are hoping that they will soften the blow of a hail storm if we happen to get one.  If the hail destroys the rafts but keeps the cars safe then it is $11.50 well spent.  I just ordered 2 more in case this happens.  He said that the rafts fit perfectly over the car b/c they are so wide.  He said that he really needs 3 instead of 2 so another reason we ordered more.  I hope these stay in stock:)I also have the large Intex lounger that keeps you completely dry so I use that one first and switch to this one when I get too hot.  It's a great combination.So far it has been great and I would highly recommend.
I bought this for my daughter as a gift.  They are hard to find in the store so I was glad to find it online.  It was just what she wanted.

Quick and easy to blow up and very comfortable to lie on and relax in the pool! I have been looking for a float that I can lie on my stomach on as well as my back and after buying the really expensive ones that had a small pillow, I'm now planning on sticking with these. Love it for the price and the use!
EXCELLENT SIZE easy to get on and get off of, and surprisingly good construction and feel. Much better than the normal faire at the local big box stores.
Easy to store on the boat.  Easy to inflate.  Fun to have to splash around in the lake.  Inexpensive.  I will buy a couple more.
These were great for the price.  They dont hold you out of the water completely so you dont fry in the sun. Its nice because youre still in the water.
It's too narrow to get comfortable on while laying in the pool. It's okay for kids but not very sturdy. Spend a bit more and get a better one if you have a pool and use rafts often.
summary: Not a good raft for adults

reviewText: These worked great in the apt. pool.  We weren't supposed to take "floats" in but these were allowed.  They were larger than ones found at Wal-Mart and everyone was curious and envious.  Not to mention they didn't cost much more than Wal-Mart's!

It floats very well. Very light and small when folded.  It doesn't require too much air which is good.  It's super quick and easy to pump air in by mouth/hand pump or elec pump.  The pain is when we're trying to take air out.  Simply rolling in doesn't do the job.  Multiple people cooperation is needed to get all the air out.  Or if you're doing it by your self, be ready to be frustrated.  My husband swore to never used it again as he got frustrated trying to get air out.
summary: Quick and easy to air in, pain in the butt to take air out

reviewText: Ok, So I missed the part where it says colors may very. Thought I was ordering a blue and ended up with a pink. Perhaps a picture of multiple colored items would be appropriate.. Bummer....

This wave mat is very nice.  It's awkward to get on or move on but otherwise is comfortable.  Half of my body is under the water while on the mat which helps keep me cool.  The disadvantage is that I couldn't pick what color I got.  Lime green really doesn't look great in my pool.
This is a very good deal and a very nice floatie. I would recommend this over the cheap ones found everywhere.

Pros:*Super Comfortable.  Long and wide.  You won't fall off as with standard "puny" floats that aren't very stable. Superior comfort compared to flat foam mattresses.  Especially good for men given the larger dimensions of this float.*Stability.  Lay not just on your back (as with most mattresses) but your stomach, on your side, or straddle it to sit up straight.*Portability.  Rolls up compactly (fully inflated) making it super easy to transport, even strapped to my bike.  None of that inflate/deflate/reflate stuff for me! Inflate once, roll it up and rock on.*Keep Cool.  Unlike "fat" air mattresses that sit on top of/out of the water, this mattress is partially submerged and keeps you cool.*Affordable.  'Nuf said.*Vibrant 80's Colors.  Turquoise, pink, green, yellow. All day glow neon.  You never know what color you're going to get, but they are all nice.*Deceptively Simple.  The best designs are.*Versatility.  Doubles great as a camping mattress. I've spent major bucks in the past on fancy camping pads and I have to say they don't hold a candle to the comfort of this $10 air mattress due to its length and width.  Great support with the wavy air chambers give comparable support as eggshell/memory foam mattress toppers on a conventional mattress. Sleep on it at night in your tent, then throw it in the lake during the day to work on your tan. Excellent as a butt pad during outdoor concerts or movies. Put it under a black light with a mirror ball and instant disco! Also great for impromptu guests crashing on your living room floor. I use it just as much for these activities as in the pool.Cons:*Durability.  As previous reviews mention, "duds" are a reality due to the "made in China" consequence.  Sometimes the seams split easily; sometimes the seams are sealed wrong so you have difficulty inflating it.  I've had a single one last 3 years, and I've also gone through 3 in a single summer season due to manufacturing defects. Granted, I'm a heavy user for multiple purposes, but I do wish the quality of the product was improved to be more reliable (hint hint: bring manufacturing back to America!)  Replacement frequency is high; I go through about three every year.*Getting your friends to give it back once they have discovered its awesomeness.All things considered though, the pros outweigh the durability issue.  I truly love this mattress for its comfort and versatility and haven't even considered using anything else the past ten years.
summary: Are you a pool floatie connoisseur?  This one's for you.

reviewText: This arrived with a hole in it!  It is not worth my time or money to pack it up and mail it back.In the future, a product like this will be purchased from a local retail store.

This float was purchased to be a 'floating cover' as required by central Texas laws in regards to having 25% of your pool covered.  This float does not stay in the pool on even mildly windy days so I do not recommend it for that purpose.  Additionally I got the orange one which faded within the first week and now after a few more weeks looks absolutely pitiful.I have to put air into it every couple of weeks too.The kids do enjoy this one a lot because it allows their body's to dip into the water while relaxing on it.
wide enough while floating that you feel steady on it floating in the pool. easy to roll up for storage even inflated.
I only like the floaties that can be rolled up and don't tip over. This one is SO easy to get on for sunbathing.  I love it.  It fills up quickly and to me is just the perfect floatie.  Thank you.

I love this raft.  It is wider and longer than others I have plus, it allows you to sit in the water enough to still stay cool yet be able to tan at the same time.  Several of us have used it ranging from 130lbs to 235lbs.  Worked great for all of us.

This is the best matt/pool float.. You can easily roll it up and take it home from the pool... pretty durable.. Second year with one and the first year with another... Looking to buy the 3rd, and 4th, for back ups.  also.. it is very easy to get up on in pool, a matt finish makes it not as slippery as other floats.

inflATE your inflateable things without blowing one particle in and still getting excellent results! Got a Nintendo Game Throne(tm) but don't want to put up with heavy breathing? Quick Fill Elec Pump will do that super fast! Tube just bought or low on air? Quick Fill will get you pack in the water on that now inflated inner tube! LOVE THIS ITEM, BABY!
summary: This is a very handy item!

reviewText: This is the best float. Not only is it longer and wider but it is extremely comfortable.
These rafts are easy to blow up and easily support the weight of adults.  We used them in the pool and in the ocean on a recent trip.  The price was great too.

We have 2 VERY large inflatable pools (Intex) and this pump makes short work of getting them up and running.  We have the family pool and I was able to get it up and ready to fill in about 10 minutes, and deflating was just about as fast.The noise is a bit high pitched, so much so that my son ran indoors!  But I can stand it if it means my not huffing and puffing for hours!

I bought this pump elsewhere for 1/3 less - BUT it is STILL a bargain at the Amazon/TRU price!  Works quickly, safely, and it is only as loud as a household vacuum.  Highly recommend for pools, mattresses, ball pits, etc.
summary: WONDERFUL  air pump - well worth the money!

reviewText: After using it about 5 times it blew up.  All kinds of rattling parts inside.  Not having much luck with the manufacturer either.  Must have been a manufacturing defect...

The world should not know what a great float this is. Well reviewed item, almost hate to share this secret wonder in case they raise the price, it sells out, I can't get another one, or they sell out to a manufacturer that makes it different. So I'm ordering a couple more. Here's the bad news though: wherever I take this float/raft every one wants to use it, or when I go to use it someone is already on it. I make them get off of it, because it's mine and I don't want to use any other float. This float makes me mean and selfish.Due the wave design it isn't like the annoying tubular designs, it almost acts like a floating blanket! It moves with my body better, it's easier to get up into when you're already in the water with it, and it's good and big sized. Since it's a bit thinner than the regular tubular design floats it will let you be wetter, allows you to be sort of more submerged in spots if you want, or if you lay still and centered it keeps you out of the water (depending how much you weigh I suppose). Also, I throw a towel over it and nap like a baby on the beach.The original one I bought has gotten a couple leaks, near the seam which I would think is the product's fault. However, it repaired easily with the included patch. I love this float!!! Everyone should have one... then I will never have to share mine!

As much fun as the ones I had growing up. My brothers and I would play this for hours. These are not quite the quality of the older ones, and they don't come with the styrofoam balls anymore. But still built pretty well.
summary: As much fun as the ones I had growing up

reviewText: If you have ANYTHING in your house that requires inflating - a swimming pool, an air mattress, an inflatable chair or table (don't laugh!) - then you absolutely MUST have this pump.  I cannot describe in words how much time and energy this little baby will save you!  I agree with the other reviewers that is a  little on the noisy side (my kids were afraid of it at first also, but they are used to it now and always ask me if they can push the button), but believe me - that is a SMALL price to pay!  What would normally take HOURS (and leave you gasping for air and ready to pass out!) now takes only a few minutes.I gave it a 5 for fun, because there is nothing more entertaining that watching your inflatable object fill up while you sit by and do nothing.It comes with a reverse mode - all you have to do is connect the hose to the other side of the pump for "sucking" instead of "blowing" action.  This makes it possible to deflate your item just as quickly.  It also comes with 2 different sized nozzles so it will fit just about anything.Overall, this is a great tool; it's small, easy to use, and most importantly will save your lungs from collapsing!

I couldn't believe I found this game. I used to play it as a kid. It is exactly as I remembered it. Bought it for my kids to have something to play outside and get out of the house. At first they didn't like it because it was not what they were used to but after a while they played for hours. They even played in the rain. This was the best $10 I ever spent!! I posted a picture of them on Facebook, and now some of my friends bought a set for their kids because they said it brought back good memories!

I had been talking about how I enjoyed this product growing up.  When my daughters birthday came up, I couldn't refuse getting her a Trac Ball.  Once it arrived, it was quickly enjoyed.  Although we haven't mastered the unique catching and throwing yet, it is great fun to play.  Great purchase!

Our game friends wanted to add this game to their game pantry, so we made this purchase on their behalf, and we have had no personal experience with product, but our friends have made no negative comments about it to date, so we hope they are having fun with it as they expected. Blessings.
Bought this for our 10 year old, but everyone enjoys playing it.  Brings back memories of lazy warm evenings of summer!

We bought this for a large family reunion and everyone enjoyed playing with it---from the youngest to the oldest.  Well made, nothing broke or fell apart even after a week of hard use, and it was easy to use.  Great fun!

My dad and I used to play Tracball when I was growing up, and our favorite time with Tracball was always at the beach!  My dad and made up a sort of "dareball", where we'd both go into the ocean and throw the ball to the other at a slight angle, so that he'd have to reach or even slightly move closer to the incoming waves.  And for a bit of extra devious fun, we'd often time it so that the catch would be required just a second or two before a wave was to come crashing down :DPenalty for missing?  The ball would get carried to shore, so it was kinda like Chutes and Ladders where the losing party would have to swim + trudge back to shore (or wait for a kindly stranger to throw the ball back out :D)So what makes Tracball so much fun?  Well, the rackets are pretty durable, the balls float, and the game supports beginners as well as more advanced players (who can come up with umpteen ways to have the balls curve to the side and even do last-minute dips).  My dad and I also had fun trying to catch and throw with our non-dominant hands, or throw the ball while facing away from each other, and so on.  Endless varieties, and in the end, lots of laughs and a ton of burned calories.Downsides?  Beware of ball-eating trees, since you can throw the balls pretty high.  Oh, and -- while I thankfully never experienced this -- watch out for excited retriever dogs who could likely crunch the hollow plastic balls into oblivion.  Only other downside I can think of is that you'll have everyone else on the beach jealous and wanting to play with your toy.  This thing is that much fun!
summary: Neverending fun and darn good exercise!

reviewText: I bought this for my 8 year old son last year for his birthday, and it's been a ton of fun.  First, I had my first trac ball set in the early to mid 80s so I never experienced the styrofoam balls some are discussing.  So, while the balls from my old set looked very similar - textured, hollow yellow plastic - they weighed quite a bit less than these modern versions.The hardest part to get across to my kids is that you need to be pretty agressive in putting spin on the ball in order for it to curve or "float".  But my kids love it and I still find it a ton of fun.  THe quality seems pretty much the same as the old set, which is nice to see.  The "raquets" are plastic and it would be pretty easy to break them if you don't take care of them.On a side note:  this goes back a few years, but did any other Trac Ball fans notice a raquet (painted silver) in The Phantom Menace - hanging in the shop on Tattooine where Anakin worked?  I think that says something about the thought and imagination that went into TPM, but I'll leave it at that.
summary: A bit different from the old days, but still great

reviewText: I love my Trac ball set.  We have a league of like 10 guys that get out and play an aggressive version of catch with these. we end up pelting each other and leaving with welts. these go fast and can be fun for us 30 somethings and not just kids.

I bought 3 sets.  I remember this from when I was a kid 30 years ago and so far my kids enjoy them as much as I did (ok, so I still do too!).  If you haven't tried these before, you should.  It's pretty easy to throw the ball well with these and even easier to catch it.  You can do some fancy stuff with the ball too as you get better.  This totally brought back part of my childhood!
summary: Great game!  Just like when I was a kid!

reviewText: Had this game as a kid in the 80s and played it all the time. My daughters and her friends love it as well. Fun to play for all ages.
summary: Trac Ball is timeless and a blast to play at any age.

reviewText: Great game that has been around forever, and can be played by adults, kids, and athletically challenged alike.You can get knock-offs but there's nothing like the original.  Price was decent, and it comes with 2 balls.
Just as a I remember it as a kid! This was a great purchase! I ordered two sets and will probably order another.
Sturdy set for the money. Wish the rackets were a little larger, but that is my only negative. Good value.

I had trackball when I was a kid growing up and the entire time that I had the game I never once met another kid who had it too. I always thought that was a little strange because it was such a great game.Well, now I've grown and I've got two daughters of my own. Over the last couple of years I've tried in vain to find a game that we can play outdoors. My daughters are only nine and seven and so finding something that they can do, that they have the coordination for, can be a little tough. Baseball was encouraging until one of them got hit with the ball. Frisbee was fun, but the seven-year-old could never quite throw it very well. Then I remembered how much I loved trackball when I was a boy. To be honest I wasn't really sure they would be able to get the wrist motion down that you need to play the game well.Boy was I surprised on Christmas.It took them about 15 or 20 minutes to really get down within they were off to the races. We were throwing the ball back and forth about 60 yards apart for a good hour. I can honestly say it was the most fun I've ever had playing outside with my daughters. My youngest got hit with the ball three times, cried all three times, and yet still wanted to continue playing. She actually said to me, "even if I get hurt I'm not going to quit playing."It would be a great game at twice the price. Santa actually brought two sets for Christmas so that we would have enough rackets for the entire family.
summary: Finally!  A game I can play with my daughters!

reviewText: Karl-Frederich Beringer's work with the Windsbächer Knabenchor is nothing short of miraculous. Although the music of Johann Sebastian Bach hardly needs any aid in attesting to its own greatness, surely the composer must feel a tinge of pride every time the Windsbächers give one of his choral masterpieces in their trademark brilliant, immaculate style.Here, Beringer gives us Bach's joyous Magnificat in D and three of the Six Motets.The Magnificat is presented in a festive, rousing performance that fully captures the unmitigated joy of the piece while spotlighting the choir's incredibly clean, forceful technique. In the opening chorus, following the flowing orchestral prelude, the choir nearly explodes on listeners, crying over and over, "Magnificat, magnificat, anima mea Dominum." Beringer takes the tempo moderately, eschewing the heavy-handed solemnity of Karl Richter but also avoiding the quasi-comical, strangled sibilances of Paul McCreesh's breakneck speeds in his own take on the Magnificat.Soloists are good--competent and involved in the music. The real stars of this disc (and any Windsbächer recording), however, are the boys themselves. You simply must HEAR the Windsbächers to fully appreciate how amazing their technique is, especially for a choir of younger children. TheirMass in B Minoris a triumphant example of their particular brand of audible perfection.In the Magnificat, the choir covers an impressive amount of emotional ground, from the restless tread of the "Omnes generationes" through the inexpressibly haunting beauty of the "Suscepit Israel," which sounds as though it's fresh off the next release from the U.K. group Libera. The concluding Doxology is a majestic peroration on the glory of the Trinity, showcasing the choir's magnificent ability to really pull out all the stops, dynamically, while still retaining their immaculately clean intonation and technique.But the Magnificat is only half of the disc. For the remainder, the Windsbächers give three of Bach's Six Motets: "Komm, Jesu, Komm," "Singet dem Herrn ein neues Lied," and the well-known "Jesu, Meine Freude."The doppelchor ("double choir") arrangement for "Komm, Jesu, Komm" is presented with moving clarity, as the choir's two halves call to each other repeatedly, "Come, Jesus!" / "Come, Jesus!" The sunlight of the chorus "Singet dem Herrn ein neues Lied" is given an exciting performance here, but "Jesu Meine Freude" is in a class by itself--there is perhaps only one recording with a knabenchor better than this one: the Windsbächers' disc of the Motets, complete.The Motets are accompanied by the Prager Kammerorchester, which will be a problem for some who prefer to hear the pieces a cappella. Those who do have this preference needn't worry, however: the Windsbächers also offer (but not available on Amazon, unfortunately) a disc of all six motets unaccompanied--despite the beautiful performances here, I personally prefer the unaccompanied complete disc to the three offered here.Nonetheless, the Windsbächers offer yet another stunningly beautiful set of Bach performances for our enjoyment. If anything captures the true spirit of Bach's intentions in his music--to glorify God and refresh the spirit--it is certainly this disc...and all of the Windsbächers' Bach recordings in general. These kids are simply amazing. Hear and be moved.
summary: Sing to the Lord a new song...

reviewText: My family love these. We had to buy some extra sets so everyone could play. We take them to the beach where there is plenty of room.

Product arrived quickly and was exactly what my son wanted.  He has played with this trac ball game at school and they aren't the most durable but they are really fun.  As soon as we knew it was the same set we ordered a second set.
I paid Amazon $16.57 for this game and there is a price sticker on the front of the box that says Biggs Sporting Goods $9.99.Why did I pay $16.57 when the price says $9.99!!!
summary: Sticker price is way less than I paid!

reviewText: My nephews and I love it! All the kids at our family party wanted to try it.Takes practice to get the hang of it. lots of fun...
Had a Wham-O Trac Ball when I was a kid; and now, as an adult, am enjoying it just as much with my kids!
Quick shipping and tons of fun and brings back memories of my childhood!  I highly recommend as a great way for summer fun.

This game is great to be played anywhere especially on the beach.  It's really a lot of fun.  I bought 2 sets so four people could play or have teams.  Great exercise.  You won't be disappointed.  The price is great.  Thanks Amazon. ..It's' really a lot of fun...

Two rackets broke within days of light use. So I do not recommend this product due to the build quality. It's kind of sad, since I had these as a kid and they were built much better and lasted a long time. They are lots of fun otherwise.
This game was fun 25 years ago....still is. Didnt think they still sold it soI gave it a shot. Glad I did.

Trac Ball is just as much fun today as you remember it as a kid.While growing up my friends and I developed dozens of Trac Ball related games. Some were like LaCrosse while others were like a stationary version of Hockey (two people and two goals). We developed new techniques for putting spin on the ball and created ball flights that seemed to defy the laws of physics.It is now 20 years later and I have found that my wife and I still enjoy Trac Ball as a way to get some exercise. Unlike baseball or football it is easy to play catch with Trac Ball and not worry about giving your significant other a black eye!Pros -- Easy to learn- Maintains its "fun" by the number of ways you can learn to curve the ball.- Very easy to "invent" games- Safe - the ball is lightweight plastic- Fun for all ages - I have been playing since I was about 5 years old- Everything is plastic so it is completely water proof... fun for the beach, unless the ball floats away in the water.Final tally - 5 stars
summary: One of the best backyard games ever invented

reviewText: This scoop, with modification with a heat gun, is used for Whirlyball. Note that the balls in this game are different than those used in Whirlyball.

My 48 year old brother and I are "just a little" out of the market demographics for this but we love it!  My brother has an old Wham-O trac ball game that has a broken handle so I got him this for his birthday.  It is much better than the cheap ones at local retailers (like Walmart).  The balls are heavy plastic (it comes with two) and the handles are good quality.  You can throw it 75 to 100 feet pretty easily.  We have used his old one on the beach and the balls are heavy enough to handle a fairly strong wind.  You can get a good curve on the flight path if you use a lot of wrist.  The only problem with this was we had to let our 11 year old sons play.  Guess I should have bought two sets!  You do need to pay attention when playing this since the balls can do some damage if they hit you in the face.  Probably not good for younger kids.  Highly recommended for "kids" from 10 to 50+.
This is exactly what I was looking forgreat value, love the productLots of fun to play with friends
summary: Exactly what I was looking for

reviewText: Need to buy more, but only because more of us want to play. This is a great set, thank you.
summary: Nicely built and a ton of fun.

reviewText: We found this game again when we stayed at our cousins beach house. As soon as we got back home my husband looked it up online and bought it. We really have enjoyed this game, and I now have to buy another set because my three year old won't let me have a turn anymore. I have enjoyed playing catch this much in years. We are trying to convince all our friends to buy sets so we can play "ultimate tracball"!

Keep the box for safe keeping and prevent damage to your product.  They are kind of fragile and could bend or crack under weight so I wouldn't recommend keeping in a car that you would throw junk into!
family loves this game in the water and on the beach

The whole family loves to play with this Trac ball set. It is a bit of a challenge for the 7 year old, but his 9 year old brother has it down. All the adults play until they are tired and need a rest. This gift was a perfect gift for the whole family.
Bought to put in the RV for camping toys, but use it in the yard often.  May need to buy a second set.  That ball flies and curves like no bodies business!
summary: Just like when I was a kid

reviewText: Love Love Love this game.  Had it as a kid growing up.  Bought 2 sets for our family to enjoy in the summer evenings.  Kids caught on quick and were impressed with my wham-o serve skills.  Great family fun for all.  You need a nice size area to play this game in.
I love this game and its even more fun with 4 people.  Great product.  Surprised no one has hurt them selves with it and got it banned:)
We had these when I was a child(30+ years ago). They are great camping fun and they are just as I remember them. Great buy!
Had this game as a kid and i loved it. so i bought for my daughters. great game for the outdoors whether your a boy or girl.
An absolute classic! I played TracBall as a kid and now I got to introduce it a new generation and they loved it.  I didn't realize they still make this.  I'm so glad I found it again!  A++++++!!!
Bought this for my Grandchildren,  they just love it,  great for beach, back yard.  Great for adults also, keeps everbody happyyoung and old

I bought this to use at our camp when we had visitors and the 2 kids played with it for a long time. Boy 10 and girl 8 (brother & sister)had no trouble using it as they were familiar with it. Good for older adults too! And it kept them busy and entertained-- even on a blustery day that ruled out a boat ride. Good exercise but more importantly -- it's fun!
my kids love these rackets. we just took them on vacation and they played with them for hours along with every one else.

My brother and I owned a set back in the mid-70s and have kept it all these years. With a growing family I was delighted to find that they were still in production.Great fun and easy to learn with a little practice.It would have been 5-stars, but it no longer comes with the Styrofoam beginners' ball.

reviewerName: Duncan Idaho "Spend time with your kids.  It ...
reviewText: I had this set as a kid and loved it.  Once I had children old enough, I wanted to purchase a set for them to play with.  I am so glad I did.  It has been a blast teaching them how to curve the ball and how to throw in general.  We can play for hours.  They are great for park outings with your family or with any group you may belong to.  We take them to our scout picnics and this is always a hit.  We have 3 sets so there are plenty to go around.  It does take a little bit of practice to get used to it, but once you have it you are in for a great time.  Just be patient and take the time to try it out before you get frustrated.  If you have a family get this.  It is so nice to have stuff like this to do rather than be stuck inside with the electronics that do not allow for interaction.HAVE FUN!!!
The build quality of this set is good...both the 'rackets' and balls are quite sturdy.  My only complaint: I wish they still included the foam balls that shipped with the original set.
I remember playing with this when I was a kid and it's still just as much fun.  It's easy to catch and easy to throw and you can get wicked curves.  Tons of fun for not much money.

This was a gift for my 7-year old daughter. It's fun, but definitely takes some practice for kids to get the hang of how to throw and catch the ball properly. Heck, even takes practice for the adults! The rackets do have the potential to make the balls go very far, so be prepared! We will get a lot of use out of these, but it will take time to get used to how to really use them properly. I would not recommend this for kids under 7, unless they're super coordinated and athletic.

This is a simple, but fun, game.  It's also very durable.  We bought a similar-looking game (not Wham-o brand) from the 99 cent store and it literally lasted about 30 minutes before both rackets and the ball were all cracked/broke.  So far we haven't had that problem with this Wham-o one.
This is a great way to gets the kids and adults to go outside for exercise.My kids and grandchildren really love Trac Ball.  We are having great fun playing with this racket game.
My grand parents had items like this growing up and they are so much fun. Very easy to use and have around the yard.

These things really fling the ball far.  Because the ball gets a good spin on it from the paddle you can throw it in a slightly different direction than you really want it to go and it will curve gracefully through the air.  Please do note that the ball is hard and fairly weighty and can really hurt you or your child.My best throw ever occurred when my brother and I agreed to stand still and see if we could hit the other person.  Keep in mind we are like 100ft apart so that this was not an easy task.  On my very first throw the ball left the cradle fast and furious with a slight downward slant that then gracefully curved upwards toward his face.  The ball would have literally hit him straight in the face if he hadn't cheated at the last second by ducking.  You can truly do amazing things when you have the right motivation!

This is some of the best gaming action I have had with my kids in a while. I pumped the game up alot before it arrived. They were stolked and fighting for a turn to play. We played until we had to go for a previous commitment. The next day they were ready to go again.Great for eye hand coordination and they learn not to be scared of the ball. It seems to float from one raquet to the other while curving and dipping. The distance is GREAT it gives them time to coordinate the catch.
summary: It's just as much fun as when I was a kid!!!

reviewText: Who thought throwing a plastic ball could be this much fun.  Just like I remembered from 25 years ago.  These "racquets" allow you to throw for a mile!  Risers, sinkers, curves, or just go deep.  Only bummer is that they no longer come with the foam ball that you could curve 20 feet.
This is seriously such a fun game to play at the park.It is easy to use and keeps kids or adults busy for hours!
I was amazed to find that this product was still being made,as I had bought a set in the 70's. It is so much fun for the whole family!!.
Sturdy, well built and fun. I did forget how hard the ball is and my six year olds knuckles got rapped by the ball, but he's OK and still playing with it.
